Menu

Luminia

Deep within the heart of the mountain, a small group of resilient dwarf miners toils tirelessly in the depths of the earth. Their home, Shadowvein hall is a testament to their unwavering dedication to their craft. Carved from the living rock, the hall is adorned with shimmering crystals and veins of precious ore, casting a warm, golden glow. The rhythmic sound of pickaxes echoes through the tunnels as the miners unearth rich veins of silver, gold, and gemstones. In the flickering light of the forges, skilled artisans shape the raw materials into intricate works of art, crafting exquisite jewelry and ornate weapons. Despite the dangers that lurk within the dark tunnels, these stout-hearted dwarves stand united, their camaraderie and resilience forming the bedrock of their enduring legacy.

Lore

A medieval fantasy world. Only one God exists (the god is non-gendered and called "the Old One") but people believes also in local beliefs. No undead. A single big nation (empire) on a unique continent the size of europe.

Keywords: the Old One, unique continent, empire, local beliefs, non-gendered God, forgotten event

World type: Medieval fantasy

Details

anecdotes

Legend has it that the ancient settlers who founded Luminia were deeply connected to the spirits of the forest. They were said to be able to communicate with the creatures of the woods and even control them. According to local beliefs, these settlers were able to tame even the most fearsome beasts of the forest, including the deadly dire wolves that still roam the mountains around Luminia. Some tales even say that the settlers made a pact with the spirits of the wood, promising to protect and tend to the forest in exchange for their help. Today, the people of Luminia still call upon the spirits of the forest for guidance, offering offerings and prayers to ensure their continued protection., The ruins in the ancient forest surrounding Luminia are shrouded in mystery and fear. Local beliefs hold that they are cursed, and that those who enter them rarely return. The villagers of Luminia tell cautionary tales of adventurers who entered the ruins seeking treasure, only to be driven mad or devoured by the spirits that dwell within. Some of the elders claim that the ruins were once a temple dedicated to a non-gendered God, worshipped by the ancient empire that ruled the unique continent long before Luminia was founded. Others whisper of a forgotten event that took place in the ruins, an event so terrible that it caused the spirits of the wood to turn against the empire and destroy it utterly. Whether these tales are true or not, the ruins remain a place of great danger and mystery., The people of Luminia have always been aware that they share their village with more than just their fellow humans. Legends of ghosts and other supernatural beings have circulated in the village for centuries, with each generation adding its own twists and embellishments to the tales. One of the most persistent of these stories is that of the ghostly figure that wanders the streets of Luminia at night. Some say that it is the spirit of a long-dead adventurer, still searching for treasure in the village he loved. Others claim that it is the restless soul of a villager who was wronged and seeks revenge. Whatever the truth of the matter, the villagers take care to avoid the places where the ghostly figure has been seen, lest they meet an untimely end., There are few creatures more fearsome than the dragon, a massive reptilian beast capable of breathing fire and tearing apart entire armies with ease. So when a traveler claimed to have seen a dragon sleeping in the mountains near Luminia, many dismissed it as nothing more than a tall tale. But there were those in the village who believed the traveler's account, and who secretly hoped that the dragon would remain asleep and not come down to lay waste to their homes. For years after the sighting, villagers whispered about the dragon and speculated about its origins and intentions. Some even went so far as to venture into the mountains seeking the dragon, but none returned to tell their tales., The forest that surrounds Luminia is a place of great beauty and great danger. It is a place where travelers can easily become lost, wandering for days without any sign of civilization. So when a young girl was lost in the forest for three days and returned unharmed, claiming to have been guided by a talking rabbit, the villagers were both amazed and frightened. The girl's tale spread quickly throughout the village, with some believing that she had truly encountered a magical creature that had helped her find her way home. Others dismissed it as the fevered imaginings of a child lost in the woods. But regardless of the truth of the matter, the tale of the talking rabbit has become one of the most enduring legends of Luminia., Sometimes, strangers arrive in Luminia with mysterious abilities and powers that seem almost magical. One such stranger arrived in the village one day and cured a woman of a terminal illness with a single touch. The villagers were both awed and frightened by this act, unsure of whether the stranger was a gift from the spirits of the forest or an agent of darker forces. But regardless of their fears, the stranger was welcomed into the village and treated with great respect and hospitality. The villagers hoped that the stranger would remain in Luminia, that they might learn from their wisdom and perhaps even be blessed with more miracles.

Keywords: legend has it that the ancient settlers were able to communicate with the spirits of the forest and even control them, the ruins are said to be cursed, and those who enter rarely return, a ghostly figure can sometimes be seen wandering the streets at night, a traveler once claimed to have seen a dragon sleeping in the mountains, a young girl was once lost in the forest for three days and returned unharmed, claiming she had been guided by a talking rabbit, a mysterious stranger arrived in the village one day and cured a woman of a terminal illness with a single touch

architecture

The ancient ruins in the forest are a source of both fascination and fear for the villagers of Luminia. Once home to an unknown civilization, the ruins remain shrouded in mystery. Scholars believe that they hold the key to understanding the forgotten event that changed the course of the village's history. Locals, on the other hand, tell stories of curses and malevolent spirits that haunt the ruins. Despite the dangers, some adventurous souls still venture into the ruins in the hopes of uncovering their secrets. The ruins are guarded by the spirits of the forest, who will guide those they deem worthy and punish those who disrespect the ancient site. It is said that the ruins emit a strange light at night, leading some to speculate that they are still imbued with magic from a time long past., The temple of the Old One is a place of great reverence for the people of Luminia. The non-gendered God is believed to have created the unique continent upon which the village stands, as well as the ancient forest that surrounds it. The temple itself is a humble structure located on the outskirts of the village, with a single spire reaching towards the sky. It is tended to by a group of devoted scholars and priests, who offer prayers to the Old One at dawn and dusk each day. The temple is also a center for intellectual pursuits, with scholars from all over the continent coming to study the ancient texts housed within its walls. Despite its importance, the temple remains accessible to all who seek solace and guidance from the God of Luminia., The defensive wall surrounding the village has stood for decades, protecting the people of Luminia from threats both human and beastly. Built after an attack by wolves that left several villagers injured, the wall is made from a combination of stone and timber. Guard towers are stationed along its perimeter, each manned by a group of skilled archers. The wall has been put to the test on several occasions, including a bandit invasion three decades ago and sporadic raids by goblin bands from the mountains. Despite these challenges, the wall has never been breached, a testament to the resilience and determination of the people of Luminia., The marketplace in the town square is a hub of activity and commerce in Luminia. Traders from neighboring villages bring their wares to sell, including timber, honey, herbs, fish, wool, pottery, and cheese. Local merchants also set up shop in the square, selling everything from handcrafted jewelry to freshly baked bread. The market is held every other week, and is known for its lively atmosphere and sense of community. It is also a place where rumors and news are exchanged, making it an important source of information for those seeking to learn about external influences on the village., The inn known for its famous honey mead is a popular destination for travelers passing through Luminia. Located at the edge of the village, it offers comfortable rooms and hearty meals to weary adventurers. Its signature drink, honey mead, is brewed on site using honey from the village's apiaries. The innkeeper is a friendly and welcoming host, eager to share stories and advice with his guests. The inn is also a center for information about the surrounding area, with maps and guides available to those seeking to explore the ancient forest or venture into the mountains beyond., The mill along the river that provides flour to the village is a vital resource for the people of Luminia. Powered by the swift currents of the river, the mill produces enough flour to feed the entire village. Its machinery is maintained by a team of skilled craftsmen who take great pride in their work. The mill is also a place of community, with villagers coming together to share news and gossip while waiting for their grain to be processed. Despite its importance, the mill is still vulnerable to the occasional flood or drought, making the villagers ever mindful of the need to maintain their delicate balance with the forces of nature.

Keywords: the ancient ruins in the forest, the temple of the Old One on the outskirts of the village, the defensive wall surrounding the village, the marketplace in the town square, the inn known for its famous honey mead, the mill along the river that provides flour to the village

Global view: A cozy and prosperous village nestled in the heart of a dense ancient forest surrounded by rugged mountains.

Global view detailed: Luminia is a picturesque village that has clearly been designed with both functionality and aesthetic appeal in mind. Timber-framed buildings with stone walls line the streets, their thatched roofs adding to their rustic charm. The houses are painted in earthy colors such as browns, greens, and reds, blending into the surrounding forest. The windows are small and often have shutters, providing insulation during the colder months. The streets are paved with cobblestones, making them sturdy enough to withstand even the harshest weather conditions. The village is also equipped with several wells, ensuring that its inhabitants always have access to fresh water. Overall, Luminia is an idyllic settlement that blends harmoniously with its natural surroundings.

Style: timber-framed, stone walls, thatched roof, small windows, earthy colors, rustic

Sites

the ancient ruins in the forest

The ancient ruins in the forest are a hauntingly beautiful sight. The crumbling remains of what was once a thriving civilization have been overgrown with moss and vines, giving them an unearthly appearance. Strange symbols and carvings cover the walls, hinting at the mystical power that once resided within. Those who venture inside are said to hear whispers and see strange apparitions, leading many to believe that the ruins are still imbued with magic.

Keywords: overgrown, moss-covered, crumbling, unearthly, forgotten, enchanted

the defensive wall surrounding the village

The defensive wall surrounding the village is impressive and imposing. It stretches for miles, cutting off Luminia from the rest of the world. The wall is made from a combination of stone and timber, and its height and thickness make it virtually impenetrable. The guard towers that dot its perimeter are manned by skilled archers, ready to repel any threat that may come their way. The wall is a testament to the resilience and determination of the people of Luminia, who have worked tirelessly to protect their home.

Keywords: military, fortress-like, tall, sturdy, threatening, impressive

the inn known for its famous honey mead

The inn known for its famous honey mead is a cozy retreat. Its warm and inviting interior is full of rustic charm, with exposed wooden beams and a crackling fireplace. The innkeeper is friendly and welcoming, treating each guest like family. The signature drink, honey mead, is brewed on site using honey from the apiaries that dot the village. The inn is a destination unto itself, and many travelers come from far and wide just to experience its homely ambiance.

Keywords: cozy, inviting, homely, rustic, welcoming, intimate

the marketplace in the town square

The marketplace in the town square is a bustling hub of activity. Vendors from all over the region converge here to sell their wares, and the air is filled with the sounds of bargaining and laughter. The market is full of vibrant colors, from the handcrafted jewelry to the freshly baked bread. Musicians and performers roam the streets, adding to the festive atmosphere. It is also a place where news and gossip are exchanged, making it an important source of information for the villagers.

Keywords: lively, colorful, crowded, boisterous, enticing, exotic

the mill along the river that provides flour to the village

The mill along the river that provides flour to the village is a utilitarian structure. Its sturdy construction and functional design reflect the hard work and practical nature of the people of Luminia. The sound of grinding grain can be heard from miles away, a testament to the importance of the mill in the village's daily life. Despite its purely functional nature, the mill is beloved by the villagers, who see it as a symbol of their community and resilience.

Keywords: utilitarian, practical, functional, industrial, sturdy, unassuming

the temple of the Old One on the outskirts of the village

The temple of the Old One is a simple yet sacred place. It stands on a small hill overlooking the village, its single spire reaching towards the sky. The exterior is unadorned, reflecting the humble nature of the non-gendered God it honors. The interior is adorned with candles and incense, creating a serene atmosphere that invites reverence and reflection. The scholars and priests who tend to the temple are deeply devoted to their work, and their passion is reflected in the space itself.

Keywords: humble, serene, reverent, sacred, simple, spiritual

culture

Keywords: curious, tolerant, respectful, collaborative, artistic, self-reliant

customs

The annual festival of lights is one of the most anticipated celebrations in Luminia. It takes place every year during the harvest season and is a time for the villagers to come together and celebrate their prosperity. The festival lasts for three days and is marked by the lighting of thousands of lanterns that fill the village with a warm and inviting glow. There are food stalls and games for everyone to enjoy, and on the final night, there is a grand fireworks display that lights up the sky. The festival is a testament to the resilience and creativity of the people of Luminia, who have managed to thrive despite the challenges of living in a remote and sometimes harsh environment., The people of Luminia have a deep connection to the cycles of the moon. They believe that each new moon brings with it new opportunities for growth and renewal, and they mark the occasion with a feast. The feast is a time for the villagers to come together and share stories and wisdom, and to set intentions for the coming month. There is always an abundance of food and drink, and the atmosphere is one of joy and anticipation. The villagers believe that by welcoming the new moon in this way, they are aligning themselves with the natural rhythms of the world and inviting blessings into their lives., In Luminia, the dead are not forgotten. The villagers believe that their ancestors continue to watch over them from the spirit world, and they honor them through offerings. These offerings are made at a sacred site in the forest, where the spirits of the ancestors are said to reside. The offerings consist of food and other items that the ancestors enjoyed in life. The villagers believe that by making these offerings, they are keeping the memory of their loved ones alive and maintaining their connection to the past., The people of Luminia worship a non-gendered deity known as the Old One. They believe that the Old One is the source of all life and that by offering prayers at dawn and dusk, they are aligning themselves with the divine will. The prayers are said in a sacred language that is only spoken during these times and are accompanied by offerings of incense and flowers. The villagers believe that by showing reverence to the Old One in this way, they are inviting blessings into their lives and creating a sense of harmony and balance in the world., The forest is an important part of life in Luminia, and the villagers believe that it is inhabited by spirits that can offer guidance and protection. When they need help or advice, they will call upon these spirits through prayer and offerings. The offerings might consist of flowers, fruit, or other items that are sacred to the spirits. The villagers believe that by showing respect and gratitude to these spirits, they are creating a reciprocal relationship that will bring them good fortune and protect them from harm., Hospitality is one of the core values of the people of Luminia. They believe that by welcoming travelers into their homes and providing them with food and shelter, they are showing respect for the interconnectedness of all beings. Visitors to Luminia are treated as honored guests, and the villagers will go out of their way to make them feel comfortable and at home. They believe that by extending this kind of hospitality, they are making the world a better place and building bridges between different cultures and communities.

Keywords: annual festival of lights, welcoming the new moon with a feast, paying respects to ancestors through offerings, offering prayers to the Old One at dawn and dusk, calling upon the spirits of the forest for guidance, offering hospitality to travelers

description

Keywords: ancient forest, river, mountains, scholars, adventurers, prosperous, protected, trade, mystery, legacy

external_influences

Luminia has established regular trade with a neighboring village to bolster its resources and promote economic growth. The trade routes are well-traveled and merchants from both villages have built strong relationships over the years. In addition, wandering merchants frequently visit Luminia and bring exotic goods not available in the village. These merchants provide valuable information about the outside world and often share interesting stories from their travels. The villagers of Luminia also have friendly relations with a nearby tribe of forest-dwelling elves. The elves have a deep knowledge of the forest and often share information about dangerous creatures or hidden resources in the area. This information is critical for Luminia's survival and prosperity. The villagers respect the elves and often offer them hospitality and gifts in return for their assistance. However, not all external influences are positive. Luminia occasionally experiences conflicts with a nearby kingdom over border disputes. These conflicts can be tense and sometimes turn violent. The villagers are forced to defend their land and resources, which can strain their relationship with neighboring kingdoms. To make matters worse, sporadic raids by goblin bands from the mountains disrupt trade and cause fear among the villagers. The goblins are cunning and dangerous, and Luminia must take extra precautions to protect itself from their attacks. Despite these challenges, Luminia receives occasional assistance from wandering druids who are drawn to the village's unique culture and natural surroundings. The druids offer guidance on how to maintain balance with nature and often share mystical knowledge or healing techniques with the villagers. Their visits are highly valued and serve as a reminder that Luminia is not alone in its struggle., Regular trade with a neighboring village has provided Luminia with access to new resources and wealth. The village has been able to expand its markets and increase economic opportunities for its people. However, these efforts have not gone unnoticed. A nearby kingdom has taken notice of Luminia's prosperity and has expressed interest in taking over the village's resources. Tensions between the two communities have been rising, and Luminia must be prepared to defend itself from any potential attacks. In addition to these external threats, Luminia occasionally experiences conflict with neighboring goblin bands. These goblins are highly organized and coordinated, and their raids can be devastating to the village's economy and sense of security. The villagers have built a defensive wall around the village and maintain a trained militia to fend off any attacks. However, these efforts have not deterred the goblins, and Luminia must remain vigilant to protect its people and resources. Despite these challenges, Luminia has established friendly relations with a nearby tribe of forest-dwelling elves. These elves have a deep knowledge of the forest and often share valuable information about the area's resources and hidden dangers. The villagers respect the elves and often offer them hospitality and gifts in return for their assistance. This relationship has helped Luminia survive in a challenging environment and maintain a balance with nature. Luminia has also received occasional assistance from wandering druids who are drawn to the village's unique culture and natural surroundings. These druids offer guidance on how to maintain balance with nature and often share mystical knowledge or healing techniques with the villagers. Their visits have helped Luminia deepen its understanding of the surrounding natural world and foster intellectual pursuits among its people., Luminia's regular trade with a neighboring village has enabled the village to expand its markets and increase economic opportunities for its people. The trade routes are well-traveled, and merchants from both villages have built strong relationships over the years. These relationships provide valuable information about the outside world and often result in new business ventures. However, not all external influences are positive. Luminia occasionally experiences conflicts with a nearby kingdom over border disputes. These conflicts can be tense and sometimes turn violent. The villagers are forced to defend their land and resources, which can strain their relationship with neighboring kingdoms. To make matters worse, sporadic raids by goblin bands from the mountains disrupt trade and cause fear among the villagers. The goblins are cunning and dangerous, and Luminia must take extra precautions to protect itself from their attacks. Despite these challenges, Luminia has established friendly relations with a nearby tribe of forest-dwelling elves. These elves have a deep knowledge of the forest and often share valuable information about the area's resources and hidden dangers. The villagers respect the elves and often offer them hospitality and gifts in return for their assistance. This relationship has helped Luminia survive in a challenging environment and maintain a balance with nature. Luminia has also received occasional assistance from wandering druids who are drawn to the village's unique culture and natural surroundings. These druids offer guidance on how to maintain balance with nature and often share mystical knowledge or healing techniques with the villagers. Their visits have helped Luminia deepen its understanding of the surrounding natural world and foster intellectual pursuits among its people. Finally, the village sometimes receives visits from wandering merchants who bring exotic goods and stories from their travels. These merchants provide valuable information about the outside world and offer new business opportunities for the village. The villagers enjoy hearing about the adventures of these wandering merchants and gather in the town square to hear their stories.

Keywords: regular trade with a neighboring village, occasional visits from wandering merchants, friendly relations with a nearby tribe of forest-dwelling elves, occasional conflicts with a nearby kingdom over border disputes, sporadic raids by goblin bands from the mountains, occasional assistance from wandering druids

goals

Keywords: preserving the ancient ruins in the forest, expanding trade networks, maintaining the peace and security of the village, deepening understanding of the forgotten event, fostering intellectual pursuits, maintaining balance with nature

history

Luminia was founded centuries ago by a group of scholars and adventurers who were drawn to the unique qualities of the ancient forest, river, and mountains that surrounded the area. These pioneers brought with them a desire for knowledge and exploration, as well as a sense of curiosity about the mysteries that lay hidden in the land., Despite facing numerous natural disasters throughout its history, Luminia has always remained a prosperous and protected village. Severe floods have caused widespread damage to the village on three occasions in the past century, but the resilience of the people and their commitment to rebuilding has ensured that the village remains standing and thriving. A great drought led to a famine that lasted for two years, but the villagers pulled together and managed to survive through the difficult times., In more recent history, Luminia faced a bandit invasion that threatened to destroy the hard-won prosperity of the village. However, the brave defenders of Luminia stood firm and repelled the attackers, sending a clear message that the village would not be bullied or threatened. This event strengthened the resolve of the people to continue working towards maintaining the peace and security of the village., One of the most significant events in the history of Luminia was the discovery of a hidden chamber in the ancient ruins in the forest. This chamber contained ancient texts that shed light on the origins of the unique continent on which Luminia is located. The scholars and intellectuals of Luminia pored over these texts, deepening their understanding of the empire that once ruled the continent and the local beliefs and traditions that still hold sway among the people., Following an attack by wolves that threatened the safety of the village, the people of Luminia banded together to build a defensive wall around the perimeter of the village. This wall has served to protect the village from further attacks and has become a symbol of the resilience and determination of the people of Luminia to protect what is theirs., To celebrate the bountiful harvest that was crucial to the survival of the village, Luminia established an annual festival of lights. The festival is a time of great joy and celebration, filled with feasting, dancing, and music. It also serves as a reminder of the importance of community and hospitality, as the people of Luminia open their homes and tables to all who come to participate in the festivities.

Keywords: founded by scholars and adventurers centuries ago, survived several natural disasters, repelled a bandit invasion three decades ago, discovered a hidden chamber in the ruins containing ancient texts, built a defensive wall around the village after an attack by wolves, established the annual festival of lights to celebrate a bountiful harvest

resources

Luminia is located in an ancient forest, and as such, its most abundant resource is timber. The villagers have been careful to manage the forest sustainably, taking only what they need and replanting trees to ensure the forest remains healthy for generations to come. The village’s proximity to the river also allows for easy transport of the timber downstream to other villages and towns. The local carpenters use the timber to create sturdy houses, furniture, and even some of the defensive structures found around the village., The forests around Luminia are also home to many bees, which produce delicious honey. Beekeeping is a common practice in the village, with many families keeping their own hives. The honey is used in cooking, brewing mead, and even as a soothing balm for wounds. In addition to its culinary uses, the honey is also an important trade item, sought after by neighboring villages and traveling merchants., The mountains surrounding Luminia are rich in herbs, which are collected by skilled gatherers and used for medicinal purposes by the village’s healers. Some of the more exotic herbs are also traded with other villages and towns, providing an important source of income for the village. The herbs are also used in cooking, adding unique flavors and aromas to the food., The river that runs through Luminia is teeming with fish, which are caught by the villagers using nets and lines. The fish provide an important source of protein for the villagers, and are also traded with neighboring villages and towns. Some of the more skilled fishermen even supply fish to the traveling merchants who pass through the village., Iron ore is found in abundance in the mountains near Luminia. The villagers mine the ore and smelt it into iron bars, which are then used to create weapons, tools, and other metal objects. The skilled blacksmiths in the village are highly respected, and their wares are in high demand both locally and beyond., Sheep farming is a common practice in the hills around Luminia, providing the villagers with wool for clothing and textiles. The wool is spun into thread and yarn, which is then woven into cloth and made into warm garments. In addition to its practical uses, wool is also an important trade item, exchanged for other goods with neighboring villages and towns., The clay found along the banks of the river is used to create pottery in Luminia. The potters in the village create sturdy vessels for storing food and water, as well as decorative items such as vases and figurines. The pottery is highly valued for its durability and aesthetic appeal, and is traded with other villages and towns., The lush pastures around Luminia are ideal for grazing cows and goats, which provide the villagers with milk and cheese. The cheese is a sought-after delicacy, prized for its rich flavor and creamy texture. The villagers also trade their cheese with other villages and towns, providing an important source of income.

Keywords: timber, honey, herbs, fish, iron ore, wool, pottery, cheese

timeline

Luminia has faced its share of challenges over the past century, with severe floods causing widespread damage to the village three times. The first time it happened, the villagers were caught off guard and struggled to cope with the ramifications. The second time, they had a plan in place, but it was still a difficult and trying experience. By the third flood, the village had implemented long-term preventative measures, such as building higher banks around the river, and the impact was mitigated. Today, Luminia is well-prepared for such occurrences, but the memory of those catastrophic events still lingers., A great drought visited Luminia, leading to a famine that lasted for two years. The villagers were forced to ration their resources carefully, and many people went hungry. Tensions ran high, and there were a few instances where people resorted to stealing from one another. Despite the difficult circumstances, the villagers banded together, sharing what little they had and supporting each other through the trying times. Eventually, the rains returned, and the crops began to grow again. The village learned valuable lessons about sustainability and resilience from this experience., The massive oak tree in the center of the village was a beloved landmark, with a rich history dating back hundreds of years. But one day, it was struck by lightning, and the resulting fire burned it down. The villagers mourned the loss of the tree and worked together to clear away the debris. They planted a new sapling in its place to honor the memory of the old oak. Although the new tree is not as impressive as its predecessor, it represents hope and renewal for the community., The ruins in the forest have always held a certain mystery and intrigue for the people of Luminia. One year, the ruins emitted a strange light for several nights in a row, attracting curious travelers from far and wide. The villagers were fascinated by the phenomenon, and some even claimed to have seen ghostly apparitions. Scholars from nearby cities came to investigate, but they could not find any logical explanation for the strange light. Eventually, it faded away, leaving the villagers with a newfound appreciation for the mysteries of their land., A strange sickness swept through the village, causing people to speak in tongues and see hallucinations. It was a frightening time for everyone, and there were rumors that it was caused by a curse or evil magic. The village healer worked tirelessly to treat those who were affected, but there was no clear cure for the sickness. Eventually, it dissipated as mysteriously as it had arrived. To this day, no one knows what caused the sickness, but the villagers remain wary of anything that seems out of the ordinary., A group of adventurers passing through the village discovered a hidden underground tunnel near the river. It was a serendipitous find, and the villagers were grateful for the discovery. The tunnel provided an additional source of water and a means of escape in the event of an attack. However, there were also concerns about the safety of the tunnel, and it required significant repairs and upkeep to ensure that it remained viable. Over time, the villagers grew more accustomed to its presence and began using it as a means of transport between different parts of the village.

Keywords: severe floods caused widespread damage to the village three times in the past century, a great drought led to a famine that lasted for two years, a massive oak tree in the center of the village was struck by lightning and burned down, the ruins in the forest emitted a strange light for several nights in a row, attracting curious travelers, a strange sickness swept through the village, causing people to speak in tongues and see hallucinations, a group of adventurers passing through the village discovered a hidden underground tunnel near the river

Ancestral Sanctuary

Type: Cooperative

Field: Religion

Activity: Spirituality

Description: The Ancestral Sanctuary is a group of dedicated individuals who have devoted their lives to the study of spirituality and the divinity of the non-gendered God. They believe in the power of faith and ancestry, which they see as key components to maintaining balance with nature. Their main focus is the veneration of their ancestors through regular offerings and prayers at their shrine. The members of the group are highly respected by the people of Luminia, who often seek their guidance and blessings in times of need.

Population: 8

Employees:

  • Elatha Skarholt - apprentice - journeyman
  • Brona Halstead - apprentice - journeyman
  • Caylan Halstead - boss - master
  • Nally Skarholt - apprentice - novice
  • Leto Halstead - senior - expert
  • Keavey Skarholt - novice - novice

Prosperity: Poor

Relationship: The Ancestral Sanctuary is highly regarded by the people of Luminia. They provide spiritual guidance and comfort to those who seek it. The group maintains friendly relations with the nearby tribe of forest-dwelling elves and often exchanges knowledge about the natural world. They have occasional conflicts with a nearby kingdom over border disputes but have managed to resolve them peacefully so far. The Sanctuary also faces sporadic raids by goblin bands from the mountains but are aided by wandering druids who pass through Luminia from time to time.

History: Founded centuries ago by a group of scholars and adventurers who were fascinated by the unique continent they had discovered, the Ancestral Sanctuary has become an integral part of Luminia's culture and history. Over time, the group has survived several natural disasters and repelled a bandit invasion three decades ago. They discovered a hidden chamber in the ruins containing ancient texts, which they have preserved to this day. The group grew in numbers and influence, establishing its own temple on the outskirts of the village.

Anecdotes: Legend has it that the founder of the Ancestral Sanctuary, a famous adventurer, brought back a strange plant from his travels. It turned out to be a powerful medicinal herb that has since become an important part of the group's healing practices.. During a particularly harsh winter, when food was scarce, the members of the Ancestral Sanctuary distributed their own supplies among the villagers and refused to accept any compensation for it. It is said that this act of generosity earned them the respect and gratitude of the entire village.. The Ancestral Sanctuary once hosted a visiting scholar who claimed to have discovered a lost scripture that could reveal the true nature of the non-gendered God. The group listened intently and engaged in spirited debates about its authenticity before ultimately deciding that it was a forgery.

Plot: A mysterious illness has befallen the village, and the members of the Ancestral Sanctuary are the only ones who can find a cure. They must undertake a perilous journey into the mountains to collect rare herbs and interact with the spirits of the forest.. A neighboring kingdom has accused the Ancestral Sanctuary of harboring rebels and has sent a delegation to investigate. The group must prove their innocence and defend their right to practice their beliefs.. One of the members of the group has uncovered a shocking secret about the forgotten event that could change everything they know about their own history. They must navigate political intrigue and betrayal as they try to uncover the truth.. The annual festival of lights is coming up, but there is a sense of unease among the members of the Ancestral Sanctuary. They have received a vision that something terrible will happen during the celebrations, and they must try to prevent it using their spiritual powers.

Keywords: Spirituality, Divinity, Faith, Ancestry, Shrine

Goals keywords: preservation, spirituality, harmony with nature, intellectual pursuits

Sites

hut of the herbalist

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: modest wooden cabin, overgrown with vines, surrounded by a garden of herbs and flowers

Inherits architecture: False

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: ancient stone house, surrounded by lush gardens, filled with books and artifacts

Type: landscape

Inherits architecture: False

Architecture: open space in the forest, decorated with flowers and lanterns, canopied by trees

the riverbank

Details: a peaceful spot along the river with a soft sandy bank

Inherits architecture: False

Arrow's Defense

Type: Team

Field: Adventure

Activity: Defense

Description: Arrow's Defense are a group of brave and skilled individuals who have taken the responsibility of protecting Luminia from all sorts of dangers. Their primary weapon is the bow and arrow, and they are well known for their excellent marksmanship and their expertise in setting up traps to fend off their foes. The group consists of archers, guards, trappers, scouts and apprentices, working together to ensure the safety of the village.

Population: 8

Employees:

  • Lorna Brasher - apprentice - novice
  • Rowan Villius - senior - expert
  • Casner Raelthorne - boss - master
  • Ashley Raelthorne - apprentice - novice
  • Cara Mallory - apprentice - novice
  • Colm Dromore - senior - expert

Prosperity: Moderate

Relationship: Arrow's Defense have a strong and amiable relationship with the villagers of Luminia. They are held in high regard by the people who trust them implicitly in matters of security. They collaborate with the village council to develop strategies to counter any threats that may arise, and they work closely with the marketplace traders to help expand the trade network of Luminia.

History: Arrow's Defense were originally a group of adventurers who came together to protect the village from the frequent goblin raids that plagued the region. Over time, they developed a close bond with the villagers and established themselves as the protectors of Luminia. Though they have faced many challenges over the years, they have never faltered in their duty and continue to serve the village to this day.

Anecdotes: During a particularly intense defense operation, the archers of Arrow's Defense ran out of arrows. Thinking on her feet, Cara Mallory used her scouting skills to retrieve enough wood to make more arrows, saving the day.. Rowan Villius once took down a goblin horde with a single arrow, earning her the nickname 'One Shot' among her fellow rangers.. Colm Dromore is known for his clever traps and devices that have thwarted many an enemy attack. One of his most famous traps involves a bucket of honey and some strategically placed logs.

Plot: A group of rogue bandits have been plaguing the trade routes of Luminia, and the rangers must work together to bring them to justice.. An ancient evil has awoken in the forest, and the rangers are the only ones who can stop it.. A new member has joined the rangers, but there is something suspicious about their past. The rangers must uncover their secrets before it's too late.

Keywords: Defense, Protect, Bow, Arrow, Traps

Goals keywords: Defense, Protection, Trade Expansion, Environmental Harmony

Sites

Arrow's Defense' outpost

Type: building

State: inhabited

Details: A collection of wooden cabins surrounded by a training field and an archery range.

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: wooden, sturdy, log cabin, archery range, traps, healing facilities

Type: structure

State: inhabited

Details: A towering wall made of thick stone with turrets and guard posts. It has mirrored windows and a drawbridge

Inherits architecture: False

Architecture: thick stone, turrets, guard posts, mirrored windows, drawbridge

The Marketplace

Type: street

State: inhabited

Details: A bustling marketplace with colorful stalls and canopies selling aromatic spices, handmade pottery and jewelry.

Inherits architecture: False

Architecture: colorful stalls, canopies, aromatic, handmade, cozy

Blackwood's Underground Syndicate

Type: Company

Field: Crime

Activity: Thievery

Description: The Blackwood family has been a part of Luminia for generations, but the latest heir, Delaney, has turned to a life of thievery. She believes she has a calling from the Old One to use her skills for a greater good. Along with her fellow thieves, Mara, Nuila, and Ashlan, she runs a highly organized underground syndicate that specializes in stealing from the rich to give to the poor. Their fence, Jurg Blackitt, helps them sell their stolen goods on the black market.

Population: 6

Employees:

  • Delaney Blackwood - leader - expert
  • Mara Vain - senior - expert
  • Jurg Blackitt - boss - master
  • Ashlan Alkott - apprentice - novice
  • Nuila Azadul - apprentice - expert

Prosperity: Poor

Relationship: The members of Blackwood's Underground Syndicate operate mostly in secret, but their efforts to redistribute wealth have not gone unnoticed by the people of Luminia. While some villagers condemn their actions, others quietly support them and even provide them with information and supplies. The local authorities are aware of their activities, but have not been able to catch them in the act.

History: The Blackwood family has a long history of scholarly pursuits and intellectual endeavors, but Delaney was always more interested in the practical application of knowledge. After several encounters with corrupt officials and greedy nobles, she decided to turn her talents to thievery as a way to right the wrongs of society. With the help of Mara, Nuila, Ashlan, and Jurg, she built up their underground syndicate into a formidable force.

Anecdotes: Delaney once successfully stole a priceless artifact from a museum in a nearby city that had been thought to be impossible to steal. Mara is known for her cat-like agility, which has saved her from many close calls with authorities. Nuila, despite her disfigurement, is highly skilled at blending in with crowds and gathering information. Ashlan once distracted an entire group of guards with her chatter while the others made off with the loot.

Plot: The group discovers a plot by a wealthy noble to stage a coup and take over the village. They must decide whether to intervene or let things play out.. The authorities finally catch up to them and offer them a chance to turn informant in exchange for reduced sentences.. While on a heist, they stumble upon a clue to a larger mystery involving the Old One and must navigate treacherous political waters to uncover the truth.

Keywords: Thievery, Stealing, Looting, Safe-Cracking, Fencing

Goals keywords: redistributing wealth, challenging social hierarchies, honoring the Old One, protecting the less fortunate

Sites

Blackwood's Underground Syndicate

Type: building

State: inhabited

Details: an underground cavern with rough-hewn stone walls and a low ceiling, filled with stolen goods and weapons.

Inherits architecture: False

Architecture: underground, damp, rough-hewn stone, cramped, dark, cluttered

Inherits architecture: True

Cloaks of Coercion

Type: Guild

Field: Crime

Activity: Banditry

Description: The Cloaks of Coercion are a small group of bandits that operate in the shadows of Luminia's protective walls. With only three members, they rely on their individual strengths and a shared mission to survive in a world where they are despised and hunted by all.

Population: 4

Employees:

  • Tahlumillean Coralaeth - senior - expert
  • Ansel Atwood - apprentice - novice
  • Vora Murdoch - boss - master
  • Stephan Silverwood - -

Prosperity: Poor

Relationship: The Cloaks of Coercion have a tense relationship with the people of Luminia, who see them as a blight on their prosperous community.

History: The Cloaks of Coercion were formed when Tahlumillean Coralaeth, Ansel Atwood, and Vora Murdoch found themselves jobless and homeless at the same time. Desperate, they turned to a life of crime and quickly became one of the most notorious groups in the region.

Anecdotes: The time Tahlumillean saved Ansel's life by expertly navigating a treacherous river, cementing their trust and friendship. When Vora talked the group out of an ill-advised attack on a wealthy caravan, proving her strategic skill. The day the Cloaks of Coercion almost fell apart when Ansel was caught by the city guard and offered a deal to betray his companions

Plot: As the Cloaks of Coercion become more desperate for funds to survive, they start taking increasingly dangerous jobs that put them in direct opposition with powerful enemies.. The group discovers a map that leads to a legendary treasure hidden deep in the mountains. But getting there will require the assistance of Luminia's most powerful druid.. A wealthy merchant offers the Cloaks of Coercion a deal: rob his main competitor and he will provide them with steady employment and even help them legitimize their business.

Keywords: Banditry, Robbery, Coercion, Ambush, Intimidation

Goals keywords: Survival, Profit, Freedom, Revenge

Clothier's Collective

Type: Guild

Field: Business

Activity: Weaving

Description: The Clothier's Collective is a group of master weavers who specialize in creating high-quality fabrics and clothing. They work together to share techniques, materials, and knowledge, striving to perfect their craft and reach new heights of creativity.

Population: 6

Employees:

  • Evelyn Helwick - apprentice - novice
  • Stianna Mallory - boss - master
  • Canice Ironside - senior - expert
  • Erris Helwick - senior - expert
  • Malek Helwick - boss - master

Prosperity: Prosperous

Relationship: The Clothier's Collective has deep roots in Luminia and is an integral part of the village's economy and culture. The group's members produce fine textiles and clothing for sale in the local marketplace, as well as for trade with other villages and towns in the region. They also provide apprenticeships and training to young weavers, passing on their skills and expertise to the next generation.

History: The Clothier's Collective was founded by a group of weavers who were dissatisfied with the lack of support for their craft in the wider community. They pooled their resources and knowledge to create a space where they could work together and share ideas. Over time, the group grew in size and reputation, attracting talented weavers from all over the region.

Anecdotes: Malek Helwick once saved the life of a young weaver who had fallen into the river while attempting to retrieve some dropped thread. Canice Ironside is known for her ability to spin even the finest of threads, earning her the nickname 'The Spider'. Evelyn Helwick once donated a year's worth of profits from her weaving to help fund the construction of a new village well.

Plot: A rival weaver's guild attempts to steal the secrets of the Clothier's Collective's signature fabric.. The Clothier's Collective discovers an ancient loom in the ruins of the forest and must determine how to use it to create a new type of textile.. Malek Helwick is accused of stealing a valuable bolt of fabric from a customer, and must clear his name before the reputation of the entire group is tarnished.

Keywords: Weaving, Clothing, Fabrics, Threads, Dyes

Goals keywords: innovate, collaborate, inspire, preserve

Council of Wisdom

Type: Council

Field: Community

Activity: Administration

Description: The Council of Wisdom is a group of experienced and trusted individuals who provide counsel and administration for the village of Luminia. Their collective knowledge, insight, and leadership steer the village towards prosperity and ensure justice and order are maintained.

Population: 5

Employees:

  • Kealey Gant - master - expert
  • Vetta Darrow - senior - master
  • Dexer Kerswell - novice - beginner
  • Bailey Atwood - apprentice - beginner

Prosperity: Adequate

Relationship: The Council of Wisdom enjoys a strong bond with the people of Luminia, who trust and rely on them for guidance and support. However, their relationship with neighboring kingdoms and goblin bands is sometimes fraught with tension and conflict.

History: The Council of Wisdom was established shortly after Luminia's founding by a group of elders who saw the need for a centralized authority to govern the village. Over time, their council grew in size and diversified in experience, becoming the community's primary decision-making body.

Anecdotes: One year, the Council of Wisdom surprised the villagers by preparing a feast themselves, cooking up the finest cuisine in town. Another time, when the river flooded and swept away several villagers' homes, the council rallied the community together to rebuild and support those affected. Once, a heated debate broke out during a council meeting, causing one member to storm out, only to return later with a new perspective and a solution to the problem.

Plot: The Council of Wisdom discovers an illegal smuggling operation within the village and must navigate a web of deceit and corruption to bring the perpetrators to justice. Meanwhile, tensions mount as nearby kingdoms eye Luminia's resources with envy, and goblin raids increase in frequency and ferocity. Will the council be able to navigate these challenges and ensure the safety and prosperity of the villagers?

Keywords: Wisdom, Experience, Tradition, Justice, Leadership

Goals keywords: Community Empowerment, Justice, Leadership, Tradition

Deepmine Guild

Type: Team

Field: Work

Activity: Mining

Description: The Deepmine Guild is a group of skilled dwarven prospectors who have made it their life's work to mine and extract precious ores from the deep caverns and tunnels beneath Luminia.

Population: 4

Employees:

  • Jarellinn - -
  • Heremon Scarrow - apprentice - novice
  • Fiyaashk - -

Prosperity: Adequate

Relationship: The Deepmine Guild has a strong relationship with the people of Luminia who depend on them for the valuable resources they extract from the earth. The villagers often trade goods and services with the guild members and there is a deep respect between the two groups.

History: The Deepmine Guild was first formed over two centuries ago by a group of hardy dwarven miners who sought to make a living from the rich veins of ore that lay hidden beneath the earth's surface. Over time, the guild has grown in size and reputation and has become one of the most well-respected mining groups in the entire region.

Anecdotes: Legend has it that one of the founding members of the Deepmine Guild, a dwarf named Balin, once fought off an entire pack of wolves single-handedly to protect a shipment of ore. The guild still honors his memory to this day. Another member, a gregarious dwarf named Gimli, is known for his love of song and his ability to lift the spirits of his fellow miners during long days spent underground. Lastly, an eccentric dwarven inventor named Hrothgar once built a machine that could dig tunnels twice as fast as any pickaxe-wielding miner, but it ultimately proved to be too unstable and was abandoned.

Plot: The Deepmine Guild has discovered a valuable new vein of ore, but a rival mining group seeks to claim it for themselves. The players are hired to protect the guild's interests and ensure that the rival group is kept at bay.. One of the members of the guild has gone missing while on a scouting mission deep in the tunnels beneath Luminia. The players are hired to find them and bring them back safely.. A series of strange accidents have been occurring within the guild's mines. The players are hired to investigate and discover the cause before it's too late.

Keywords: Mining, Ore, Digging, Tool, Cave

Goals keywords: mining, prosperity, discovery, innovation

Sites

State: inhabited

Details: a bustling workplace where dwarf prospectors gather to discuss their findings and plan their next expeditions.

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: dwarf-sized stone building, dark and damp interior, dimly lit with torches, carved stone pillars, decorated with mining tools and ore samples, heavy wooden doors

Type: building

State: inhabited

Details: a bustling blacksmith's forge where dwarven craftsmen shape the raw ore extracted from the mines into useful objects

Inherits architecture: False

Architecture: hot, smoky room filled with furnaces, large bellows on the walls, anvils ringing with the sound of metal being shaped and honed, walls covered in soot and ash, tongs and hammers scattered about, heavy wooden doors

The Great Pit

Type: landscape

State: inhabited

Details: a deep mine where dwarven prospectors dig for valuable ore, surrounded by scaffolding and echoing with the sound of pickaxes striking rock

Inherits architecture: False

Architecture: surrounded by scaffolding and mining equipment, massive hole in the ground, carved steps leading down into the pit, flanked by lanterns to provide light, worn and uneven stone walls, a small hut nearby for workers to rest

Defenders of Luminia

Type: Team

Field: Administration

Activity: Security

Description: The Defenders of Luminia are a small group of highly-trained soldiers, tasked with ensuring the safety and security of the village and its inhabitants. Led by the wise and experienced Dextrel Skarholt, and aided by the brave and curious Katherine Brasher, this group works tirelessly to protect Luminia from all external threats, including bandits, goblin raids, and border disputes.

Population: 3

Employees:

  • Katerine Brasher - apprentice - novice
  • Dextrel Skarholt - boss - expert

Prosperity: Adequate

Relationship: The Defenders of Luminia are highly respected and valued members of the community. They work closely with the village elders and leaders to ensure that all threats to the safety and security of Luminia are dealt with swiftly and effectively. They also maintain friendly relations with the nearby tribe of forest-dwelling elves, often working together to hunt and track any dangerous animals that may endanger the villagers.

History: The Defenders of Luminia were founded shortly after the village was attacked by wolves. In response to this threat, the villagers banded together and built a defensive wall around their homes. Realizing that this was not enough to guarantee their safety, they formed a small group of soldiers to patrol the perimeter of the village and keep watch throughout the night. Over time, this group grew in size and reputation, becoming the skilled and dedicated defenders that they are today.

Anecdotes: One night, Katherine Brasher single-handedly fought off a group of bandits who were attempting to steal from a local merchant.. Dextrel Skarholt once calmed an enraged forest spirit that had been causing chaos in the village.. The Defenders of Luminia once spent an entire week searching for a lost child, eventually finding them safe and sound in a nearby cave.

Plot: The Defenders of Luminia receive a distress call from a neighboring village, and must rush to their aid to prevent an impending attack by a rival kingdom.. An ancient artifact is discovered in the ruins of the forest, and the Defenders of Luminia must protect it from those who would seek to use its power for evil.. Katherine Brasher goes missing during a reconnaissance mission, and the rest of the group must embark on a perilous rescue mission to bring her back home.

Keywords: Security, Patrol, Night Shift, Defense, Watchtower

Goals keywords: Security, Defense, Protection, Peacekeeping

Hardwick Milling Co.

Type: Family

Field: Work

Activity: Milling

Description: The Hardwick family has been operating the mill for generations, passing down their skills and knowledge from one to another. They are known throughout Luminia for their high-quality flour and ability to produce large quantities of it quickly. Each member of the family plays an important role in the functioning of the mill, with their own unique set of skills and personalities.

Population: 5

Employees:

  • Havelock Hardwick - senior - expert
  • Heleth Hardwick - apprentice - novice
  • Galtar Hardwick - boss - master
  • Garline Hardwick - senior - expert
  • Stephan Blackwood - -

Prosperity: Adequate

Relationship: The Hardwick family has a close relationship with the people of Luminia, as their flour is an important staple in the village. They have also formed good relationships with nearby villages and tribes, who trade with them regularly. The family has had occasional conflicts with nearby kingdoms over border disputes, but they try to stay out of political matters as much as possible.

History: The Hardwick family has been operating the mill for generations, with each member learning from the one before them. They have survived several natural disasters, including a devastating flood that destroyed most of the mill. They rebuilt it stronger than ever, and it has been a source of pride for the family ever since.

Anecdotes: 1. During a particularly harsh winter, the Hardwick family had to work around the clock to keep up with the demand for flour. They survived on very little sleep and managed to produce enough flour to feed the entire village. 2. Galtar once got into an argument with a traveling merchant over the quality of the flour. The argument escalated until they were both screaming at each other, but eventually Galtar won the argument by producing a loaf of bread that was so delicious the merchant was speechless. 3. Garline once caught Havelock napping on the job. She snuck up on him and scared him so badly he fell out of his chair and landed in a pile of flour.

Plot: When the Hardwick family discovers a new, more efficient way of milling grain, they have to convince the rest of Luminia to adopt their methods.. A group of goblins begin raiding the mill, and threaten to burn it down if the family doesn't pay them tribute.. During a particularly dry summer, the river that powers the mill dries up. The Hardwick family has to find another source of power to keep the mill running.

Keywords: Milling, Grain, Flour, Millstone, Sifters

Goals keywords: quality, efficiency, tradition, innovation

Sites

The Hardwick Residence

Type: building

State: inhabited

Details: a small stone cottage with a flower garden outside. The smell of fresh bread permeates the air and flour-covered boots are often seen on the doorstep.

Inherits architecture: False

Architecture: stone, cottage, cozy, homely, practical

The Mill

Type: building

State: inhabited

Details: a wooden mill powered by the river, with a large millstone and several sifters. The structure is designed for efficiency and functionality.

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: rustic, wooden, water-powered, efficient, practical, utilitarian

The Storage Barn

Type: building

State: inhabited

Details: a spacious brick building used for storing large sacks of grain and stacks of flour bags. The interior is organized with measuring scales and other practical furnishings.

Inherits architecture: False

Architecture: brick, spacious, utilitarian, practical

Helstrom's Hearth

Type: Company

Field: Business

Activity: Hospitality

Description: Helstrom's Hearth is a bustling inn located in the heart of Luminia. The warm, welcoming ambiance is palpable as soon as you step through the door. The walls are adorned with tapestries and relics from across the land, and the smell of delicious cooking fills the air. The Helstrom family has been running the inn for generations, providing a comfortable place for travelers and locals alike to rest, eat, and drink.

Population: 8

Employees:

  • Bailey Helstrom - boss - expert
  • Muriel Helstrom - apprentice - novice
  • Vinter Helstrom - boss - master
  • Derry Helstrom - apprentice - novice
  • Alain Helstrom - apprentice - novice
  • Jordan Raelthorne - boss - expert

Prosperity: Prosperous

Relationship: Helstrom's Hearth is an integral part of the Luminia community, and the Helstrom family is highly respected by the other villagers. The inn provides a hub for socializing and networking, and visitors often come away feeling like they've made new friends. The Helstroms have also built strong relationships with local suppliers, including apiarists, fishermen, and farmers, which helps to ensure that their menu is always fresh and locally sourced.

History: The Helstrom family founded the inn centuries ago, and it has been passed down through the generations. Over the years, the business has survived a number of challenges, including natural disasters, bandit attacks, and even a wolf invasion. However, through hard work and determination, the Helstroms have managed to keep their business thriving.

Anecdotes: Legend has it that during the bandit invasion three decades ago, Bailey Helstrom single-handedly took down six attackers with nothing but a rolling pin. Although the story is probably embellished, it's a testament to the Helstroms' fierce determination and bravery. Another rumor that circulates around Luminia is that Vinter Helstrom's honey mead is actually enchanted, and that anyone who drinks it will have good luck for the rest of the year. Of course, this is just a tall tale - but it hasn't stopped people from lining up at the inn for a taste!

Plot: A group of thieves plots to steal the Helstrom family's secret honey mead recipe. A wealthy traveler offers to buy the inn from the Helstroms, but their motives are unclear. During the annual Honey Mead Festival, a group of goblins from the mountains raids the village and takes hostages

Keywords: Inn, Food, Drink, Rooms, Entertainment

Goals keywords: Providing quality service, Preserving traditions, Supporting the local economy, Building a strong reputation

Hides and Tans Fellowship

Type: Guild

Field: Business

Activity: Leatherworking

Description: The Hides and Tans Fellowship is a group of skilled artisans dedicated to leatherworking. They specialize in tanning hides using natural tannins and the curing process, resulting in high-quality leather that is sought after by merchants and adventurers alike.

Population: 3

Employees:

  • Jenett Darkmantle - expert - master
  • Devlin Fenwick - boss - expert
  • Nathanial Strong - -
  • Gwendolyn Porter - -
  • Caleb Blackwood - -
  • Tristan Hawkwood - -
  • Sable Blackburn - -
  • Remy Thorne - -
  • Leif Eriksen - -
  • Silas Hightower - -
  • Rowan Redwood - -

Prosperity: Adequate

Relationship: The Hides and Tans Fellowship enjoys a close relationship with the people of Luminia, providing them with high-quality leather goods and supporting the village's prosperity through trade. The guild also works closely with other artisans in the community, exchanging ideas and techniques to improve the quality of their products.

History: The Hides and Tans Fellowship was founded over a century ago by a group of skilled tanners who wanted to share their knowledge and expertise with others. Over time, the guild has grown in size and reputation, becoming an important part of Luminia's economy and culture.

Anecdotes: Jenett Darkmantle once saved the guild from financial ruin by introducing a new technique for tanning hides that greatly improved the quality of their leather. Devlin Fenwick is known for her incredible memory and ability to recall the tanning process for any type of hide from memory alone. Despite their differences in personality, the two work together seamlessly to lead the guild.

Plot: The Hides and Tans Fellowship is struggling to keep up with demand from merchants and needs to find a new source of tannins to stay afloat.. A rival tanner's guild from a neighboring village is undercutting the Hides and Tans Fellowship by selling low-quality leather goods at a lower price.. A mysterious illness is spreading among the animals in the forest, making it difficult for the guild to obtain high-quality hides for their tanning process.

Keywords: Leatherworking, Tanning, Hides, Tannins, Curing

Goals keywords: craftsmanship, innovation, expansion, sustainability

Honey Keepers

Type: Family

Field: Work

Activity: Beekeeping

Description: The Honey Keepers are a family of beekeepers who have been producing honey in Luminia for generations. They are known throughout the village for their high-quality honey and beeswax products, which they sell at the local marketplace. The family is led by Gum Rhinehart, who inherited the business from his father and has since expanded the apiary to include over 100 hives.

Population: 5

Employees:

  • Morna Denby - apprentice - novice
  • Gum Rhinehart - boss - expert
  • Renny Skarholt - senior - master
  • Julian Rhinehart - senior - expert
  • Sadie Muldoon - -
  • Kaelin Blackthorn - -
  • Jarek Ironsides - -
  • Arthur Farnsworth - -
  • Gryan Oakley - -
  • Aria Hawksmoor - -
  • Leif Magnusson - -
  • Fenris Grimsson - -
  • Brigitte Northwood - -

Prosperity: Adequate

Relationship: The Honey Keepers maintain a close relationship with the rest of the village, often trading honey and beeswax for other resources they need. They are also active members of the annual festival of lights, where they showcase their latest products and offer samples to visitors. Additionally, they are on good terms with the nearby tribe of forest-dwelling elves, who often seek out their honey for its medicinal properties.

History: The Honey Keepers were founded over a century ago by Gum's great-grandfather, who discovered a natural abundance of wildflowers in the area and saw an opportunity to start producing honey. Over the years, the family has faced numerous challenges, including a severe drought in the early 1900s and an outbreak of disease among the bees in the 1950s. However, they have persevered and remained a staple of the Luminia community.

Anecdotes: Once, while gathering honey from a particularly aggressive hive, Morna Denby was stung on the hand and her entire hand swelled up to twice its size. The family had to perform an emergency ritual to help ease the pain and swelling. Another time, a group of travelers passing through Luminia stopped by the Honey Keepers' apiary and were so enamored with their products that they offered to trade a rare artifact for a single jar of honey. Lastly, during the annual honey festival, Renny Skarholt was approached by a young girl who was lost in the woods. Renny used her knowledge of the forest and her connection with the local spirits to safely guide the girl back to her family.

Plot: A neighboring village is experiencing a severe drought and seeks out the Honey Keepers for assistance in starting their own apiary. A new invasive species of beetle threatens to destroy the Honey Keepers' hives. One member of the Honey Keepers discovers a rare and valuable species of flower that could greatly increase honey production, but it only grows in an extremely dangerous part of the forest

Keywords: Beekeeping, Honey, Beeswax, Apiary, Pollination

Goals keywords: expanding the apiary, increasing honey production, maintaining the health of the bees, training the next generation of beekeepers

Iron Hoof Guild

Type: Guild

Field: Business

Activity: Farriery

Description: The Iron Hoof Guild is a sturdy business located in the heart of Luminia. It is run by Thershaele Coralaeth, a young and energetic elf who learned his trade from Marba Hardwick, a wise and nurturing dwarf with a love for baking. Together, they provide the village with the highest quality farriery services.

Population: 3

Employees:

  • Thershaele Coralaeth - apprentice - novice
  • Marba Hardwick - boss - master

Prosperity: Adequate

Relationship: The Iron Hoof Guild has an excellent relationship with the people of Luminia. They are renowned for their excellent customer service and have established themselves as a vital part of the community. They regularly participate in village events and contribute to the prosperity of the village.

History: Founded by dwarves and elves several centuries ago, The Iron Hoof Guild has a long-standing reputation for providing exceptional farriery services. They survived the natural disasters that affected the region and had to rebuild their workshop after a goblin raid destroyed it. They continue to maintain their status as the premier farriers in the region through hard work and dedication.

Anecdotes: It is said that Marba's secret ingredient in her honey oatmeal cookies is horse hoof shavings!. Thershaele once stayed up all night to finish a set of horseshoes for a client's racing horse, which won the competition by a nose.. There are rumors that The Iron Hoof Guild has been commissioned to create a special set of magical horseshoes for one of the scholars researching the ancient ruins nearby.

Plot: The Iron Hoof Guild is commissioned to make a set of horseshoes for a famous adventurer's horse. However, they discover that the adventurer is being trailed by goblins who are eager to steal the horseshoes for themselves.. The workshop has a serious accident with a forge explosion, which injures several guild members. They must find the cause of the problem and prevent it from happening again.. A nearby town is hosting a farriery competition, and The Iron Hoof Guild is determined to win the top prize. They must overcome some tough competitors while staying true to their values.. The Iron Hoof Guild discovers a strange and rare metal in the mountains, and they must figure out how to smelt it and use it in their horseshoes.

Keywords: Farriery, Horses, Shoes, Nails, Anvil

Goals keywords: expansion, excellence, reputation, innovation

Iron Quill Inc.

Type: Company

Field: Administration

Activity: Notification

Description: Iron Quill Inc. is a small group of skilled individuals who specialize in the art of notification. They are responsible for disseminating information to the residents of Luminia and beyond. They take great pride in their work and ensure that every message they deliver is accurate and timely.

Population: 3

Employees:

  • Nolan Ironside - boss - expert
  • Elatha Raelthorne - apprentice - novice
  • Stephan Darke - -
  • Jasper Bloodwood - -
  • Sarai Shadowroot - -
  • Alastair Moonstone - -

Prosperity: Poor

Relationship: Iron Quill Inc. has a close relationship with the residents of Luminia. They are respected for their professionalism and dedication to their craft. They also have good relationships with nearby villages and towns, which helps them to gather news and information from beyond Luminia.

History: Iron Quill Inc. was founded by Nolan Ironside and Elatha Raelthorne, two natives of Luminia who saw a need for reliable communication in the village. Since then, they have worked tirelessly to provide this service to their community.

Anecdotes: Nolan once delivered a message to the wrong person, causing chaos and confusion throughout the village. However, he quickly rectified the mistake and earned the gratitude of the person who received the message in error. Elatha once stayed up for two nights straight to complete a rush order for a nearby town. Her diligence helped to solidify Iron Quill Inc.'s reputation for reliability. Iron Quill Inc. once intercepted a message that revealed a plot by a neighboring kingdom to invade Luminia. They were able to warn the local government in time, and the invasion was successfully repelled.

Plot: Iron Quill Inc. is approached by a group of adventurers who need help disseminating information about a dangerous artifact they are searching for. However, the artifact's owners also hire Iron Quill Inc. to spread misinformation about the adventurers. Iron Quill Inc. must decide whether to betray their clients or risk their reputation by spreading false information.

Keywords: Notification, News, Proclamation, Announcement, Gossip

Goals keywords: communication, accuracy, timeliness, reliability

Luminia's Gardeners Guild

Type: Cooperative

Field: Hobbies

Activity: Landscape Design

Description: The Luminia's Gardeners Guild or the Green Thumb Cooperative is a group of skilled and passionate individuals who specialize in landscape design, plants, fertilizing, watering and pruning. Their mission is to make Luminia a beautiful and prosperous place by designing and managing gardens, parks and public spaces.

Population: 5

Employees:

  • Phineas Versh - senior - expert
  • Brona Darkmantle - boss - expert
  • Muriel Pendrake - apprentice - novice
  • Kirwin Vain - senior - expert

Prosperity: Poor

Relationship: The Gardeners Guild is an integral part of Luminia's social and economic fabric. They contribute to the development of the village through their green projects and initiatives, and are valued for their creativity, dedication and expertise. They have a good relationship with other groups such as the scholars, adventurers and traders, who appreciate the importance of green spaces and natural beauty in their respective pursuits. However, they sometimes have conflicts with the mining and logging industries, which prioritize profit over sustainability.

History: The Gardeners Guild was formed when several residents of Luminia realized the potential of gardening as a means of improving the quality of life in their village. Phineas Versh, Brona Darkmantle, Muriel Pendrake and Kirwin Vain lead the formation of the guild and worked tirelessly to establish it as a reputable institution. Despite facing obstacles such as harsh weather conditions and limited resources, they managed to gain recognition and support from the village leaders and the wider community.

Anecdotes: Phineas Versh once created a bonsai tree that survived for more than 50 years and became a tourist attraction. Brona Darkmantle designed a secret garden for a wealthy merchant that was rumored to contain magical properties. Muriel Pendrake saved a rare species of flowers from extinction by creating a suitable habitat for them in her own backyard.

Plot: The Gardeners Guild is approached by a wealthy landowner who wants to create a botanical garden on his estate, but faces opposition from the local authorities.. The Guild discovers a rare plant with medicinal properties deep in the forest, but has to protect it from poachers and greedy traders who want to exploit it for profit.. A member of the Guild falls in love with a druid who has different views on the role of nature in human society, leading to a conflict within the group and their relationship.

Keywords: Landscape Design, Plants, Fertilizer, Watering, Pruning

Goals keywords: beautification, prosperity, education, community

Activity: Herb Gathering

Population: 4

  • Bryson Raelthorne - senior - expert

They are also respected by the local scholars and adventurers for their deep understanding of the natural world. However, they have had some conflicts with the local authorities, who do not always recognize the value of their work.

History: Nature's Serenity was founded by a group of herb gatherers and healers who came together to share their knowledge and resources. They started out small, but over time, they grew in size and reputation. Today, they are an integral part of the community and are respected for their expertise and dedication to their craft.

Anecdotes: One member of Nature's Serenity, Bryson Raelthorne, once saved a young girl from a deadly disease by using a rare herb he had discovered in the forest. Another member, Ryleigh Vain, is known for his ability to make a healing tea that can cure even the most stubborn cold. Derry Kerswell, the newest member, has quickly become a valuable asset to the group with her eagerness to learn and passion for healing.

Plot: Nature's Serenity is faced with a challenge when a new disease sweeps through the village, and the cure is unknown. They must embark on a dangerous journey through the forest to find the rare herb that can cure the disease before it's too late. Along the way, they must navigate treacherous terrain and face dangerous creatures while also dealing with internal conflicts within the group.

Keywords: Herb Gathering, Healing, Medicine, Nature, Concoctions

Goals keywords: healing, nature, knowledge, harmony
