Norwick's Farmstead

Type: Family

Field: Work

Activity: Farming

Description: The Norwick family has been living and working in Luminia for generations. As one of the few families that farms the land around the village, they are respected for their hard work and dedication. The Blackstone Farmstead, where the family lives and works, is a modest but well-kept plot of land with a small farmhouse and several fields.

Population: 8

Employees:

  • Devlin Norwick - senior - expert
  • Nally Norwick - boss - master
  • Caylan Norwick - apprentice - novice
  • Kiltey Norwick - senior - expert
  • Cammy Norwick - senior - expert
  • Matilda Norwick - apprentice - novice

Prosperity: Poor

Relationship: The Norwick family is an integral part of the community in Luminia. They provide the village with much of its food, and are respected for their hard work and dedication. The family has friendly relations with most of their neighbors, and often lend a helping hand when needed. However, they have had occasional conflicts with nearby kingdoms over border disputes.

History: The Norwick family has been farming the land around Luminia for generations. The Blackstone Farmstead has weathered many storms and natural disasters over the years, but the family has always managed to keep the farm running. They were hit hard by a severe drought a few years ago, but managed to bounce back with the help of their neighbors.

Anecdotes: 1. Nally Norwick, the wise woman of the family, is known throughout the village for her healing remedies made from local herbs. 2. Devlin Norwick once caught a giant fish in the river that feeds Luminia, and donated it to the annual festival of lights feast. 3. Kiltey Norwick's famous blueberry pie won first prize at the autumn fair.

Plot: The Norwick family is struggling to keep their farm running after a particularly bad harvest. They are on the brink of bankruptcy and desperately need outside help. The players could be hired by a wealthy merchant or noble to help them, or they could try to rally the village to save the farmstead. Alternatively, the players could discover a new crop or farming technique that could revolutionize the way the family farms, and help them achieve sustainability and prosperity.

Keywords: Farming, Agriculture, Crops, Harvest, Fields

Goals keywords: sustainability, family legacy, food security, community

Raelthorne Trading Company

Type: Cooperative

Field: Business

Activity: Trading

Description: The Raelthorne Trading Company is a moderately prosperous group of traders and merchants who specialize in the trade of various goods such as honey, herbs, fish, iron ore, wool, pottery, and cheese. The company consists mostly of a tight-knit group of family members who have been involved in trading for generations. They are known for their reliable transportation, fair prices, and excellent wares.

Population: 15

Employees:

  • Orla Alkott - senior - expert
  • Rosaleen Raelthorne - elder - master
  • Kelsey Voyle - junior - novice
  • Renny Raelthorne - elder - master
  • Alexia Mallory - senior - expert
  • Creena Mallory - junior - novice
  • Crowle Raelthorne - elder - master
  • Emma Raelthorne - - - -
  • Creedan Raelthorne - junior - novice
  • Muriel Raelthorne - senior - expert
  • Heremon Kerrigan - junior - novice
  • Egan Helwick - elder - master
  • Ecken Hardwick - junior - novice
  • Bailey Pendrake - senior - expert

Prosperity: Moderate

Relationship: The Raelthorne Trading Company has deep roots in Luminia and is considered an integral part of the community. They have regular trade with a neighboring village and occasional visits from wandering merchants. They have friendly relations with a nearby tribe of forest-dwelling elves, but occasional conflicts with a nearby kingdom over border disputes. They have sporadic raids by goblin bands from the mountains but receive occasional assistance from wandering druids.

History: Founded by scholars and adventurers centuries ago, the Raelthorne Trading Company started as a small trading outpost on the outskirts of Luminia. Over time, the company grew in size and influence, establishing itself as one of the most successful trading companies in the region. The company has survived several natural disasters, repelled a bandit invasion three decades ago, and discovered a hidden chamber in the ruins containing ancient texts.

Anecdotes: 1) The Raelthorne Trading Company once encountered a group of travelers who were stranded in the forest after their wagon broke down. The company offered them food, shelter, and transportation, free of charge. 2) During a particularly harsh winter, the company donated a portion of their supplies to help feed the hungry and homeless in Luminia. 3) Once, while traveling through a nearby kingdom, the company was ambushed by a group of bandits. Despite being outnumbered, they were able to fend off the attackers and protect their wares.

Plot: The Raelthorne Trading Company must defend their goods and reputation against a rival trader who is selling low-quality merchandise.. The company discovers an ancient artifact while on a trading expedition, and must decide whether to keep it or sell it for a large profit.. The company must navigate a political conflict between two neighboring kingdoms that threatens their trade routes.. The Raelthorne Trading Company learns of a secret plot to sabotage their business and must uncover the culprits before it's too late.

Keywords: Trading, Commerce, Merchandise, Wagons, Routes

Goals keywords: trade expansion, family legacy, sustainable growth, cultural exchange

The Bison Runners

Type: Company

Field: Work

Activity: Hunting

Description: The Bison Runners are a group of skilled hunters and trappers who venture deep into the wilderness outside of Luminia to hunt bison for their meat, hides, and pelts. Founded by Bartan Rothrock, the gruff but kind-hearted leader of the company, the Bison Runners are known for their bravery and resourcefulness in the face of the dangers of the wilderness.

Population: 10

Employees:

  • Regan Rhinehart - senior - expert
  • Ennis Atwood - apprentice - novice
  • Morna Atwood - boss - master
  • Henna Mallory - senior - expert
  • Garrett Kerrigan - apprentice - novice
  • Betilda Rusling - apprentice - expert
  • Bartan Rothrock - boss - master
  • Conor Roane - senior - expert

Prosperity: Poor

Relationship: Despite being somewhat isolated from the rest of Luminia, the Bison Runners are an integral part of the village's economic and social fabric. They provide much-needed resources such as meat and pelts, and they also serve as a source of pride for the village. The villagers often look up to them as fearless adventurers who are unafraid to take risks to ensure the prosperity of the village.

History: The Bison Runners have been operating for several generations, and their skills have been passed down from father to son (and occasionally, daughter). Over the years, they have faced their fair share of challenges, including harsh winters, dangerous predators, and disputes with neighboring tribes. However, they have persevered thanks to their resilience and strong bond as a community.

Anecdotes: Once, the Bison Runners came across a pack of wolves that had brought down a young bison. Instead of simply driving the wolves away, they hunted and killed the wolves, then used their pelts to make warm clothing for themselves.. One winter, the Bison Runners were nearly wiped out by a sudden blizzard that lasted for several days. However, they managed to survive by huddling together in a makeshift shelter, sharing their resources, and using their skills to hunt game even in the harsh conditions.. During a dispute with a neighboring tribe over hunting rights, the Bison Runners managed to negotiate a peaceful resolution by offering to share their bounty with the other tribe.

Plot: The Bison Runners discover a hidden cave system while on a hunt, and uncover a long-forgotten treasure that could change the fortunes of Luminia forever.. A mysterious illness spreads through the Bison Runners' community, threatening to wipe them out unless a cure can be found.. The Bison Runners are hired by a nearby kingdom to hunt down an elusive monster that has been terrorizing their villagers.

Keywords: Hunting, Trapping, Bison, Pelts, Wilderness

Goals keywords: hunting, trapping, self-sufficiency, sustainability

The Caretakers' Society

Type: Guild

Field: Care

Activity: Medicine

Description: The Caretakers' Society is a group of healers who devote their lives to the well-being of the people in Luminia. They are skilled practitioners of medicine who use their knowledge of herbalism, poultices, and antibiotics to treat all manner of ailments.

Population: 3

Employees:

  • Sumil Coralaeth - senior - expert
  • Biagio Drevinuath - -
  • Niamh Harlow - -
  • Leif Stonefist - -
  • Caelia Silverscale - -
  • Amalric Swiftfoot - -
  • Gwion Snow - -
  • Saoirse Loreley - -

Prosperity: Moderate

Relationship: The Caretakers' Society is highly respected in Luminia and is considered an essential part of village life. They work closely with other groups, such as the local druids and the town council, to ensure that the needs of the community are met. The villagers trust the Caretakers implicitly and often seek their advice on matters of health and wellness.

History: The Caretakers' Society was founded by Sumil Coralaeth, an elf who came to Luminia over two hundred years ago. She established the guild as a way to share her knowledge of healing with others and ensure that the people of Luminia always had access to skilled practitioners. Over time, the guild has grown and evolved, with new members joining and bringing their own skills to the organization.

Anecdotes: During a particularly harsh winter, the Caretakers braved the snow and ice to tend to the sick and injured. They were able to keep the death toll lower than expected and earned the gratitude of the entire village.. After a young girl was bitten by a poisonous spider, the healers worked tirelessly to create a new poultice that ultimately saved her life.. When a group of bandits attacked Luminia, the Caretakers were on the front lines, tending to the wounded and saving lives.

Plot: A deadly plague sweeps through Luminia, and the Caretakers must race against time to find a cure before it's too late.. The Caretakers discover a new healing method that could revolutionize the way medicine is practiced in the village, but must overcome resistance from traditionalists.. A rival group of healers arrives in Luminia, and the Caretakers must prove their worth and defend their reputation against those who would undermine them.

Keywords: Medicine, Healing, Poultice, Antibiotic, Herbalism

Goals keywords: Curing, Preventing, Teaching, Researching

The Circle of Mystic Women

Type: Cooperative

Field: Ideologies

Activity: Magic

Description: The Circle of Mystic Women is a small group of talented magic-users who have made their home in Luminia. They are well-respected within the village and beyond for their skills in divination, herbalism, enchantment, and alchemy.

Population: 6

Employees:

  • Gamack Domack - expert - master
  • Quinn Vain - senior - expert
  • Niall Vain - apprentice - novice
  • Galtar Blackitt - journeyman - expert
  • Hogan Vain - senior - journeyman

Prosperity: Poor

Relationship: The people of Luminia hold the Circle in high regard, and many seek out their services and counsel in times of need. The Circle, in turn, takes an active interest in the well-being of the village, using their magic to protect the land and its inhabitants from threats both natural and supernatural. They maintain friendly relations with the nearby tribe of forest-dwelling elves and maintain cautious diplomacy with the neighboring kingdom, which occasionally seeks to exert control over Luminia and its resources.

History: The Circle has been a fixture of Luminian life for generations. Its founders were a group of powerful women who came together to study and practice magic in secret, fearing persecution from the patriarchal society around them. Over time, the group grew in numbers and influence, and eventually became an integral part of the community.

Anecdotes: Legend has it that one of the founding members of the Circle was able to divine the exact location of a hidden chamber containing ancient texts, which led to a great leap forward in their understanding of magic and history. Another member once enchanted an entire hamlet's worth of livestock to help them escape a devastating fire in the middle of the night. And on one memorable occasion, the entire Circle joined forces to break the hold of a powerful curse that had befallen a visiting noblewoman.

Plot: Mysterious thefts of rare magical ingredients. A powerful curse on a member of the Circle. A political crisis requiring the Circle's intervention to maintain Luminia's independence

Keywords: Magic, Divination, Herbalism, Charms, Curses

Goals keywords: knowledge, balance, harmony, prosperity

The Council of Wisdom

Type: Council

Field: Community

Activity: Administration

Description: The Council of Wisdom is a group of experienced and knowledgeable elders who are responsible for overseeing the administration of Luminia. Comprised of two respected members of the community, this group offers guidance and leadership to the people of the village.

Population: 3

Employees:

  • Ashlan Pendrake - boss - master
  • Kelsey Darkmantle - senior - expert
  • Orion Swiftfoot - -
  • Kaela Timberbough - -
  • Vespera Nightshade - -
  • Elianor Thistlewood - -
  • Cedric Redthorn - -
  • Eva Blackwood - -

Prosperity: Moderate

Relationship: The Council of Wisdom is highly respected by the people of Luminia. Its members are seen as the embodiment of the village's values of wisdom, tradition, and justice. The Council is closely allied with other groups in the community, including the scholars and adventurers who founded Luminia.

History: The Council of Wisdom has been a part of Luminia for generations. Its members have changed over time, but the group's purpose and importance have remained constant. The Council of Wisdom was formed by the village's founders, who recognized the need for a wise and experienced group to oversee the administration of the community.

Anecdotes: When the Council of Wisdom was formed, its first members were chosen by drawing straws. The two individuals who drew the shortest straws were invited to serve on the Council, and they went on to become two of Luminia's most respected elders.. During a particularly difficult winter, the Council of Wisdom organized a community-wide effort to collect firewood and other supplies for families in need. The effort was successful, and it helped to strengthen the bonds between the people of Luminia.. When the village was attacked by wolves, the Council of Wisdom played a key role in coordinating the defense efforts. Their quick thinking and decisive action helped to save many lives.

Plot: The Council of Wisdom approaches the party with a request for assistance in investigating a series of thefts that have been plaguing the village.. One of the members of the Council of Wisdom is accused of a serious crime, and the party is asked to investigate the matter and determine the truth.. The Council of Wisdom discovers an ancient artifact that they believe holds great power. They task the party with retrieving it from a dangerous location.

Keywords: Wisdom, Experience, Tradition, Justice, Leadership

Goals keywords: Maintaining tradition, Upholding Justice, Fostering Leadership, Encouraging Learning

The Cult of the Old One

Type: Council

Field: Ideologies

Activity: Religion

Description: The Cult of the Old One is a group of individuals who worship an enigmatic deity known as the Old One, believed to be a non-gendered god. The members of the cult practice various rituals and offer sacrifices to the Old One in hopes of receiving guidance, protection, and blessings.

Population: 5

Employees:

  • Icabod Denisson - apprentice - novice
  • Heleth Blackitt - boss - master
  • Gwen Ironside - senior - expert
  • Dunarl Hardwick - senior - expert

Prosperity: Poor

Relationship: The Cult of the Old One is respected within Luminia and is known to be one of the most prosperous groups. They maintain friendly relations with nearby tribes of forest-dwelling elves, and they provide occasional assistance to wandering druids. However, there are rumors of dark practices and sacrifices within the cult, which have caused some tension with other groups in Luminia.

History: The Cult of the Old One was founded by a small group of scholars and adventurers centuries ago, who stumbled upon a strange artifact that led them to the belief in the Old One. Over time, the group grew and established a temple on the outskirts of Luminia. They have weathered several natural disasters, such as floods and harsh winters, and have had occasional conflicts with nearby kingdoms over border disputes. However, they remain committed to their beliefs and their connection to the unique continent they call home.

Anecdotes: Once, during a harsh winter, the members of the cult took in and cared for a group of travelers who were stranded on their journey through the mountains. The travelers later reported experiencing strange visions and vivid dreams during their stay.. There is a rumor that a member of the cult discovered a hidden chamber in the ruins containing ancient texts that describe a forgotten event that has yet to be fully understood.. Some have claimed to have witnessed members of the cult performing strange rituals in the dead of night, involving fire and blood.

Plot: The Cult of the Old One has been tasked with preserving the ancient ruins in the forest, but they are being threatened by a group of bandits who are seeking treasure. The players must help the cult fend off the bandits and protect the ruins.. A member of the cult possesses knowledge of an artifact that could bring great power to anyone who possesses it. The players must either retrieve the artifact for a powerful NPC, or decide whether to keep it for themselves or give it to the cult.. The players come across a group of travelers who have been haunted by visions and dreams after staying with the cult during a harsh winter. The players must help them unravel the mystery and discover what really happened during their stay with the cult.

Keywords: Religion, Cult, Sacrifice, Offering, Mystery

Goals keywords: preserving ancient ruins, deepening understanding of the Old One, fostering intellectual pursuits, maintaining balance with nature

  • Derry Gilroy - apprentice - novice

Prosperity: Adequate

Relationship: The Devout of the Non-Gendered God have a close relationship with the people of Luminia. While they are a separate group, they are respected and valued for their contributions to the village. They provide medicinal herbs and honey to those in need, and offer hospitality to travelers passing through. They also work with the village leadership to maintain the peace and security of the area.

History: The Devout of the Non-Gendered God was founded several decades ago by a group of scholars and adventurers who discovered the forgotten event that had caused the imbalance in nature. They built The Temple as a place of worship and teaching, and over time it has become a hub for spiritual and intellectual pursuits. The group has survived several natural disasters and repelled a bandit invasion, but they continue to face external influences that threaten their way of life.

Anecdotes: One member of The Devout of the Non-Gendered God, Derry Talbot, is renowned throughout Luminia for her knowledge of medicinal herbs. She has been called upon to treat everything from minor injuries to life-threatening illnesses, and has saved countless lives over the years. Another member, Cammy Talbot, once ventured into the ancient ruins on her own to search for a rare plant, but got lost and had to be rescued by her fellow villagers. Finally, the group once held a ceremony to honor the spirits of the forest, and during the ritual they sensed a disturbance in the balance of nature. Upon investigation, they discovered a group of goblin raiders who were poisoning the river and disrupting the ecosystem. Thanks to their intervention, the goblins were defeated and the natural balance was restored.

Plot: The Devout of the Non-Gendered God have learned of a group of outsiders who are planning to mine iron ore in the nearby mountains. While they appreciate the importance of trade and commerce, they fear that such activities will upset the delicate balance of nature and harm the local ecosystem. The group may seek the aid of the adventurers and scholars in Luminia to prevent the outsiders from carrying out their plans, or they may attempt to negotiate a compromise that allows for economic development while preserving the natural environment.

Keywords: Religion, Worship, Piety, Gods, Rituals

Goals keywords: balance, harmony, nature, understanding

The Ember Crafters

Type: Guild

Field: Business

Activity: Charcoal

Description: The Ember Crafters are a small group of skilled charcoal burners who specialize in creating high-quality charcoal for local blacksmiths and smelters. They take pride in their work and are known for their attention to detail and knowledge of the burning process.

Population: 4

Employees:

  • Bergin Forsythe - Apprentice - Novice
  • Katerine Raelthorne - Apprentice - Novice
  • Bixler Ironside - Apprentice - Novice

Prosperity: Adequate

Relationship: The Ember Crafters have a good relationship with the people of Luminia, especially the blacksmiths and smelters who rely on their high-quality charcoal. They are respected members of the community and often participate in local events and festivals.

History: The Ember Crafters were founded over a century ago by a group of enterprising charcoal burners who saw an opportunity to create a thriving business in the heart of the ancient forest. They started small, with just a handful of workers, but over time they built up their reputation and their client base, becoming one of the most respected charcoal production guilds in the region.

Anecdotes: One of the founding members of The Ember Crafters was said to have discovered the secret to creating high-quality charcoal while meditating in the forest. Another member, a notorious prankster, once filled the village square with smoke by accidentally setting fire to a batch of charcoal during a public demonstration. Yet another member, an eccentric inventor, created a new kind of charcoal oven that revolutionized the industry and helped The Ember Crafters stay ahead of their competition.

Plot: The Ember Crafters are faced with a crisis when a rival guild begins undercutting their prices and offering inferior quality charcoal. It's up to the players to help The Ember Crafters discover the rival guild's secret and put an end to their nefarious activities. Along the way, they'll need to navigate the treacherous politics of the local blacksmiths' guild and find allies in unexpected places.

Keywords: Charcoal, Firewood, Smelting, Burning, Oven

Goals keywords: quality, tradition, innovation, sustainability

The Forge of Luminia

Type: Guild

Field: Business

Activity: Blacksmithing

Description: The Forge of Luminia is a blacksmithing business located in Luminia. They specialize in working with iron and steel, and are well known for their high-quality tools and products. The guild is led by a group of skilled blacksmiths who have dedicated their lives to perfecting their craft.

Population: 4

Employees:

  • Birk Skarholt - senior - expert
  • Dorn Mallory - apprentice - novice
  • Golrick Hardwick - apprentice - novice
  • Helga - -

Prosperity: Prosperous

Relationship: The Forge of Luminia has a strong relationship with the people of Luminia. They are respected for their skill and dedication, and are often called upon to provide tools and equipment for other businesses in the village. They also have a good relationship with the local nobility, who value their craftsmanship and are willing to pay top dollar for their goods.

History: The Forge of Luminia was founded by a group of blacksmiths who came to Luminia over 50 years ago. They quickly gained a reputation for their skill and dedication, and soon became one of the most respected businesses in the village. Over the years, they have weathered many storms and have emerged stronger and more prosperous than ever before.

Anecdotes: Once, during the annual blacksmithing competition, Birk Skarholt created a sword so perfect that it was said to be blessed by Saint Dunstan himself.. During a particularly harsh winter, the members of the Ironmongers' Guild worked tirelessly to provide warm clothing and tools to the people of Luminia.. Legend has it that the founder of the guild, a mysterious figure known only as 'the Blacksmith', possessed a supernatural ability to forge weapons of incredible power.

Plot: The Forge of Luminia has been commissioned to create a powerful weapon for the local lord. But when it is stolen by a group of thieves, the guild must embark on a dangerous quest to retrieve it.. A new member has joined the guild, claiming to be a descendant of the legendary 'Blacksmith'. But there are those who are suspicious of his true motives.... The annual blacksmithing competition is coming up, and the guild is determined to win at all costs. But when a rival guild comes to town, things quickly spiral out of control.

Keywords: Blacksmithing, Iron, Steel, Forge, Tools

Goals keywords: Craftsmanship, Innovation, Quality, Tradition

The Guardian's Pact

Type: Team

Field: Administration

Activity: Security

Description: The Guardian's Pact is a group of highly skilled guards who are entrusted with maintaining the security and safety of Luminia at all times. They are trained in various techniques of combat and are adept at handling any threat that may arise within or outside the village. The members of the Guardian's Pact are not just guards, they are the protectors of the village, and their duty goes beyond just maintaining law and order.

Population: 6

Employees:

  • Darsey Kerrigan - senior - expert
  • Malek Brasher - apprentice - novice
  • Dardan Brasher - boss - master
  • Delp Scarrow - senior - expert
  • Delp Kerrigan - boss - master

Prosperity: Adequate

Relationship: The Guardian's Pact is highly respected within the village of Luminia. They have a close relationship with the villagers and are considered to be an integral part of the community. The Pact is also on friendly terms with the nearby tribe of forest-dwelling elves, and they often provide each other with assistance when needed.

History: The Guardian's Pact was formed after Luminia repelled a bandit invasion three decades ago. It was decided that the village needed a dedicated force to maintain its security and protect its citizens. The first members of the Pact were chosen from among the bravest and most capable warriors in the village. Over the years, the Guardian's Pact has gained a reputation for being one of the most skilled and reliable forces in the region.

Anecdotes: 1. Malek Brasher, a young and impulsive member of the Pact once saved a group of children who had wandered too far into the forest. He led them back to the village unharmed, despite being pursued by goblin raiders. 2. Delp Scarrow, a veteran member of the Guardian's Pact, once single-handedly defended the village from an attacking army of skeletons that had been raised by a dark wizard. 3. Darsey Kerrigan, one of the most skilled members of the Guardian's Pact, is rumored to have a secret lover who lives in a nearby village.

Plot: A group of outsiders arrives in Luminia, claiming to be peaceful travelers. However, as time passes, it becomes clear that they are actually spies sent by a nearby kingdom to gather information about Luminia's defenses. The Guardian's Pact must work together to uncover their true intentions and protect the village from enemy attacks.

Keywords: Security, Patrol, Law, Protection, Enforce

Goals keywords: security, protection, enforce, loyalty

History: The Harvest Guild was founded by a group of farmers and artisans who saw the potential for growth in the land surrounding Luminia. They worked tirelessly to cultivate the soil and build a thriving community centered around their work. Over the years, they have weathered natural disasters, invasions, and conflicts with neighboring kingdoms, but their commitment to Luminia has never wavered.

Anecdotes: 1. After a particularly devastating flood destroyed their crops, The Harvest Guild banded together to rebuild their farms and replant the soil. Their resilience and determination inspired the rest of the village, and brought them closer together. 2. One year, during the Harvest Festival, a competition was held to see who could grow the largest pumpkin. The winning pumpkin was so large that it had to be carried by a team of oxen! 3. A group of travelers passing through Luminia once remarked that they had never tasted better honey than the kind produced by The Harvest Guild.

Plot: The Harvest Guild is facing a new threat to their crops from a mysterious blight that is spreading across the land. They must work together to find a solution before it's too late!. A neighboring village is in need of help after a natural disaster destroys their crops and leaves them without food for the winter. The Harvest Guild must decide whether to share their resources or keep them for their own needs.. A group of bandits is targeting The Harvest Guild's shipments of goods and causing disruption to their trade network. The Guild must find a way to stop the bandits and protect their livelihoods.. The Harvest Guild discovers a new crop that has the potential to revolutionize their trade, but it requires a risky investment of time and resources. They must decide whether to take the chance and reap the rewards, or play it safe and stick to their tried and true methods.

Keywords: Farming, Agriculture, Crops, Harvest, Fields

Goals keywords: sustainability, productivity, innovation, community

Sites

The Fields

Type: landscape

State: in use

Details: a series of contiguous cultivated lands, enclosed by fences and irrigated

Inherits architecture: False

Architecture: organized, vast, fertile, green, fenced, irrigated

Type: building

State: in use

Details: a small wooden building with a warm fireplace and a homely atmosphere

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: timber-framed, welcoming, cozy, smoky, inviting

Type: street

State: in use

Details: a large open square surrounded by canopies where The Harvest Guild bring their goods to sell

Inherits architecture: False

Architecture: open-air, colorful, lively, crowded, booming

The Mill

Type: building

State: in use

Details: old stone watermill that is still in operation, the sound of the water wheel can be heard from afar

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: rustic, stone-built, water-powered, busy, aromatic

The Living Trees Guild

Type: Guild

Field: Business

Activity: Woodcarving

Description: The Living Trees Guild is a group of skilled woodcarvers based in Luminia, known for their breathtaking wooden sculptures and intricate carvings. The guild was founded by a group of artists who came together to share their passion for woodcarving, and has since become an important part of the village's cultural heritage.

Population: 4

Employees:

  • Kerr Bancroft - senior - expert
  • Gade Rhinehart - apprentice - novice
  • Rudd Halstead - apprentice - beginner

Prosperity: Adequate

Relationship: The Living Trees Guild is an integral part of the Luminia community, providing not only beautiful works of art for locals and visitors to admire, but also opportunities for young people to learn the craft of woodcarving. The guild has strong ties with other local businesses and organizations, and often collaborates with them on projects and events. Members of the guild are well-respected in the village, and are often called upon to create custom pieces for special occasions.

History: The Living Trees Guild was founded over a century ago by a group of woodcarvers who wanted to elevate their craft to a higher level. They worked tirelessly to perfect their skills, and eventually gained recognition throughout the region for their stunning wooden sculptures and carvings. Today, the guild continues to thrive, with new members joining every year to carry on the tradition of excellence established by their forebears.

Anecdotes: Legend has it that the guild's founder, a reclusive woodcarver known simply as 'the master', discovered the secret to unlocking the beauty of living trees in his later years. He passed this knowledge on to his apprentices, who went on to become some of the greatest woodcarvers of their time. In more recent times, a young girl from Luminia was inspired by a visit to the annual guild exhibition to take up woodcarving herself. She worked tirelessly at her craft, and eventually became a respected member of the guild, creating her own beautiful works of art.

Plot: A rival woodcarving guild from a neighboring village challenges The Living Trees Guild to a carving competition, sparking a fierce rivalry that threatens to tear both communities apart. An ambitious young woodcarver joins The Living Trees Guild, determined to create a masterpiece that will bring him fame and fortune, but soon discovers that true artistic success comes from within. A devastating fire destroys The Guild Hall, forcing the members of The Living Trees Guild to band together and rebuild their beloved community.

Keywords: Woodcarving, Sculpture, Statues, Decor, Chisel

Goals keywords: preserving nature through art, elevating woodcarving as a profession, inspiring new generations of woodcarvers, fostering creativity and innovation

Sites

The Carving Studio

Type: building

State: inhabited

Details: a spacious workshop filled with the sounds of chisels on wood and the smell of freshly sawn wood

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: wooden walls, carved wooden beams, workbenches, tool racks, sawdust on the floor, natural light

The Exhibition Hall

Type: building

State: inhabited

Details: a gallery with large windows letting in natural light, displaying beautifully carved wooden sculptures

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: brightly lit interior, open floor plan, carefully curated displays, decorative sculptures, inviting spaces, welcoming atmosphere

Type: building

State: inhabited

Details: a grand hall with intricate wood carvings adorning the walls and a high ceiling, filled with natural light

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: large wooden building, ornate carvings, stained glass windows, stone pillars, spacious interior, well-lit

The Lucky Catchers

Type: Guild

Field: Business

Activity: Fishing

Description: The Lucky Catchers are a group of skilled and hard-working fishermen who pride themselves on their ability to provide the freshest fish for Luminia's inhabitants. They have developed a close-knit community, relying on each other's strengths to ensure that they can make a living off the sea. The guild is led by an elected representative, who serves as a mediator in any disputes and oversees the general welfare of the group.

Population: 4

Employees:

  • Barl Dorgun - apprentice - novice
  • Torey Ironside - apprentice - expert
  • Luan Enabarr - apprentice - novice

Prosperity: Adequate

Relationship: The Lucky Catchers are an integral part of Luminia's economy, providing a crucial source of protein for its inhabitants. They have a good relationship with the village, as they are able to provide fresh fish quickly and efficiently. They also have a good relationship with nearby tribes of forest-dwelling elves, who appreciate their focus on sustainability.

History: The Lucky Catchers were established over a century ago by a group of fisherman who saw the potential for a thriving fishing industry in Luminia. They have survived natural disasters, including a particularly destructive storm that destroyed many of their boats and gear. However, they rebuilt their livelihood and have continued to provide for the village.

Anecdotes: The Lucky Catchers once caught a rare species of fish that had never been seen before in Luminia, causing great excitement and intrigue amongst the villagers. They also saved a family of travelers who were stranded at sea during a storm, earning them gratitude and respect. On a more humorous note, they once caught so many fish that they overwhelmed the village's market and had to improvise a fish fry to use up their excess catch.

Plot: The Lucky Catchers are facing a sudden decline in fish populations and must find innovative ways to sustain themselves without depleting the sea. In their search for new fishing grounds, they come across a mysterious underwater cavern that seems to hold a bounty of fish. However, they soon realize that the cavern is guarded by a powerful sea monster, and they must decide whether to risk their lives to secure a stable future for their guild.

Keywords: Fishing, Fish, Nets, Boats, Sea

Goals keywords: sustainability, efficiency, innovation, cooperation

Sites

The Dock

Type: building

State: in use

Details: a long wooden pier that extends into the calm waters of the lake, moored boats and fishing nets drying in the sun

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: wooden, pier, nautical, functional, fishy, practical

Type: building

State: in use

Details: a large wooden warehouse with ropes hanging from the ceiling, stacks of nets piled up in corners, and the smell of fish scales permeating the air

Inherits architecture: True

State: inhabited

Details: a small wooden hut nestled along the shore, colorful buoys hanging on the walls, fishing gear strewn about, and the warm hearth emitting a welcoming glow

Inherits architecture: True

The Luminarian Society of Ideologies

Type: Cooperative

Field: Ideologies

Activity: Scholarship

Description: The Luminarian Society of Ideologies is a group of intellectuals residing in Luminia whose goal is to promote and elevate scholarship and philosophy. They believe that knowledge is paramount in achieving a stable and prosperous society.

Population: 8

Employees:

  • Bullin Blackitt - senior - expert
  • Muriel Ironside - apprentice - novice
  • Phineas Darkmantle - junior - novice
  • Beck Kerrigan - junior - novice
  • Katerine Mallory - boss - master
  • Katerine Darkmantle - senior - expert

Prosperity: Adequate

Relationship: The society enjoys a respected place in Luminia's society, being seen as a beacon of rationality and wisdom. Their library is open to all and is a valuable resource for the village. The Society has been known to provide counsel to the village council on important matters.

History: In its early days, The Luminarian Society of Ideologies was a small group of individuals who sought to preserve the ancient texts found during the excavation of the ruins in the forest. Over time, the society grew in number and scope, becoming an integral part of Luminia's intellectual and cultural landscape.

Anecdotes: One prominent member, Katerine Darkmantle, was inspired to compose a ballad about the ancient ruins in the forest after spending many days studying their inscriptions. Another time, a disagreement arose among members over the true nature of the Old One, with some members advocating a more scientific view, while others took a more spiritual approach. This led to a heated debate that lasted for days, with both sides eventually agreeing to disagree. Finally, there is a story of a young apprentice named Phineas who accidentally set fire to a portion of the library, but was able to save most of the books by using his artistic talent to create makeshift fireproof covers.

Plot: The society discovers an ancient text that sheds new light on the history of Luminia. However, the text is written in an unknown language and the society must work together to decipher it. Along the way, they face challenges from outside groups who seek to prevent the knowledge from being uncovered.. A new member joins the society who challenges the traditionalist views of some members. This leads to tension within the group, and eventually to a schism. The two factions must then compete to prove their respective theories through research and experimentation.. A prominent member of the society is found dead under mysterious circumstances. The other members must work together to uncover the truth behind their colleague's death and bring the perpetrator to justice.

Keywords: Scholarship, Knowledge, Library, Philosophy, Research

Goals keywords: education, intellectualism, knowledge preservation, research

Inherits architecture: True

The Luminia Entertainers

Type: Team

Field: Hobbies

Activity: Music

Description: The Luminia Entertainers are a group of talented performers who specialize in music, singing, poetry and entertainment. They are known throughout the village for their lively performances and charismatic personalities, and are often sought out to provide entertainment for festivals and celebrations.

Population: 5

Employees:

  • Jarok Ainsworth - boss - master
  • Orla Atwood - apprentice - novice
  • Herne Urdro - senior - expert
  • Amery Darkmantle - apprentice - novice

Prosperity: Poor

Relationship: The Luminia Entertainers are deeply ingrained in the life of the village, and enjoy a close relationship with its residents. They often perform at festivals and special events, and are welcomed into homes and businesses throughout Luminia. In turn, they contribute to the cultural richness of the village and help bring joy and entertainment to the people.

History: The Luminia Entertainers were founded decades ago by a group of traveling musicians who stumbled upon the village and were charmed by its beauty and hospitality. Over time, they became a beloved fixture in the community, entertaining locals and visitors alike with their enchanting performances.

Anecdotes: The Luminia Entertainers are known for their ability to improvise and adapt to any situation. Once, during a particularly rainy festival, they had to perform inside a cramped tavern instead of their usual outdoor stage. Undaunted, they transformed the small space into an intimate and vibrant concert hall, using every corner and surface available to them.

Plot: The Luminia Entertainers are approached by a traveling theater troupe who challenge them to a musical showdown.. One of the band members has a secret past that threatens to disrupt the group's harmony.. The group is offered a chance to perform for a wealthy benefactor, but must navigate the tricky politics of high society.. A mysterious figure from the group's past resurfaces, challenging them to a musical duel to settle an old score.. The Luminia Entertainers are invited to a neighboring village's festival, but soon discover that it is haunted by malevolent spirits.

Keywords: Music, Entertainment, Instruments, Singing, Poetry

Goals keywords: entertainment, artistic expression, community engagement, performing excellence

The Navigators' Alliance

Type: Guild

Field: Business

Activity: Sailing

Description: The Navigators' Alliance is a tight-knit group of sailors and cartographers who share a passion for sailing and exploring the vast unknown seas. They are a band of experts in navigation, mapping, and sea trade. The members of the alliance are united by their love for adventure, and their desire to explore the greatest mysteries of the sea.

Population: 3

Employees:

  • Una Villius - senior - expert
  • Garrett Voyle - boss - master

Prosperity: Adequate

Relationship: The Navigators' Alliance is an important part of life in Luminia. The guild's sailors and cartographers play a critical role in maintaining the prosperity of the village by bringing in valuable resources from far-off lands. The people of Luminia hold the members of the guild in high esteem, and the alliance enjoys a special status in the community.

History: The Navigators' Alliance was founded over a century ago by a group of explorers who had grown tired of the mundane life on land. Together, they set off on a great adventure to explore the unknown regions of the sea. Over time, the guild grew in size and influence, becoming a major force in seafaring and trade.

Anecdotes: Legend has it that the founder of the guild, Captain Alistair, was gifted a map to a lost island by the non-gendered God of the local beliefs. The island is said to be filled with untold riches and wonders, but no one has ever been able to find it.. During a particularly treacherous storm at sea, the members of the guild rallied together to save their ship from certain destruction. Their bravery and skill in navigation earned them much respect and admiration among their peers.. There is a rumor that one of the guild's sailors, a mysterious woman named Una Villius, knows the location of a hidden underwater city that is said to contain ancient artifacts of great value.

Plot: A rival guild seeks to disrupt the Navigators' Alliance's trade routes and reputation. One of the guild's ships goes missing under mysterious circumstances, and the members must investigate. The alliance discovers a new continent across the seas, filled with danger and wonder

Keywords: Sailing, Navigation, Fish, Trade, Map

Goals keywords: Exploration, Discovery, Trade, Community

The Prosperity League

Type: Guild

Field: Business

Activity: Finance

Description: The Prosperity League is a group of skilled financiers and businessmen dedicated to the economic growth and stability of Luminia. From managing credit and loans, to investing and generating profits, these individuals are experts in their field.

Population: 3

Employees:

  • Vidor Fenwick - boss - master
  • Brock Ironside - apprentice - novice

Prosperity: Prosperous

Relationship: The Prosperity League is highly regarded in Luminia for their contributions to the village's economic prosperity. They work closely with other businesses and trade partners to ensure the financial well-being of the entire community. However, some villagers view the League as elitist and out of touch with the struggles of the common folk.

History: The League was founded by Vidor Fenwick and Brock Ironside after years of working together as bankers in Luminia. They saw the need for a centralized group of finance experts who could guide the economic growth and stability of the village. Over the years, the Prosperity League has earned a reputation as reliable and trustworthy financial advisors.

Anecdotes: One year, the Prosperity League donated a significant portion of their profits to rebuilding a local orphanage that had been destroyed in a fire. Their efforts helped provide shelter and resources for the young children of Luminia. During a heated town meeting, a member of the League was accused of exploiting struggling villagers for profit. The accusations were ultimately proven false, but the incident damaged the League's reputation among some members of the community. The League once hosted an extravagant gala to celebrate their success and raise funds for their charity event. However, the event was disrupted by a group of goblin raiders who caused chaos and destruction throughout the village.

Plot: The League is approached by a wealthy merchant from a neighboring village seeking investment opportunities, but the merchant has ulterior motives that could lead to disaster for both parties. The League must navigate this risky situation to prevent financial ruin.. A rival group of bankers from another village threatens to disrupt the economic stability of Luminia. The League must fight to defend their clients and uphold their reputation as the go-to financial advisors in the region.. One of the League's top employees suddenly disappears, leaving behind a trail of financial discrepancies and suspicious activity. The League must investigate their colleague's disappearance and clear their name before they are implicated in a scandal.

Keywords: Finance, Credit, Loans, Investment, Profit

Goals keywords: economic growth, financial stability, transparency, client satisfaction

The Shadow Network

Type: Corporation

Field: Secret Societies

Activity: Spying

Description: The Shadow Network is a clandestine group of spies and infiltrators that operate in the shadows of Luminia. They use their extensive knowledge of local beliefs, customs and traditions to blend in with the common folk and gather information for their clients. Their services are sought after by both wealthy merchants and powerful nobles.

Population: 3

Employees:

  • Brona Denby - senior - expert
  • Devlin Enabarr - apprentice - novice

Prosperity: Adequate

Relationship: The Shadow Network maintains a tenuous relationship with the people of Luminia. While many view them as a necessary evil that helps keep the village safe from external threats, others see them as a dangerous and subversive force that threatens the peace and stability of the community. The leadership of the group is constantly on guard against those who might seek to expose their activities and undermine their power.

History: The Shadow Network was founded decades ago by a group of disgruntled scholars and adventurers who were disillusioned with the state of affairs in Luminia. They believed that secrets were the key to power and sought to create a network of spies and informants to gain an edge over their rivals. Over the years, the group has grown in size and influence, becoming one of the most feared and respected organizations in the region.

Anecdotes: One popular story tells of how The Shadow Network once managed to infiltrate the household of a powerful noble family by posing as servants. Over the course of several months, they gathered information on the family's secrets and vulnerabilities, ultimately leading to their downfall. Another anecdote speaks of a daring spy who successfully infiltrated a rival organization and was able to gather intelligence that led to the arrest of several key members.

Plot: The Shadow Network is hired by a wealthy merchant to gather information on his business rivals. As they delve deeper into the inner workings of the other merchant's operations, they uncover a web of corruption and deceit that threatens to destabilize the entire economy of Luminia. With their client's interests at stake, The Shadow Network must decide whether to use their knowledge to gain power and influence or to expose the truth and risk everything they've built.

Keywords: Spying, Infiltration, Compliance, Blackmail, Gatekeeping

Goals keywords: knowledge, power, secrecy, influence

The Sole Savers

Type: Guild

Field: Business

Activity: Shoemaking

Description: The Sole Savers is a small guild made up of three talented shoemakers. They produce high-quality footwear for the people of Luminia and beyond, using only the finest materials and traditional techniques.

Population: 3

Employees:

  • Durgan Vain - apprentice - novice
  • wyn'Talyththi Coralaeth - boss - master

Prosperity: Adequate

Relationship: The Sole Savers are well-regarded in Luminia and have a good relationship with the villagers. They work closely with local farmers to source high-quality leather and other materials for their shoes, and often participate in village events and festivals. The group also has a friendly rivalry with the tailors' guild, with whom they often collaborate on fashion shows and fashion-forward style events.

History: The Sole Savers has been a respected part of Luminia for generations, with many families relying on them for their footwear needs. Despite facing challenges from cheaper, mass-produced shoes from neighboring kingdoms, the guild has managed to stay afloat due to their commitment to quality.

Anecdotes: Once, the Sole Savers managed to create a pair of shoes so comfortable that a local bard declared them to be 'the most comfortable shoes in the land'. This led to an influx of demand from neighboring kingdoms, who were amazed at the quality of the craftsmen's work. Another time, during a particularly harsh winter, the guild worked around the clock to produce shoes for the villagers who were battling the elements. It was a true testament to their dedication to their craft and their community. In a different anecdote, Durgan Vain managed to make a pair of shoes so fine that they were rumored to have magical properties. Some say that the wearer of these shoes could dance for days without tiring.

Plot: The Sole Savers are hired by a mysterious traveler to craft a pair of special shoes that will take him to a hidden treasure deep in the mountains. One of the members of The Sole Savers is accused of stealing a shipment of valuable leather from a rival shoemaker, and must prove his innocence while navigating political intrigue in Luminia. The guild discovers a rare type of leather from a previously unknown animal, leading to great demand and increased profits, but also attracting unwanted attention and competition from rival shoemakers.

Keywords: Shoemaking, Leather, Sewing, Nails, Soles

Goals keywords: Innovation, Quality, Sustainability, Community

The Stablemasters' Association

Type: Guild

Field: Business

Activity: Horse Breeding

Description: The Stablemasters' Association is a group of skilled equestrians who specialize in breeding and training horses. They are known for their exceptional knowledge of horse husbandry, from nutrition and grooming to selecting the best breeding pairs. The members of the association take great pride in their work and have a deep appreciation for the beauty and grace of these magnificent animals.

Population: 4

Employees:

  • Bixler Voyle - apprentice - novice
  • Kealey Brasher - boss - expert
  • Egan Halstead - senior - advanced

Prosperity: Moderate

Relationship: The Stablemasters' Association has strong ties to the people of Luminia. They provide horses for transportation, farming, and military purposes, and are respected for their expertise and professionalism. The association also works closely with other groups in the region, such as the local farmers and blacksmiths, to ensure that Luminia remains prosperous and secure.

History: The Stablemasters' Association was founded over a century ago by a group of skilled equestrians who saw the need for a more organized approach to horse breeding and training in Luminia. Over the years, the group has grown and become an important part of the village's economy and culture.

Anecdotes: One member of the association, Kealey Brasher, is well-known for her expertise in Luminia's history. She often regales visitors to the horse exhibition with stories of the village's past, and is a beloved figure among the locals. Another member, Egan Halstead, is a skilled warrior who has used his equestrian training to great effect on the battlefield. His courage and bravery have earned him the respect and admiration of his fellow association members. Finally, Bixler Voyle, a young and ambitious breeder, is known for his innovative techniques and willingness to take risks. He is considered a rising star among the group, and many believe that he will one day lead the association to even greater heights.

Plot: A wealthy merchant from a neighboring city wants to buy the entire stock of horses from the Stablemasters' Association, but rumors abound that he plans to use them for nefarious purposes. The association must decide whether to sell the horses and risk their reputation, or refuse and risk angering a potentially dangerous customer.. One of the association's most prized stallions goes missing just before the annual exhibition. The members suspect foul play, and launch an investigation to find the thief and retrieve the horse before the show begins.. A rival group of horse breeders, envious of the Stablemasters' Association's success, begins spreading rumors and sabotaging their operations. The association must find a way to uncover the source of the attacks and put a stop to them before they cause serious harm.

Keywords: Horse Breeding, Stables, Equestrian, Saddle, Hoof

Goals keywords: breeding, training, equestrianism, market expansion

Inherits architecture: False

Architecture: open field, fences, obstacles

The Timbermen Guild

Type: Cooperative

Field: Work

Activity: Lumberjacking

Description: The Timbermen Guild is a close-knit community of lumberjacks who have lived and worked together in the forests surrounding Luminia for generations. They are skilled at felling trees with their trusty axes and using the timber to provide valuable resources to the village. While they may seem rough around the edges, they are fierce defenders of their way of life and take great pride in their work.

Population: 12

Employees:

  • Shay Langworth - apprentice - novice
  • Orla Langworth - apprentice - novice
  • Brone Langworth - boss - expert
  • Malek Langworth - apprentice - novice
  • Dowd Langworth - senior - journeyman
  • Wolfe Atwood - journeyman - expert
  • Bryson Villius - senior - master
  • Kearey Voyle - apprentice - novice
  • Dunla Villius - senior - journeyman
  • Wyatt Langworth - apprentice - novice

Prosperity: Poor

Relationship: The relationship between the Timbermen Guild and Luminia is mutually beneficial. The guild provides valuable resources to the village, while the villagers support the timbermen by purchasing their goods and offering them hospitality when they come into town. The guild also maintains friendly relations with the nearby tribe of forest-dwelling elves, trading with them for rare herbs and knowledge of the forest.

History: The Timbermen Guild has been active since the founding of Luminia, providing the village with the timber it needs to thrive. They have weathered many storms and natural disasters, always emerging stronger and more resilient than before. They are proud of their heritage and are dedicated to passing on their knowledge and skills to the next generation.

Anecdotes: The Timbermen Guild is known for its tall tales and brave deeds. One member, Shay Langworth, once saved an entire group of lumberjacks from a pack of wolves by luring them away with a song. Another member, Bryson Villius, has been known to fell trees with a single swing of his axe. And yet another member, Kearey Voyle, dreams of becoming a scholar and uses her free time to read and study the ancient texts found in the ruins nearby.

Plot: A massive flood threatens to destroy the Timbermen Guild's logging operation, and they must use all their skills and resources to prevent a disaster.. The guild discovers a rare type of timber that could revolutionize the village's economy, but they must protect it from rival lumberjacks and dangerous creatures.. One of the members of the guild is accused of stealing from a neighboring village, and the guild must clear their friend's name and find the real culprit.

Keywords: Lumberjacking, Wood, Axe, Forest, Timber

Goals keywords: resource management, tradition preservation, community building, skills improvement

Sites

the clearing

Type: clearing

State: inhabited

Details: A large clearing in the forest where the workers gather around a circle of stumps to socialize and enjoy the warmth of the bonfire at night.

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: stumps encircling a fire pit, stacks of logs, minimalist design, natural materials, functional

the forest camp

Type: camp

State: inhabited

Details: A series of rustic log cabins that blend in with the forest, built on wooden platforms above the ground.

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: log cabins, wooden platforms, simple construction, minimalist design, natural materials, functional

the riverbank mill

Type: mill

State: inhabited

Details: A cute rustic watermill located by the river. The sound of the water wheel makes it a peaceful and soothing environment.

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: rustic watermill, wooden waterwheel, functional design, natural materials, ingenious mechanisms

The Toothed Belt Guild

Type: Cooperative

Field: Work

Activity: Engineering

Description: The Toothed Belt Guild is a small group of mechanics and engineers dedicated to advancing the field of automation in Luminia. They specialize in designing and building intricate machines powered by toothed belts, which they believe are more efficient than other methods of power transmission. The Toothed Belt Guild is known for their hard work, attention to detail, and determination to push the boundaries of what is possible with machines.

Population: 5

Employees:

  • Waldron Ellsworth - senior - expert
  • Harlan Pendrake - apprentice - novice
  • Bryson Bannister - senior - master
  • Evelyn Ironside - apprentice - novice

Prosperity: Poor

Relationship: The Toothed Belt Guild is a respected member of the Luminian community, known for their contributions to the local economy and intellectual pursuits. While they do not interact much with the general population, they have a good relationship with the local scholars and academics, who appreciate their dedication to innovation and problem-solving.

History: The Toothed Belt Guild was founded over a decade ago by a group of like-minded individuals who shared a passion for engineering and automation. Over the years, they have built a reputation as the go-to experts for anything related to toothed belts and machines. While they have faced their fair share of challenges, including government regulations and competition from other guilds, they remain steadfast in their commitment to advancing their craft.

Anecdotes: Once, Waldron Ellsworth stayed up for three days straight trying to fix a particularly challenging machine. When he finally succeeded, the entire guild celebrated with honey mead and a parade through the town square.. Harlan Pendrake once designed a machine that could knit an entire sweater in under an hour. It was so efficient that it put several local seamstresses out of business, causing a small controversy in the village.. Bryson Bannister once swore that he would retire from the guild if they were unable to build a machine that could make the perfect batch of cheese. After months of experimenting and tweaking, they finally succeeded, much to Bryson's delight.

Plot: The Toothed Belt Guild has been hired by a neighboring village to design and build a machine that can harvest their crops more efficiently. However, they soon discover that the real challenge is not in building the machine, but in navigating the politics and power struggles of the village leaders.. The annual toothed belt machine competition is coming up, and tensions are running high as each member of the guild tries to outdo the others. However, when one of the machines unexpectedly malfunctions during the competition, it will take all of their combined skills to figure out what went wrong.. Rumors are spreading that a group of bandits is planning to raid the Toothed Belt Workshop in order to steal their plans for a new machine. The guild must come up with a plan to defend their workshop before it's too late.

Keywords: Engineering, Machines, Gears, Toothed Belt, Automation

Goals keywords: advancing automation, toothed belt technology, efficiency, innovation

Sites

The Honey Mead Inn

Type: inn

State: inhabited

Details: A cozy tavern with wooden walls and dim lighting. The air is filled with the smell of honey and mead.

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: timber-framed, thatched roof, wooden interior, cozy, rustic, traditional

The Machine Market

Type: marketplace

State: inhabited

Details: An open-air market filled with noise from machines and demonstrations. The bright sign advertises Toothed Belt Guild products.

Inherits architecture: False

Architecture: open-air market, tents, demonstration machines, colorful, crowded, noisy

The Toothed Belt Workshop

Type: building

State: inhabited

Details: A small brick building with a chimney spewing black smoke. The windows are covered in oil stains and large gears are visible from outside.

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: brick building, chimney, mechanical elements, industrial, simple, functional

The Wayfinders

Type: Team

Field: Adventure

Activity: Exploration

Description: The Wayfinders are a group of explorers who seek adventure and discovery beyond the safety of Luminia. With a diverse team of experts, they navigate treacherous landscapes, confront monstrous beasts, uncover hidden treasures, and chart maps of uncharted territories.

Population: 10

Employees:

  • Hedwig Blackitt - senior - expert
  • Artis Alkott - senior - expert
  • Ennis Alkott - boss - master
  • Burnev Blackitt - senior - expert
  • Stianna Denby - senior - master
  • Crowle Denby - senior - expert
  • Kerr Denby - senior - expert
  • Dragar Blackitt - boss - master

Prosperity: Moderate

Relationship: The Wayfinders have a strong bond with Luminia, as many of its members were born and raised in the village. They share its customs, traditions, and values, and often bring back resources and knowledge that benefit the community. They also act as the first line of defense against external threats, warning the villagers of incoming dangers.

History: The Wayfinders emerged from a group of young adventurers who sought to explore the uncharted regions beyond Luminia's borders. They learned from the best scholars and navigators of the village and formed a tight-knit team of specialists who shared their thirst for discovery. Over the years, the Wayfinders have mapped vast swathes of land, discovered hidden treasures, and unlocked secrets buried deep in ancient ruins.

Anecdotes: On one expedition, the Wayfinders encountered a tribe of elves who had been isolated from civilization for centuries. Through patience and respect, they managed to establish communication and exchange knowledge, opening a new chapter in Luminia's cultural history. On another occasion, they narrowly escaped a sandstorm that threatened to bury them alive, relying on their wits and skills to find shelter and reach safety.

Plot: The Wayfinders are hired by a wealthy merchant to escort him through the dangerous mountains to a secret dungeon rumored to hold a valuable artifact. However, they soon discover that the merchant has other plans, and they must decide whether to fulfill their contract or stop his treacherous schemes.. The group hears rumors of a hidden temple deep in the jungle, dedicated to an ancient god with immense power. But as they venture closer, they encounter fierce resistance from a rival faction who seeks to claim the temple for themselves. Will they be able to secure the temple's secrets before it's too late?. One member of the Wayfinders receives a cryptic message from a distant relative, asking for help in unraveling a mystery surrounding a forgotten event in their family's past. The group sets out on a quest that leads them across the continent, delving into dark secrets and ancient lore.

Keywords: Exploration, Discovery, Treasure, Monsters, Map

Goals keywords: Exploration, Discovery, Adventure, Knowledge

Sites

The Ancient Ruins

Type: ruin

State: abandoned

Details: an underground ruin located beneath the ancient forest near Luminia, with dark and foreboding atmosphere and overgrown with moss and ivy

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: crumbling, overgrown, mysterious glyphs, dark and foreboding, natural springs, enchanted pathways

The Underground Catacombs

Type: underground

State: abandoned

Details: a set of dark and damp tunnels underneath Luminia, rumored to be haunted by the spirits of ancient settlers

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: rusty iron doors, damp walls lined with fungi

The Wayfarer's Inn

Type: inn

State: inhabited

Details: a cozy inn in Luminia, known for its famous honey mead

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: timber-framed, thatched roofs, wooden balconies

Vintner's Guild

Type: Family

Field: Work

Activity: Winemaking

Description: The Vintner's Guild is a small, family-owned winery located in Luminia. The Guild is run by Ansel Rolfe and his wife Erris, with help from their daughter Rosaleen and Keavey Rolfe, Ansel's mother. They produce a variety of wines from grapes grown in their vineyards along the river. The Vintner's Guild prides themselves on their attention to detail and their commitment to producing high-quality wines.

Population: 5

Employees:

  • Ansel Rolfe - apprentice - novice
  • Erris Voyle - boss - expert
  • Keavey Rolfe - senior - journeyman
  • Rosaleen Rolfe - apprentice - novice

Prosperity: Poor

Relationship: The Vintner's Guild has a close relationship with the people of Luminia, providing them with high-quality wines and a sense of local pride. They have also established relationships with nearby villages and cities, exporting their wines and bringing trade to Luminia.

History: The Vintner's Guild was founded over a century ago by Ansel's great-grandfather. Over the years, it has weathered storms, floods, and droughts, but has managed to maintain its status as a staple of the Luminian community.

Anecdotes: Ansel and Erris were childhood sweethearts who bonded over their shared love of wine-making. Keavey is the last surviving member of the Rolfe family to remember the founding of the Guild. Rosaleen has a natural talent for wine-tasting and is being groomed as the future head winemaker of the Guild

Plot: The Vintner's Guild is approached by a wealthy foreigner who wants to invest in their winery, but secretly has malicious intentions. A rival wine-making guild accuses the Vintner's Guild of stealing their grape crop, leading to a heated legal battle. The Vintner's Guild discovers that one of their new wines has a mysterious, almost-magical effect on those who drink it, attracting both the adventurous and the corrupt

Keywords: Winemaking, Grapes, Vines, Wine Cellar, Tasting

Goals keywords: expand production, establish a larger customer base, win international awards, innovate new wine-making techniques

Sites

Type: building

State: inhabited

Details: A small farmhouse surrounded by sprawling vineyards, with a modern wine cellar and a rustic outdoor seating area.

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: small farmhouse, vineyards, modern wine cellar, rustic outdoor seating area

Type: building

State: inhabited

Details: A cozy tasting room in the town square, with a timber-framed structure, thatched roofs, cobblestone streets, and ornate carvings.

Inherits architecture: True

Architecture: timber-framed, thatched roofs, cobblestone streets, ornate carvings

Wandering Wayfarers

Type: Team

Field: Wanderers

Activity: Nomads

Description: The Wandering Wayfarers are a group of nomads who have chosen the moonlit path as their home. They travel from place to place, seeking adventure and survival in equal measure. The campfire is their home, and the open road is their way of life. They are a tight-knit group, bound together by their shared love of the journey.

Population: 10

Employees:

  • Sartine Hardwick - apprentice - novice
  • Kelsey Mallory - senior - expert
  • Alvy Kerrigan - apprentice - novice
  • Morna Halstead - boss - master
  • Cammy Grayden - apprentice - novice
  • Durwin Hitch - boss - expert
  • Fargas Mallory - apprentice - novice
  • Cacey Mallory - senior - expert

Prosperity: Poor

Relationship: The Wandering Wayfarers are known in Luminia as a group of adventurers and explorers. They are respected for their tenacity and resourcefulness, and often provide valuable information about the dangers and opportunities that lie beyond the village's borders. The villagers are happy to provide the travelers with food and supplies, knowing that they will always return with fascinating stories to tell.

History: The Wandering Wayfarers have been traveling together for several years, always seeking new sights and experiences. They have faced many challenges along the way, from natural disasters to bandit attacks. Despite these obstacles, they have remained united and steadfast in their mission to explore the world around them.

Anecdotes: One night, while camping in the forest, the Wayfarers were visited by a group of fairies who danced around their fire until dawn. Another time, they stumbled upon an abandoned castle and decided to spend the night there. They were awakened by the sound of ghostly laughter, but managed to scare off the spirits by loudly singing an old drinking song. One member of the group, Fargas Mallory, was caught trying to steal from a local merchant and had to be bailed out by his fellow travelers.

Plot: The Wandering Wayfarers stumble upon a hidden valley that is said to contain a powerful artifact. They must navigate treacherous terrain and battle fierce creatures to reach the valley and claim the prize. However, they soon realize that there are other groups who are also seeking the artifact, and they must race against time to get there first.

Keywords: Nomads, Traveling, Campfire, Adventures, Survival

Goals keywords: adventure, freedom, survival, discovery

White Rapids Transport

Type: Guild

Field: Business

Activity: Rafting

Description: White Rapids Transport is the most reliable and trustworthy source of transport and cargo handling in all of Luminia. The members of the guild are all experts in navigating the treacherous white water rapids that run through the region, using their specially made rafts to transport goods and people safely and efficiently. Whether you need to transport a shipment of timber downstream or simply want a thrilling ride through the rapids, the Rivermen's Guild is the place to go.

Population: 4

Employees:

  • Ruibrarii Coralaeth - apprentice - novice
  • Ennis Gilroy - senior - expert
  • Enda Voyle - boss - master

Prosperity: Adequate

Relationship: White Rapids Transport has a strong relationship with the people of Luminia, who rely on them for transport and trade. The guild also has a good relationship with the nearby tribe of forest-dwelling elves, who often provide them with guidance on navigating the river and avoiding dangerous areas. Occasionally, the Rivermen's Guild has conflicts with nearby kingdoms over disputes related to river access and resources, but they always try to resolve these conflicts peacefully.

History: White Rapids Transport was founded by a group of skilled rafters who were looking for a way to make a living while doing what they loved - navigating the rapids of the river. Over time, they became known as the most skilled and dedicated boatmen in the region, and their reputation for reliability and safety grew. Today, the guild is a thriving business that continues to grow and expand.

Anecdotes: One member of the guild, Ruibrarii Coralaeth, once navigated the rapids blindfolded as part of a dare from some visiting adventurers. They made it through without incident, much to the amazement of the onlookers. Another member, Ennis Gilroy, once sang an impromptu song at the inn about the beauty of the river, inspiring many of the listeners to take up rafting themselves. And Enda Voyle, the oldest member of the guild, once managed to navigate the river during a terrible storm, saving a shipment of valuable goods from being lost in the current.

Plot: White Rapids Transport is approached by a wealthy merchant who wants them to transport a valuable cargo downstream to a distant kingdom. However, the journey is fraught with danger, as there are rumors of goblin bands raiding along the river. Will the Rivermen be able to protect the cargo and deliver it safely, or will they fall prey to the goblin threat?

Keywords: Rafting, Boats, River, Transportation, Cargo

Goals keywords: expanding trade networks, maintaining the peace and security of the river, fostering close relationships with customers, preserving the natural beauty of the river

Details: a large wooden building on the riverfront with a thatched roof, timber-framed walls and large dock for cargo storage

Inherits architecture: True

Woodland Craftsmen

Type: Guild

Field: Business

Activity: Woodworking

Description: Woodland Craftsmen is a group of skilled woodworkers that specialize in creating custom furniture and cabinetry. Their workshop is adorned with various tools such as saws, chisels, and planes, which they use to transform raw timber into beautiful pieces of craftsmanship.

Population: 4

Employees:

  • Rowe Redgrave - apprentice - novice
  • Rhyshe - -
  • Jordan Grimes - apprentice - novice

Prosperity: Adequate

Relationship: The Woodland Craftsmen have a close relationship with the people of Luminia, providing them with high-quality furniture and cabinetry. They also collaborate with other guilds in the village to create unique pieces that combine different skills and techniques.

History: The Woodland Craftsmen were founded by a group of carpenters who sought to create a community of skilled craftsmen. Over the years, the group has grown in size and reputation, becoming one of the most respected guilds in Luminia.

Anecdotes: One member of the Woodland Craftsmen, Rowe Redgrave, once crafted a table from a tree that he had carved himself. He entered the table into the annual woodworking competition and it won first prize. The table is still on display in the marketplace, and people come from all over to admire it.

Plot: The Woodland Craftsmen are commissioned by a wealthy noble to create a custom piece of furniture for their castle. The noble is very particular about their taste, and demands that the Woodland Craftsmen adhere to their every whim. However, as the project progresses, the craftsmen discover a dark secret about the noble's past. They must decide whether to remain silent and complete the project, or to reveal the truth and risk losing the commission.

Keywords: Woodworking, Furniture, Cabinetry, Saw, Chisel

Goals keywords: craftsmanship, innovation, community, sustainability
