Job

Workplace: The Devout of the Non-Gendered God

description: wise and knowledgeable historian

fullname: Alley Mosley

job: historian

key_figure: yes

nickname: the chronicler

quote: \"The past holds many secrets, but I have the key\"

rank: senior

relations: mentor to younger historians

skill level: master

working_clothes: simple robe, quill, parchment

workplace: The Devout of the Non-Gendered God

Relationship

Creel Barrington: Creel is an apprentice blacksmith at The Devout of the Non-Gendered God. Alley finds him a bit brusque but admires his hardworking attitude.

Derry Talbot: Derry is Alley's boss at The Devout of the Non-Gendered God. They get along very well and often discuss their work together.

Garrett Voyle: Garrett is a member of the family where Alley also resides. They have a mutual respect for each other, and Garrett sometimes comes to Alley for advice on family matters.

Nash Barrington: Alley and Nash have known each other for decades. They share a mutual respect and admiration for each other's work. Nash often seeks advice from Alley before making decisions.

Anecdotes

Once, Alley helped a group of adventurers in finding a lost artifact in the mountains surrounding Luminia.

Alley has a secret collection of rare books that she inherited from her grandfather.

During a festival, Alley danced with the village leader, Nash Barrington, and surprised everyone with her energy and moves.

Goals

preserve history

educate younger generations

protect the village

uncover mysteries

Plot

Alley has uncovered a mystery about the Old One, an ancient deity worshipped by the natives of Luminia. She needs help in decoding a message left by the Old One.

Alley has found an old map that could lead to a hidden treasure. She needs adventurers to help her find it.

A group of scholars has arrived at Luminia, and they are interested in learning about the beliefs and customs of the natives. Alley is excited to teach them about her home.

A new group of settlers has arrived in Luminia, and they seem to have different values and beliefs than the natives. Alley is worried about the impact they might have on the village.

Secret

None

Alley Talbot

''Age is an issue of mind over matter. If you don't mind, it doesn't matter.''

  • Age: 80
  • Age look: older

  • Clothes: purple shawl over a white dress
  • Eyes: hazel
  • Gender: female
  • Generation: young
  • Habits: Alley is a creature of habit. She wakes up early every day to tend to her small garden outside of her home in Luminia. She spends most of her day reading and writing about the history and lore of the region. In the evenings, she can be found sharing her knowledge with her family and friends. Alley is also known for her love of tea, which she enjoys throughout the day.

description: compassionate and sharp-minded elder

quote: \"Age gives you wisdom, but it doesn't cure foolishness\"

rank: senior

relations: mentor to younger members

skill level: master

working_clothes: simple robe, spectacles, walking stick

workplace: The Devout of the Non-Gendered God

Relationship

Bixler Voyle: Alley sees a lot of herself in Bixler and enjoys discussing history and adventure with him. She hopes he will one day become a historian like her.

Boren Voyle: As the head of the Voyle family, Boren respects Alley's wisdom and knowledge. The two often share conversations about history and the region's legacy.

Enda Voyle: As the elder of the Voyle family, Enda and Alley share a special bond. The two often have quiet conversations about life and the mysteries of the world.

Erris Voyle: Alley has a close relationship with Erris and often serves as a mentor to her. The two share a love for storytelling and history.

Garrett Voyle: Alley has known Garrett for many years and respects his wisdom and insight. The two often have deep conversations about the world around them.

Kearey Voyle: Alley admires Kearey's curiosity and ambition. She hopes to inspire her to pursue her dreams, even if they take her outside of Luminia.

Anecdotes

Alley once helped a group of adventurers find their way through the ancient forest using her knowledge of the region's history and landmarks.

Alley is known for her sharp wit and often tells jokes to lighten the mood during tense situations.

Despite her age, Alley continues to be an active member of the community and often helps those in need.

Alley once found an old relic in the river near Luminia that was believed to be lost for centuries. Her discovery shed new light on the history of the region.

Goals

preservation

education

understanding

legacy

Plot

Alley has been tasked with preserving the history of Luminia, but there are some who seek to erase certain parts of the region's past. She may find herself in danger as she tries to protect the legacy of her people.

A group of outsiders has arrived in Luminia with their own ideologies and beliefs. Alley may be caught between her loyalty to her people and her desire to learn and understand new ways of thinking.

Alley has uncovered a long-forgotten event in the history of the region that could change everything people know about their past. She must navigate political intrigue and danger as she tries to have the truth revealed.

Alley has become increasingly concerned about the impact of humans on the ancient forest and mountains that surround Luminia. She may start a movement to promote conservation and preservation of the environment.

Secret

none

Group

Group Name: Pendrake family

key_figure: no

rank: elder

relationship: Loving towards her grandchildren

situation: grandmother

family_name: Pendrake family

Job

Workplace: The Council of Wisdom

description: Wise and knowledgeable

fullname: Ashlan Pendrake

job: village elder

key_figure: yes

nickname: The Sage

quote: Knowledge is power, use it wisely

rank: boss

relations: mentor to Kelsey Darkmantle

skill level: master

working_clothes: flowy green robe with golden embroidery

workplace: The Council of Wisdom

Relationship

Arias Voyle: Ashlan is very fond of her grandson, Arias. She enjoys spending time with him and hearing about his adventures.

Kearey Voyle: Ashlan has a close relationship with her granddaughter, Kearey. She is proud of Kearey's ambitions to become a scholar and encourages her to pursue her goals.

Anecdotes

Ashlan once single-handedly put out a small fire in the herbalist shop using her extensive knowledge of various herbs and their properties.

Ashlan was once approached by a group of young adventurers looking for guidance on a quest. Ashlan listened intently to their stories and offered sage advice, which they found invaluable on their journey.

Ashlan once organized a community gathering to commemorate a forgotten event in Luminian history. The event was a great success and brought together members of the community who had never before met.

Goals

Community

Knowledge

Justice

Tradition

Plot

Ashlan discovers a previously unknown relic that holds great historical significance to Luminia. Her efforts to uncover the artifact's true purpose and history lead her down a dangerous path, as others become aware of its existence and potential value.

Ashlan's granddaughter Kearey uncovers a shocking secret about Luminia's past that threatens to uproot the tradition and beliefs of the entire community. Ashlan is faced with a difficult decision: protect tradition and risk stunting the growth of the younger generation or embrace change at the expense of the old ways.

When a newcomer arrives in Luminia, claiming to be the reincarnation of the Old One, Ashlan is skeptical. However, as the newcomer gains more and more followers, Ashlan begins to question whether there is any truth to their claims. She must navigate a delicate political landscape as tension between the traditionalists and the newcomers reaches a boiling point.

Ashlan's secret love for the village blacksmith is discovered by her family. To complicate matters, the blacksmith himself may have feelings for Ashlan. As the two navigate their feelings for each other, they must also contend with disapproving family members and the potential consequences of a relationship between a council member and a common craftsman.

Secret

She was secretly in love with the village blacksmith

Bartan Rothrock

You can't rush perfection.

wise and respected leader

  • Age: 92
  • Age look: old
  • Beauty: average
  • Clothes: fur-lined green tunic
  • Eyes: brown
  • Gender: yes
  • Generation: old
  • Habits: Bartan Rothrock is known for his stubborn nature and his love for bison meat. He has a habit of starting his day early in the morning with a hearty meal of bison jerky, which he usually prepares himself. He spends most of his day leading the hunting company. In the evenings, he can be found in the tavern, sharing stories with the locals and enjoying his favorite drink—dwarf ale.
  • Hair: long white beard
  • Height: short
  • Origin: outsider
  • Physical detail:
  • Race: dwarf
  • Skin: wrinkled and tan
  • Structure preference: family
  • Surname: Rothrock
  • Traits: patient, traditional, loyal, stubborn
  • Weight: average

Group

Group Name: Rothrock cult

key_figure: Rothrock

rank: family patriarch

relationship: deeply committed to his family

situation: male

family_name: Rothrock cult

Job

Workplace: The Bison Runners

description: leader of the hunting company, gruff exterior hides a soft heart

fullname: Bartan Rothrock

job: boss

key_figure: yes

nickname: The Old Bear

quote: "We've got bison to hunt and traps to set"

rank: boss

relations: fatherly towards everyone, especially Betilda

skill level: master

working_clothes: simple hunting clothes, but with a striking fur hat

workplace: The Bison Runners

Relationship

Betilda Rusling: Bartan values Betilda's quiet strength and respect for the wilderness. He sees her as a skilled hunter and trapper, but worries that she may not have enough confidence to reach her full potential.

Boren Voyle: Bartan and Boren have a close relationship as father-in-law and son-in-law. They work together to manage the family and The Bison Runners.

Conor Roane: Bartan values Conor's eagerness to please and finds his positive attitude contagious. He sees potential in him and hopes to help him develop his skills.

Ennis Atwood: Bartan enjoys working with Ennis and finds his easy-going nature refreshing. He sees potential in him and hopes to help him grow into a skilled hunter and tracker.

Erris Voyle: Bartan is deeply committed to his wife and feels lucky to have found her. They have been happily married for many years and have built a prosperous life together in Luminia.

Garrett Kerrigan: Bartan recognizes Garrett's shyness and tries to give him space to grow and develop his skills. He sees potential in him and hopes to help him build confidence.

Henna Mallory: Bartan sees Henna as an equal and appreciates her intelligence and independence. He is proud to have her as part of The Bison Runners team.

Kearey Voyle: Bartan sees potential in Kearey and wants to help her achieve her dream of becoming a scholar. However, he sometimes worries that her rebellious nature will lead her down a dangerous path.

Morna Atwood: Bartan respects Morna's wisdom and values her as a trusted employee and friend. He often seeks her advice on important matters related to The Bison Runners.

Anecdotes

Bartan once saved his hunting partner's life by fighting off a pack of wolves with his bare hands.

When Bartan was young, he cheated on his wife, but he has since regretted it deeply and has never repeated the mistake again.

Bartan has a deep respect for the local scholars in Luminia and often seeks their advice when making important decisions.

Goals

legacy

prosperity

family

adventure

Plot

Bartan's past infidelity is discovered by his wife or one of his children, causing a rift in the family and possibly leading to the collapse of The Bison Runners.

The woods surrounding Luminia are mysteriously overrun by aggressive and dangerous bison. It is up to Bartan and The Bison Runners to figure out why and put an end to it.

Bartan receives a letter from an old friend who is in trouble and needs his help. He must decide whether to leave Luminia and risk the safety of his family and the hunting company.

A group of bandits led by a former employee of The Bison Runners begins to target the hunting company and its employees. Bartan and his team must find a way to stop them before they cause serious harm.

Secret

he cheated on his wife

Group

Group Name: Darkmantle family

rank: apprentice

relationship: is closest to her grandfather Phineas

situation: daughter

family_name: Darkmantle family

Job

Workplace: Luminia's Gardeners Guild

description: A passionate and skilled woodworker

fullname: Brona Darkmantle

job: woodworker

key_figure: yes

nickname: The Wood Whisperer

quote: "If it's made of wood, I can make it better"

rank: boss

relations: Highly regarded by the group due to her status as a key figure, but often stubborn when it comes to new ideas or methods. Has taken Muriel under her wing as an apprentice.

skill level: expert

working_clothes: sturdy leather apron

workplace: Luminia's Gardeners Guild

Relationship

Arias Voyle: Brona is proud of her young brother Arias, who is energetic and adventurous. Although he sometimes annoys her with his constant energy, she enjoys spending time with him and teaching him about woodworking.

Bixler Voyle: Brona is proud of her elder brother Bixler, who is ambitious and adventurous. Although they have different interests, they support each other in pursuing their dreams.

Boren Voyle: Brona looks up to her father Boren, who is respected in the village for his charisma and wisdom. She often seeks his advice when she faces difficult decisions.

Enda Voyle: Brona has a close relationship with her grandmother Enda, who is wise and patient. She often seeks her advice when she faces challenges in her life.

Erris Voyle: As a member of the same family group, Brona is very close to her mother Erris. Despite their different interests (Erris dreams of becoming a scholar), they share a strong bond and support each other in pursuing their passions.

Garrett Voyle: Brona respects her grandfather Garrett, who is quiet and reserved but wise with years of experience. She often seeks his advice on matters related to family or life in general.

Kearey Voyle: Brona's youngest sister Kearey is rebellious and headstrong, but also curious and ambitious. Although they sometimes clash due to their different personalities, they share a bond over their love for learning and exploring.

Kirwin Vain: Brona has great respect for Kirwin, the groundskeeper at the Gardeners Guild, who is responsible and diligent. She has learned a lot from him about how to maintain a garden and keep it healthy.

Muriel Pendrake: Brona gets along well with Muriel, her colleague at the Gardeners Guild, who is also passionate about nature and gardening. They often exchange ideas and collaborate on projects.

Phineas Versh: Brona is the closest to her grandfather Phineas, who taught her the basics of woodworking and continues to mentor her. They share a deep bond over their love for nature and creating beautiful things.

Anecdotes

Once, Brona spent an entire week carving a wooden statue of a deer that she saw in the forest. When she finally finished it, her grandfather Phineas was so impressed that he gave her one of his old woodworking tools as a gift.

Brona once participated in a woodworking competition in a nearby town and won first prize for her beautiful chair design that was inspired by the river that flows through Luminia.

Goals

Master woodworker

Beautiful furniture

Nature-inspired designs

Recognition

Plot

Brona's dream is to become a master woodworker and create furniture that will be recognized and appreciated all over the kingdom. This could lead her to take on challenging projects that will test her skills and creativity.

Brona's love for nature might lead her to discover some hidden mysteries about the ancient forest that surrounds Luminia. This could potentially lead to a dangerous adventure that will put her woodworking skills to the test.

Brona might fall in love with one of her colleagues at the Gardeners Guild, but this could create some tension between her and her grandfather Phineas who believes she should focus solely on her woodworking career.

Secret

has a secret talent for carving intricate designs into wood

Job

Workplace: The Timbermen Guild

description: quiet but determined man

fullname: Brone Langworth

job: lumberjack

key_figure: yes

nickname: The Axe

quote: "Measure twice, cut once"

rank: boss

relations: father to Dowd and grandfather to Orla

skill level: expert

working_clothes: fur-lined coat and boots

workplace: The Timbermen Guild

Relationship

Bixler Voyle: Bixler is Brone's nephew and looks up to him as a role model. Brone takes an active interest in Bixler's life and career aspirations.

Dowd Langworth: Dowd is one of Brone's apprentices at The Timbermen Guild. Brone sees potential in Dowd and is committed to helping him grow into a great lumberjack.

Enda Voyle: Enda is Brone's grandmother-in-law and he has a great deal of respect for her. He often seeks out her advice on important matters.

Kearey Voyle: Kearey is Brone's sister-in-law and aspires to become a scholar one day. Brone encourages her to follow her dreams, but also worries about her safety in the world outside of Luminia.

Shay Langworth: Brone and Shay have a loving and supportive relationship. They work well together at The Timbermen Guild and often go on hunting trips with their sons.

Wyatt Langworth: Wyatt is Brone's youngest son and is eager to please his father. Brone takes pride in teaching Wyatt everything he knows about lumberjacking.

Anecdotes

Brone once saved a fellow lumberjack from being swept away by a river during a storm. His quick actions and strength saved the man's life.

Brone's scar on his forehead is from a freak accident when he was an apprentice. He was hit in the head by a falling branch and had to be rushed to the healer.

Once, during a hunting trip, Brone and his sons came across an injured deer. Brone insisted that they bring it back to the healer in Luminia to be nursed back to health.

Goals

provide for his family

become an established lumberjack

gain more respect from his colleagues

ensure the safety of his village

Plot

If Brone's family is ever threatened, he will do everything in his power to protect them.

Brone is determined to become the most respected lumberjack in Luminia and will stop at nothing to achieve this goal.

There are rumors of a dangerous creature living in the ancient forest near Luminia. If Brone were to encounter this creature, it could have dire consequences for him and the village.

Brone has always been curious about the mystery surrounding the Old One and the forgotten event. If he were to uncover any information about these topics, it could change his life forever.

Secret

none

Job

Workplace: Norwick's Farmstead

description: Responsible and practical, with a sharp wit and a quick tongue

fullname: Cammy Norwick

job: farmer

key_figure: no

nickname: the jester

quote: "Laughter makes the hard work easier"

rank: senior

relations: always ready with a joke or a funny story to lighten the mood

skill level: expert

working_clothes: simple cotton clothes

workplace: Norwick's Farmstead

Relationship

Caylan Norwick: Cammy's relationship with her younger sister Caylan is complicated. The two are fiercely competitive with each other, but also deeply loyal and affectionate.

Devlin Norwick: Cammy has a cordial but distant relationship with her aunt Devlin. The two share a sharp intellect, but Cammy finds Devlin's reserved nature and tendency towards secrecy frustrating.

Kiltey Norwick: Cammy has a close relationship with her mother, who taught her everything she knows about farming. Kiltey is proud of Cammy's accomplishments and supports her ambitions to take over the family business.

Matilda Norwick: Cammy shares a special bond with her youngest niece, Matilda. She finds the teenager's curiosity and sense of adventure refreshing, and often takes her along on walks in the forest.

Nally Norwick: Cammy has a great deal of respect and admiration for her grandmother, Nally. She values the older woman's wisdom and storytelling abilities, and often seeks her out for advice.

Anecdotes

Cammy once pulled a prank on Caylan by convincing her that there was a ghost in the barn. Caylan spent the whole night hiding under her covers, while Cammy laughed herself silly.

When she was younger, Cammy snuck into the local library after hours to read books about history and mythology. She's still embarrassed about getting caught by the librarian.

Cammy once had to chase down a runaway cow through the streets of Luminia. It took her several hours, but she eventually succeeded in capturing it.

Goals

takeover

independence

loyalty

success

Plot

Cammy's secret ambition to take over more of the family business could lead to conflict with her father and other family members. This plotline could explore themes of loyalty, ambition, and succession.

Cammy's love for Luminia's natural beauty could put her at odds with a group of outsiders who want to exploit the resources in the area. This plotline could involve Cammy taking a stand to protect her home and community.

Cammy's competitive relationship with Caylan could come to a head when they both develop romantic feelings for the same person. This plotline could explore themes of jealousy, family dynamics, and self-discovery.

Secret

She has secretly taken over more of the family business than her father realizes.

Canice Ironside

"Be patient, child. Everything is a process."

stern and wise, keeper of family traditions

  • Age: 65
  • Age look: old
  • Beauty: very ugly
  • Clothes: simple robes in earthy tones
  • Eyes: brown
  • Gender: female
  • Generation: old
  • Habits: Canice is a creature of habit. She wakes up early every morning, performs a series of stretching exercises, and starts her day with a cup of herbal tea. She spends most of her day at the Clothier's Collective, weaving fabrics and ensuring that the guild's standards are met. During her breaks, she likes to take short walks around Luminia to clear her mind. In the evenings, she retreats to her small cottage on the outskirts of Luminia, where she spends time reading and practicing her magic.

Job

Workplace: Clothier's Collective

description: Stern and wise, keeper of family traditions

fullname: Canice Ironside

job: weaver

key_figure: yes

nickname: Keeper

quote: "When in doubt, go back to basics"

rank: senior

relations: Treats everyone as if they were family, especially fond of Erris

skill level: expert

working_clothes: Long skirt and apron, earthy tones

workplace: Clothier's Collective

Relationship

Boren Voyle: Canice has a great deal of respect for her uncle, Boren Voyle. As the family chief, Boren is responsible for overseeing the family's affairs and ensuring that their legacy is preserved.

Erris Voyle: Canice has a close relationship with her cousin, Erris Voyle. As the family head and mother of three, Erris often seeks out Canice's counsel and advice.

Evelyn Helwick: Canice has taken Evelyn under her wing as an apprentice weaver. As a fellow bookworm, the two often bond over literature and stories from Luminia's past.

Malek Helwick: Canice respects Malek's responsibility as one of the guild's bosses, but often finds him too stern and rigid for her taste.

Stianna Mallory: Canice has a contentious relationship with her boss, Stianna Mallory. Stianna is grumpy and judgmental, which often clashes with Canice's more patient and nurturing approach.

Anecdotes

Once, during a particularly harsh winter, Canice used her magic to conjure up a warm breeze that saved the village's crops from freezing.

Canice once caught a group of children stealing fabric from the Clothier's Collective. Instead of punishing them, she taught them how to weave and helped them make their own clothes.

Goals

preserve family traditions

pass on knowledge

protect Luminia

learn more about magic

Plot

Canice discovers a dark secret about the Clothier's Collective and must decide whether to speak out or keep quiet to protect her family.

A mysterious illness sweeps through Luminia, and the only cure involves a rare magical herb that can only be found deep within the ancient forest. Canice is reluctantly forced to team up with an unlikely ally to find the herb and save the village.

Canice's granddaughter, Kearey, is on the verge of discovering the truth about Canice's magical abilities. Canice must decide whether to come clean about her past or risk exposing her family to danger.

A group of scholars arrives in Luminia to study the ancient forest, and they uncover a long-forgotten legend about a magical artifact hidden within. Canice must race against time to retrieve the artifact before it falls into the wrong hands.

Secret

She knows magic

A member of Casner's family, possibly his ambitious older brother Bixler, may get involved in an illegal activity that puts Arrow's Defense in danger. Casner will need to choose between family loyalty and his duty to protect the Caravaneers' merchandise.

Casner may uncover a mystery surrounding Luminia's ancient forest that threatens the safety of the village. He will need to work with his colleagues and his family to solve the mystery and protect Luminia from harm.

Relationship

Arias Voyle: Caylan is the grandmother of Arias Voyle, and they have an energetic and curious relationship. Caylan often shares her knowledge of spirituality with Arias and encourages him to explore the mysteries of the world.

Boren Voyle: Caylan is the mother of Boren Voyle, and they have a respectful and caring relationship. Caylan often seeks Boren's advice on spiritual matters and looks up to him as a wise father figure.

Enda Voyle: Enda Voyle is Caylan's mother, and they have a loving and respectful relationship. Caylan often seeks Enda's wisdom and guidance on spiritual matters and looks up to her as a wise elder.

Erris Voyle: Caylan is the mother of Erris Voyle, and they have a close and loving relationship. Caylan often shares her wisdom with Erris and advises her on matters related to the family and the village.

Garrett Voyle: Garrett Voyle is Caylan's father-in-law, and they have a distant but respectful relationship. Caylan often seeks Garrett's wisdom on matters related to the family's history and traditions.

Kearey Voyle: Caylan is the grandmother of Kearey Voyle, and they have a rebellious and curious relationship. Caylan often encourages Kearey to follow her dreams and explore new ideas, even if they challenge the traditions of their family.

Anecdotes

Caylan once saved a lost child from the forest and brought him back to his parents.

Caylan's silver hair always gives her grandchildren the impression that she is a wise wizard.

Caylan has a secret stash of honey that she keeps hidden in her cottage.

Caylan is known for her amazing storytelling skills, and people often gather around her to listen to her tales.

Caylan has a rare talent for healing, and many people come to her seeking her help.

Goals

Enlightenment

Legacy

Protection

Community

Plot

Caylan's family has a long-standing feud with another family in the village. Caylan needs to resolve the issue before it escalates into something more serious.

A group of adventurers is passing by Luminia village and seeks a wise elder who could guide them through the mountains. They ask for Caylan's help, but she's hesitant to leave the village and her duties. Will she help the adventurers or stay behind?

The Old One has been appearing to Caylan in her dreams, asking her to uncover the mystery behind a forgotten event that happened in Luminia centuries ago. Will Caylan unravel the mystery, or will it remain a secret forever?

Caylan's daughter has fallen in love with an outsider who has come to Luminia. The outsider's family is not native, and they do not share Caylan's beliefs. Caylan must decide whether to accept her daughter's choice or disapprove of it.

There is a dangerous illness spreading throughout the village, and people are dying every day. Caylan must find a way to heal the sick and protect the healthy from this deadly disease.

Secret

none

Crowle Raelthorne

"Trust me, I have seen worse"

Wise and gentle grandfather. Retired trader.

  • Age: 71
  • Age look: old
  • Beauty: average
  • Clothes: long white robe
  • Eyes: hazel
  • Gender: male
  • Generation: mid
  • Habits: Crowle is a creature of habit, waking up early every morning to tend to his small garden outside of his house and meditate. He spends most of his day reading books on history and lore, often accompanied by his granddaughter Emma. In the evenings, he enjoys sipping on a cup of tea while reminiscing about his younger days as a trader.
  • Hair: bald
  • Height: small
  • Origin: native
  • Physical detail:
  • Race: human
  • Skin: wrinkled skin

  • Weight: chubby

Group

Group Name: Raelthorne family

key_figure: no

rank: patriarch

relationship: loving towards family members

situation: grandfather

family_name: Raelthorne family

Job

Workplace: Raelthorne Trading Company

description: Wise and gentle grandfather. Retired trader.

fullname: Crowle Raelthorne

job: trader (retired)

key_figure: yes

nickname: The Mentor

quote: "Patience and understanding are the keys to success."

rank: elder

relations: Highly respected and considered as the go-to person in the group for advice and guidance.

skill level: master

working_clothes: Simple, practical clothes

workplace: Raelthorne Trading Company

Relationship

Alexia Mallory: Crowle admires Alexia's sophisticated and cultured nature, and he enjoys working with her at the Raelthorne Trading Company.

Bailey Pendrake: Bailey is a senior assistant at the Raelthorne Trading Company and Crowle sees her as assertive and responsible.

Boren Voyle: Crowle has known Boren for many years and sees him as a handsome and respected father figure. He admires his charismatic, honorable, and wise qualities.

Creedan Raelthorne: Creedan is Crowle's youngest son and ambitious apprentice at the Raelthorne Trading Company. Crowle hopes to pass on his knowledge and wisdom to Creedan.

Creena Mallory: Creena is an apprentice at the Raelthorne Trading Company, and Crowle sees her as a nurturing and empathetic individual.

Ecken Hardwick: Ecken is an ambitious apprentice at the Raelthorne Trading Company and Crowle sees potential in him. He admires Ecken's confidence and eagerness to prove himself.

Egan Helwick: Egan is a retired trader and Crowle doesn't know him well, but he recognizes his gruff and curmudgeonly personality.

Emma Raelthorne: As Crowle's curious and imaginative granddaughter, Emma enjoys exploring the Caravaneers' wagons with him and listening to his stories.

Enda Voyle: Crowle has a deep respect for Enda, who is his granddaughter's grandmother. He sees her as a wise old woman with vast life experience and admires her wise, patient, and caring nature.

Erris Voyle: Crowle has a great relationship with Erris, who is his eldest granddaughter's mother. He sees her as a caring and protective mother and respects her nurturing and empathic nature.

Garrett Voyle: Crowle has always had a quiet respect for Garrett, who is his granddaughter's grandfather. He sees him as a patient, wise, and observant individual, with years of experience that have given him great insight into the world.

Heremon Kerrigan: Heremon is an apprentice at the Raelthorne Trading Company, and Crowle recognizes his creativity but finds him somewhat anti-social.

Kearey Voyle: Crowle is proud of Kearey's ambition and curiosity, and he enjoys talking to her about her dreams of becoming a scholar. However, he worries about her headstrong nature and hopes she will remain safe in her pursuit of knowledge.

Muriel Raelthorne: Muriel is Crowle's eldest daughter and works alongside him at the Raelthorne Trading Company. They have a very close relationship, and Crowle admires her hard-working and serious nature.

Orla Alkott: Crowle has worked with Orla for many years and sees her as an aging but still sharp trader. He enjoys her gentle and nurturing personality.

Renny Raelthorne: Renny is Crowle's sister-in-law and a retired seamstress. She is strict and bitter, and Crowle tries to avoid her whenever possible.

Rosaleen Raelthorne: Rosaleen is Crowle's niece and a retired apothecary. She is forgiving and generous, and Crowle enjoys spending time with her.

Anecdotes

Crowle once single-handedly fended off a group of bandits who attempted to rob his caravan. He earned the nickname 'Old Crow' after that incident for his quick thinking and bravery.

Crowle often tells his family stories of the time he traded exotic spices from a far-off land with an eccentric merchant who rode on the backs of giant turtles.

During a particularly difficult winter, Crowle risked his life to venture into the nearby mountains to trade with a tribe of isolated villagers who had a surplus of food. His actions saved many lives in Luminia.

Goals

prosperity

knowledge

family legacy

peaceful retirement

Plot

An old friend of Crowle's from the Raelthorne Trading Company has fallen on hard times and needs a loan. However, the friend has a shady past, and giving him the money could put Crowle's reputation at risk.

The village of Luminia is threatened by a group of raiders, and Crowle must use his knowledge of trading to negotiate a peace treaty with them before they attack.

A wealthy scholar from a foreign land approaches Crowle with a rare ancient artifact that he wants to sell to the Raelthorne Trading Company. However, the artifact is cursed, and whoever possesses it will suffer great misfortune. Crowle must decide whether to put his company's prosperity above his own intuition.

Secret

none

Malek Brasher: Malek is an apprentice guard at The Guardian's Pact and Dardan's cousin. While Malek is charismatic and impulsive, Dardan worries about his thirst for adventure leading him into danger.

Anecdotes

When Dardan was a child, he and his siblings would often sneak out of their home at night to explore the ancient forest surrounding their village.

During a guard patrol, Dardan once saved a young child from drowning in the river.

Dardan has a secret fascination with the Old One, a mysterious figure from Luminia's history that many locals believe still watches over the village.

Goals

protect

impress

adventure

mystery

Plot

Dardan's crush on the mayor's daughter may put him in danger if he pursues her too aggressively. He may need to find a way to impress her without drawing unwanted attention to himself.

As a member of The Guardian's Pact, Dardan is often on the front lines of protecting the village from external threats. He may need to use his quick wit and resourcefulness to outsmart any attackers.

Dardan's curiosity about the Old One could lead him to discover something ancient and mysterious about Luminia's past. However, this quest for knowledge may also put him in harm's way if he uncovers dark secrets.

He has a crush on the mayor's daughter

description: the chosen one, believed to be able to communicate with the Old One

fullname: Delaney Blackwood

job: thief

key_figure: yes

nickname: The Messenger

quote: "The Old One spoke to me - You have been warned"

rank: leader

relations: Highly respected by the others in the group, seen as someone who can bring the favor of their God to the group.

skill level: expert

working_clothes: black cloak and hood, with silver embroidery

workplace: Blackwood's Underground Syndicate

Relationship

Ashlan Alkott: Ashlan Alkott is one of Delaney's apprentices at the Syndicate. Although she is still learning the ropes, Delaney sees a lot of potential in her and often gives her tips on how to improve her technique.

Bartan: Delaney is very close to Bartan, who taught her everything she knows about thievery. She looks up to him as a father figure and hopes to someday earn his respect and trust.

Bixler: Bixler, Delaney's elder brother, is an ambitious young man who shares her love for adventure. The two often go exploring together in the surrounding mountains and forests.

Enda: Enda, Delaney's grandmother, is a wise old woman with vast life experience. She is very supportive of Delaney's curiosity and encourages her to pursue her dreams.

Garrett: Garrett, Delaney's grandfather, is a quiet and reserved man who has seen many things in his long life. Although he doesn't say much, his advice is always thoughtful and worth listening to.

Jurg Blackitt: Jurg Blackitt is the boss of the Syndicate's fencing operations and a trusted ally of Bartan. Although he can be intimidating at times, Jurg has a kind heart and is always looking out for his colleagues.

Kearey: Kearey, Delaney's younger sister, is a rebellious young woman who dreams of becoming a scholar. Although they have different interests, the two sisters are very close and often confide in each other.

Mara Vain: Mara Vain is a senior member of the Syndicate and one of Delaney's colleagues. Although they don't always see eye to eye, Mara recognizes Delaney's potential and often gives her advice on how to improve her skills.

Nuila Azadul: Nuila Azadul is another of Delaney's apprentices, and a very loyal member of the Syndicate. Although she is disfigured by a curse, Delaney sees past her appearance and values her as a friend and colleague.

Anecdotes

Delaney once stole a priceless ruby from a wealthy merchant, using only her wits and a handful of smoke bombs. The other members of the Syndicate were amazed by her skill and daring.

When she was younger, Delaney used to sneak out of the village at night and go exploring in the mountains. She once stumbled upon a hidden cave full of ancient artifacts, including a strange amulet that glowed with an eerie light.

Delaney has a pet ferret named Gus, whom she rescued from a cruel owner. Gus is very loyal and affectionate, and often accompanies her on her nighttime expeditions.

Goals

magic

scholars

the Old One

adventure

Plot

Delaney's secret studies in magic are discovered by the local authorities, who accuse her of consorting with dark forces. She must flee Luminia and go into hiding, while seeking allies who can help her clear her name and find a way to control her powers.

The Syndicate is hired to steal a powerful artifact from a rival gang in the city of Rivenport. Delaney is tasked with infiltrating the gang's headquarters and stealing the artifact, but she soon discovers that the gang's leader is someone she knows from her past.

Bartan, Delaney's mentor and father figure, is betrayed by a member of the Syndicate and left for dead. Delaney must rally the other members and embark on a dangerous mission to avenge Bartan and reclaim his honor.

Secret

she is secretly studying magic

Relationship

Alvy Kerrigan: Delp's other cousin and fellow apprentice guard, Alvy is a quiet and reserved individual who values hard work and discipline. Despite their differences, Delp sees a lot of potential in Alvy and hopes to help him reach his full potential.

Barden Kerrigan: Delp's grandfather and former family head, Barden is a source of wisdom and guidance for Delp. Despite his gruff exterior, Barden loves his grandson deeply and would do anything to protect him.

Bayden Kerrigan: Delp's eldest son has always been a bit of a wild card, and their relationship has been strained at times. Despite their differences, however, Delp is fiercely protective of Bayden and will do whatever it takes to keep him safe.

Beck Kerrigan: Delp's young grandson is a constant source of joy and inspiration for him. He loves spending time with Beck and teaching him about the world around them.

Darsey Kerrigan: Delp's cousin and fellow guard, Darsey often serves as Delp's sounding board and confidant. The two share a deep trust and respect for one another.

Garrett Kerrigan: Delp shares a close bond with his young nephew, often taking him out on adventures in the ancient forest. Garrett looks up to his uncle as a role model and hopes to one day follow in his footsteps as a guard.

Heremon Kerrigan: Delp's son is a gifted artist, but often struggles to fit in with his peers. Despite this, Delp remains supportive of his son's passions and encourages him to pursue his dreams.

Malek Brasher: As an apprentice guard at The Guardian's Pact, Malek looks up to Delp as a mentor. While the two have very different personalities, they share a strong sense of duty and honor.

Anecdotes

Despite his serious demeanor, Delp has been known to let loose and enjoy a pint of ale or two with his fellow guards after a long day of work.

One time, Delp caught a group of young troublemakers attempting to steal from a local merchant. Instead of punishing them harshly, he took them under his wing and taught them the value of hard work and honesty.

Delp has a soft spot for animals and can often be found feeding stray cats and dogs on the streets of Luminia.

Goals

family

protection

honor

legacy

Plot

Delp's secret debt to the innkeeper comes back to haunt him when the inn is threatened by a gang of bandits.

When a strange illness plagues the village, Delp must work alongside his colleagues at The Guardian's Pact to find the source of the outbreak and prevent it from spreading.

Delp's family is targeted by a group of thieves who are after a valuable artifact that has been passed down through generations. It's up to Delp to protect his loved ones and keep the artifact out of the wrong hands.

Delp becomes embroiled in a conflict with a rival guard faction that seeks to take control of the village. Despite the odds against him, Delp uses his experience and cunning to outsmart his opponents and emerge victorious.

Secret

he owes money to the innkeeper

description: wise and experienced herbalist

fullname: Derry Talbot

nickname: the green thumb

rank: boss

Relationship

Boren Gilroy: An elder from Derry's family group. They have a deep respect for each other and often share stories about their respective families' histories.

Cammy Talbot: Derry's daughter, who also works at The Devout as a nurse. They have a close relationship and often work together to treat patients.

Nash Barrington: The leader of the group in which Derry lives. They have a respectful and friendly relationship, with Nash often seeking out Derry's advice and guidance.

Anecdotes

Derry once saved a young girl who had fallen into the river and had been swept downstream. She used her extensive knowledge of herbs to treat the girl's injuries and nurse her back to health.

During a particularly harsh winter, Derry spent days on end in the forest, searching for rare herbs to help alleviate the symptoms of a deadly flu that had struck the village. Through her efforts, the spread of the disease was contained and many lives were saved.

Derry is known for her love of baking and often makes delicious treats for her colleagues at The Devout.

Goals

herbalism

knowledge

community

faith

Plot

Derry is approached by a group of adventurers who need her help in finding a rare herb that is said to cure a deadly disease. She must decide whether to risk her own safety to aid the group.

Derry uncovers a plot by a rival religious group to steal the sacred artifacts of the Non-Gendered God from The Devout. She must find a way to prevent the theft without putting her colleagues or herself in danger.

Derry's knowledge of herbs attracts the attention of a powerful noble who offers her a position as his personal healer. She must decide whether to accept the offer or remain in Luminia with her community.

Derry discovers a secret about the origins of her family group that threatens to tear it apart. She must find a way to reconcile the conflicting beliefs and restore peace among her people.

Secret

none

Caleb Blackwood: A teenage tanner apprentice at the guild. Devlin enjoys working with Caleb due to his enthusiastic and energetic attitude.

Enda Voyle: Devlin's grandmother. Devlin often seeks out her grandmother's wisdom and life experience when facing difficult decisions.

Erris Voyle: Devlin's mother. They have a close relationship, and Devlin often turns to her for advice on balancing her duties at the guild with her responsibilities as a mother.

Garrett Voyle: Devlin's grandfather. A quiet and observant man, Garrett often provides sage advice to Devlin when she is feeling overwhelmed or unsure of herself.

Gwendolyn Porter: An experienced tanner at the guild. Devlin often seeks out Gwendolyn's advice on more complex leatherworking projects.

Jenett Darkmantle: A fellow tanner and creative artisan at the guild. Devlin respects Jenett's skill and creativity and often collaborates with her on new projects.

Kearey Voyle: Devlin's youngest sister. Devlin admires Kearey's ambition and drive to become a scholar, but worries she may be taking on too much too soon.

Leif Eriksen: A journeyman tanner at the guild. Devlin admires Leif's skill and calm demeanor and often seeks out his advice on difficult projects.

Nathanial Strong: A tanner apprentice at the guild. Devlin sees potential in Nathanial and often takes him under her wing to teach him new techniques.

Remy Thorne: A tanner apprentice at the guild. Remy shares Devlin's passion for leatherworking, and the two often collaborate on new ideas and projects.

Rowan Redwood: An experienced tanner at the guild. Devlin often seeks out Rowan's advice on more challenging leatherworking projects due to her patient and methodical approach.

Sable Blackburn: A tanner apprentice at the guild. Devlin sees potential in Sable and often takes her under her wing to develop her leatherworking skills.

Silas Hightower: An experienced tanner at the guild. Devlin sees Silas as a mentor and often turns to him for guidance on more complex projects.

Tristan Hawkwood: A journeyman tanner at the guild. Devlin respects Tristan's experience and often turns to him for advice on more complicated projects.

Anecdotes

Devlin once saved a batch of leather from ruin by inventing a new curing technique on the spot.

During a village festival, Devlin organized a successful fundraiser for the guild by selling handcrafted leather goods.

Goals

innovate

grow

expand

succeed

Plot

Devlin discovers a rare type of tannin in the ancient forest that could revolutionize the guild's leatherworking methods, but a rival tanner has also caught wind of the discovery and will stop at nothing to get their hands on it.

The Hides and Tans Fellowship is struggling financially, and Devlin must come up with a new marketing strategy to attract more customers and keep the guild afloat.

Devlin's daughter falls ill with a mysterious illness, and Devlin must use her knowledge of local beliefs and remedies to try and cure her.

workplace: The Timbermen Guild

Relationship

Brone Langworth: Dowd looks up to his father and hopes to one day take over as head of the family himself. He values his father's advice and guidance, and tries to make him proud in everything he does.

Malek Langworth: Malek is Dowd's younger brother and colleague at The Timbermen Guild. They have a competitive relationship, but Dowd tries to be a good mentor to Malek and teach him valuable skills.

Orla Langworth: Orla is Dowd's young niece, and he loves playing with her whenever he has free time. He hopes to inspire her adventurous spirit and encourage her to explore the world around her.

Shay Langworth: Shay is Dowd's auntie and a constant source of love and support for him. She often gives him advice on personal matters and encourages him to pursue his dreams.

Wyatt Langworth: Wyatt is Dowd's younger cousin and page. Dowd sometimes feels responsible for looking after Wyatt, as he is still young and inexperienced. However, he also enjoys spending time with him and teaching him new things about the lumberjack trade.

Anecdotes

Dowd once rescued a fellow lumberjack who was injured while cutting down a tree. He climbed up the trunk of the tree and carefully lowered the man to the ground, all while using just one hand to hold onto the trunk.

When Dowd was younger, he accidentally cut down a tree that his father had marked for protection. He felt terrible about it and spent days replanting new trees in the area.

Dowd once found a rare type of wood that no one in Luminia had ever seen before. He brought it back to The Timbermen Guild, where it was used to make beautiful furniture for the village's wealthiest residents.

Goals

success

leadership

knowledge

legacy

Plot

Dowd is approached by a group of scholars who are studying the ancient forest surrounding Luminia. They offer him a job as their guide, promising to pay him handsomely for his assistance. But what secrets will Dowd uncover as he delves deeper into the forest?

The Timbermen Guild is struggling to make ends meet, and Dowd is forced to come up with a plan to save the business from going bankrupt. Can he convince his colleagues to work even harder and find new sources of income?

Dowd's younger brother, Malek, is jealous of his success and constantly tries to undermine him at work. Can Dowd find a way to mend their relationship and get Malek to see him as a mentor, rather than a rival?

A wealthy trader comes to Luminia with an offer to buy The Timbermen Guild for a large sum of money. Dowd must decide whether to sell the business and secure his family's financial future, or continue working there and striving for success on his own terms.

Secret

none

Dunarl Hardwick

"We'll make it work. We always do."

wise and stoic, with a gruff exterior hiding a heart of gold

  • Age: 60
  • Age look: older adult
  • Beauty: pretty

  • Eyes: brown
  • Gender: male
  • Generation: mid
  • Habits: Dunarl is a practical and responsible person who follows a strict routine. He wakes up early every day and spends the morning meditating and praying to the Old One. He then heads to work at The Cult of the Old One, where he spends the majority of his day performing his priestly duties. In the evenings, Dunarl returns home to spend time with his family and help out with any chores that need to be done. He values hard work and does not like to waste time on frivolous activities.
  • Hair: shaggy and grey
  • Height: short
  • Origin: native
  • Physical detail:

Group

Group Name: Hardwick family

key_figure: yes

rank: family chief

relationship: loves his family above all else and will do anything to protect them

situation: father

family_name: Hardwick family

Job

Workplace: The Cult of the Old One

description: Wise and stoic, with a gruff exterior hiding a heart of gold.

fullname: Dunarl Hardwick

job: priest

key_figure: no

nickname: The Faithful

quote: "In the end, it's not about what we sacrifice. It's about what we gain."

rank: senior

relations: Respected by all members of the group, particularly close to Heleth, sometimes frustrates Icabod with his devotion

skill level: expert

working_clothes: orange robes, brown sandals

workplace: The Cult of the Old One

Relationship

Decklin Hardwick: Dunarl's cousin. They have a playful relationship and often engage in friendly banter. Dunarl enjoys Decklin's sense of humor and carefree attitude.

Ecken Hardwick: Dunarl's eldest son. They have a somewhat strained relationship due to Ecken's competitive nature. Dunarl worries that Ecken is too focused on success and not enough on family.

Galtar Hardwick: Dunarl's uncle. They have a complicated relationship due to Galtar's grouchy and judgemental nature. Dunarl tries to remain loyal to his family but is often frustrated by Galtar's behavior.

Garline Hardwick: Dunarl's mother. She is tough and no-nonsense, and often clashes with Dunarl over his devotion to The Cult of the Old One. Despite their differences, Dunarl loves his mother deeply and respects her opinions.

Golrick Hardwick: Dunarl's grandson. He adores his grandfather and looks up to him as a role model. Dunarl sees a lot of himself in Golrick and hopes to pass on his wisdom to the next generation.

Gruhn Hardwick: Dunarl's youngest son. He is ambitious and determined, much like his father. Dunarl worries that Gruhn may become too focused on success and forget the importance of family.

Havelock Hardwick: Dunarl's beloved grandfather. He was the previous family chief and taught Dunarl the importance of tradition and family. Although Havelock has passed away, Dunarl still looks to him for guidance in times of need.

Heleth Hardwick: Dunarl's eldest daughter. She is strong-willed and fiercely independent, much like Dunarl himself. They have a close relationship but occasionally clash over their differing opinions.

Holdur Hardwick: Dunarl's son. They have a warm and friendly relationship, and Holdur often turns to his father for advice and support.

Marba Hardwick: Dunarl's beloved grandmother. He has a close relationship with her and turns to her for advice in times of need.

Sartine Hardwick: Dunarl's youngest daughter. She is shy and reserved, much like Dunarl's own nature. They share a quiet bond and often spend time together in silence.

Anecdotes

Dunarl once saved his nephew Golrick from drowning in the river when he was just a child. The incident cemented their bond and Golrick has looked up to Dunarl ever since.

Dunarl has a reputation for being stubborn and opinionated, but his family knows that it is just a front to protect his vulnerable side.

Goals

family legacy

Old One's teachings

protection of loved ones

spiritual enlightenment

Plot

Dunarl's family has a long-standing feud with a neighboring family, the Ironsides. The feud has escalated in recent years and Dunarl fears that violence may break out soon. He must figure out a way to calm tensions before a full-blown conflict erupts.

The Cult of the Old One has been growing increasingly radical in its beliefs, and Dunarl is starting to have doubts about its teachings. He must decide whether to remain loyal to the cult or to speak out against its dangerous practices.

Secret

none

Job

Workplace: Wandering Wayfarers

description: grizzled veteran with a stern, no-nonsense demeanor

fullname: Durwin Hitch

job: blacksmith

key_figure: no

nickname: iron hand

quote: "Heat, hammer, shape. Repeat"

rank: boss

relations: sees Fargas as a promising apprentice

skill level: expert

working_clothes: leather apron and gloves

workplace: Wandering Wayfarers

Relationship

Cacey Mallory: Durwin is wary of Cacey Mallory, the senior thief of the Wandering Wayfarers. He knows that she has a criminal past and worries that she may be a liability to the group.

Cammy Grayden: Durwin and Cammy have a close relationship, despite their vastly different personalities. Durwin sees Cammy as a source of light in an often dark world and appreciates her optimism and love for adventure.

Fargas Mallory: Durwin took Fargas under his wing when he joined the Wandering Wayfarers as an apprentice blacksmith. Durwin sees potential in Fargas and wants to help him grow into a skilled blacksmith like himself.

Morna Halstead: As the boss of the Wandering Wayfarers, Morna Halstead and Durwin have a professional relationship. Durwin respects Morna's exceptional hunting skills and sees her as a valuable member of the group.

Vora Murdoch: Durwin has a deep respect for Vora Murdoch, the family head of the group. He sees her as a natural leader and often seeks her advice when making important decisions for the Wandering Wayfarers.

Anecdotes

Durwin once saved the life of a fellow member of the Wandering Wayfarers by using his blacksmith skills to create a makeshift brace for a broken leg.

Durwin is known for his love of puzzles and often spends hours trying to solve them in his free time.

Despite his tough exterior, Durwin has a soft spot for children and is known to go out of his way to help them whenever he can.

Goals

redemption

protection

legacy

adventure

Plot

Durwin's criminal past comes back to haunt him when an old acquaintance comes to Luminia looking for revenge. The group must work together to protect Durwin and ensure that his past doesn't catch up with him.

The Wandering Wayfarers are hired to escort a group of scholars who are exploring a nearby ancient ruin. Durwin is tasked with creating weapons and equipment for the group, but soon discovers that there is more to the scholars' mission than meets the eye.

Durwin's leadership of the Wandering Wayfarers is called into question when a new member joins the group and challenges his authority. Durwin must prove his worth and demonstrate that he is the right person to lead the group.

Durwin becomes obsessed with uncovering the mystery surrounding the Old One, a local deity worshipped by the villagers of Luminia. He convinces the rest of the group to help him in his quest, but soon learns that the truth is more dangerous than he ever could have imagined.

Secret

he has a criminal past

Job

Workplace: The Wayfinders

description: Strict but fair, with a deep attachment to tradition.

fullname: Ennis Alkott

job: leader

key_figure: yes

nickname: The Wise

quote: Leadership is not an entitlement, it's a privilege

rank: boss

relations: Family members with Artis

skill level: master

working_clothes: fine clothing with insignia of leadership

workplace: The Wayfinders

Relationship

Artis Alkott: Ennis's relationship with his nephew Artis is complicated. He admires his nephew's charm and handsome looks but despises his reckless behavior. Ennis often has to clean up after Artis's messes at The Wayfinders.

Bixler Voyle: Bixler looks up to his uncle Ennis and often seeks his approval or advice. Ennis sees potential in Bixler's adventurous spirit but worries about his recklessness.

Boren Voyle: Ennis's relationship with his brother-in-law is cordial but distant. They share a common goal of maintaining the family's prosperity but have different ways of achieving it.

Burnev Blackitt: Ennis respects Burnev's expertise as a blacksmith and appreciates his blunt but caring nature. They often work together to improve the village's defenses.

Crowle Denby: Ennis doesn't know Crowle well, but he respects his bravery and eagerness to prove himself as a ranger. He often assigns him scouting missions for The Wayfinders.

Enda Voyle: Ennis loves and respects his grandmother, who is the matriarch of the Voyle group. He often seeks her wisdom and guidance on important matters.

Erris Voyle: Ennis respects his older sister and often seeks her advice on family matters or personal issues. He has helped her raise her children after her husband's death.

Garrett Voyle: Ennis has a deep respect for his grandfather, who has seen many changes in Luminia over the years. He values his experience and listens closely to his advice.

Hedwig Blackitt: Ennis respects Hedwig's skills as a scout and values her seniority. He finds her charming but sometimes worries about her recklessness.

Kearey Voyle: Ennis is worried about Kearey's safety and future. He admires her ambition and curiosity but wishes she would stay close to home and respect the Voyle traditions.

Kerr Denby: Ennis has a cordial relationship with Kerr, but he doesn't trust his smooth talking and ambitious spirit. He keeps a close eye on Kerr's dealings and advises him on how to avoid trouble.

Anecdotes

Goals

tradition

prosperity

legacy

beliefs

Plot

Ennis's family business is being threatened by a rival merchant who wants to dominate the trade in Luminia. Ennis has to navigate through the complex world of trade agreements and political alliances to protect his family's prosperity.

The Wayfinders have stumbled upon an ancient manuscript that could reveal Luminia's forgotten event, but it's guarded by dangerous monsters. Ennis has to gather a team of adventurers and lead them to retrieve the manuscript.

Ennis's rebellious niece Kearey has left the village to study in a far-away town. Ennis worries about her safety and the influence of the big city on her beliefs and traditions. He decides to go after her and convince her to come back home.

Ennis has discovered a secret society of scholars who investigate the ancient scripts and beliefs of Luminia. He is torn between his loyalty to his group and his fascination with the society's work. He has to choose whether to join the society and risk his group's reputation or keep the secret to himself.

Secret

None

description: Human singer who always wears a smile and loves to charm the audience.

working_clothes: Red silk shirt, black pants, and a green vest

workplace: White Rapids Transport

Relationship

Afnaerad: Ennis has a great deal of respect for Afnaerad and sees him as a wise and compassionate member of the group. He values his friendship greatly and looks up to him as a role model.

Derry Kerswell: Ennis enjoys spending time with Derry and sees her as a talented young musician. He is often impressed by her enthusiasm and determination and hopes to be able to help her grow as a performer.

Enda Voyle: Ennis has a great deal of respect for Enda and sees her as a wise and experienced member of the group. He often seeks her advice on matters related to the music business and values her input greatly.

Jarok Ainsworth: Ennis has known Jarok for many years and sees him as a mentor and friend. He often turns to him for advice and is grateful for the guidance he has received over the years.

Rhyshe: Ennis is slowly getting to know Rhyshe and is impressed by her musical talent. He enjoys spending time with her and hopes to be able to get her to open up more.

Ruibrarii Coralaeth: Ennis gets along well with Ruibrarii and often accompanies him on his forest explorations. He enjoys hearing about the elf's adventures and finds him to be a curious and interesting character.

Anecdotes

Ennis once saved a child from drowning in the river near Luminia. He was passing by when he heard the child's cries and jumped into the water without hesitation.

Ennis once lost his voice before a big performance. His colleagues were worried that they would have to cancel the show, but Ennis managed to pull through and deliver a stunning performance despite his hoarse throat.

Goals

fame

recognition

memories

legacy

Plot

Ennis has been approached by a talent scout who wants him to perform in the capital city. However, this would require him to leave Luminia and his beloved group behind. Will Ennis choose fame and fortune over his loyalty to his colleagues?

Ennis has been experiencing frequent bouts of forgetfulness lately. While he brushes it off as normal aging, his colleagues are starting to get worried. Could there be something more serious going on?

Ennis's former lover, who left him to pursue a career in the capital city, has returned to Luminia after many years. Although Ennis has moved on, his former lover's return stirs up old emotions and memories. Will Ennis be able to confront his past and move on?

Job

Workplace: Vintner's Guild

description: Caring and protective mother

fullname: Erris Voyle

job: winemaker

key_figure: yes

nickname: the vinekeeper

quote: "The vines are an extension of me."

rank: boss

relations: Treats Ansel like her own son

skill level: expert

working_clothes: simple dress, always carrying a grapevine wand

workplace: Vintner's Guild

Relationship

Ansel Rolfe: Ansel is an apprentice winemaker at the guild, and looks up to Erris as a mentor. He admires her dedication to her work and often seeks her advice on winemaking techniques.

Bixler Voyle: Bixler is Erris' eldest son, and shares her love for adventure and exploration. The two are very close, but Erris worries about Bixler's safety when he leaves Luminia to explore new lands. She hopes that he will eventually return home and continue the family tradition of winemaking.

Boren Voyle: Erris has been married to Boren for many years, and the two share a deep love and respect for each other. Boren is highly respected in the community and serves as the chief of their family group. Erris relies on him for guidance and support, and often seeks his advice when faced with difficult decisions.

Kearey Voyle: Kearey is Erris' youngest daughter, and the two have a somewhat strained relationship. Kearey dreams of becoming a scholar, which is not a traditional path for women in Luminia. Erris worries about her daughter's safety and well-being, but also wants to support her in pursuing her dreams.

Keavey Rolfe: Keavey is a senior winemaker at the guild and has been working with Erris for many years. The two are good friends and often share tips and tricks for making the best wine.

Rosaleen Rolfe: Rosaleen is an apprentice winemaker at the guild and looks up to Erris as a role model. She admires Erris' commitment to her family and her work, and hopes to one day be as skilled a winemaker as she is.

Anecdotes

Erris once accidentally spilled a barrel of wine on herself during a particularly busy day at the guild, and spent the rest of the day smelling like grapes.

Erris once rescued a stray cat that had wandered into the guild's wine cellar, and took it home to live with her family.

When asked about her favorite type of wine, Erris always answers 'The one that brings people together.'

Goals

Travel

Learn

Protect

Expand

Plot

Erris is approached by a wealthy adventurer who offers to buy a large quantity of wine from the guild. However, the adventurer has a shady reputation, and Erris must decide whether to risk the guild's reputation by doing business with him.

Bixler, Erris' eldest son, announces that he wants to leave Luminia to explore new lands. Erris must confront her fear of losing her child and decide whether to let him go or try to convince him to stay.

A new group of winemakers arrives in Luminia and starts selling their wine at lower prices than the guild. Erris must find a way to compete and protect the guild's interests without resorting to unethical tactics.

An ancient vineyard located in a dangerous part of the forest is discovered, and Erris is tasked with leading a team to retrieve the rare grapes. However, the vineyard is rumored to be cursed, and the expedition may be more dangerous than anyone realizes.

Secret

She always wanted to travel.

Garrett Versh

"I'm not as old as I look."

A humble man who is known for his kindness.

  • Age: 80
  • Age look: old
  • Beauty: very pretty
  • Clothes: Long robes of red velvet
  • Eyes: blue
  • Gender: male
  • Generation: old
  • Habits: Garrett wakes up early every morning and takes a walk around the village, greeting his neighbors and admiring the natural beauty that surrounds Luminia. He then spends most of his day working at The Devout of the Non-Gendered God, attending religious ceremonies and counseling fellow believers. In his free time, Garrett enjoys reading ancient texts and researching local myths and legends. He also practices his sword fighting skills in secret, a trait that only a few members of his family know about.

Group

Group Name: Versh family

key_figure: yes

rank: family elder

relationship: The elder statesman of the family, respected by all.

situation: grandfather

family_name: Versh family

Job

Workplace: The Devout of the Non-Gendered God

description: humble and forgiving elder

fullname: Garrett Versh

job: elder

key_figure: no

nickname: the forgiver

quote: \"We all make mistakes. It's how we learn from them that counts\"

rank: senior

relations: father figure to other members

skill level: expert

working_clothes: simple robe, spectacles, walking stick

workplace: The Devout of the Non-Gendered God

Relationship

Anson Versh: Garrett's cousin and a curious young man. Garrett enjoys teaching Anson about local beliefs and forgotten events.

Cammy Talbot: A senior nurse at The Devout of the Non-Gendered God, and a close friend of Garrett. Garrett often seeks Cammy's advice on medical matters and trusts her implicitly.

Dardan Versh: Garrett's son and the chief of the Versh family. Although they have their differences, Garrett is proud of Dardan's achievements and his dedication to their family.

Derry Talbot: The wise and experienced herbalist at The Devout of the Non-Gendered God. Garrett respects Derry's knowledge and often consults with him regarding religious rituals.

Haley Versh: Garrett's granddaughter and a spirited adventurer. Garrett loves spending time with Haley and is always impressed by her bravery and independence.

Nash Barrington: The respected village leader of Luminia. Garrett has a good relationship with Nash and often attends meetings with him to discuss matters concerning the village.

Phineas Versh: Garrett's uncle and a jolly man who loves to tell stories. Garrett and Phineas often share a drink together and reminisce about old times.

Shay Versh: Garrett's daughter and a respected elder in the Versh family. Garrett has a close relationship with Shay and often relies on her for advice.

Anecdotes

Garrett once saved the life of a young adventurer who was lost in the ancient forest. He led the adventurer back to safety and gave them guidance on how to avoid dangers in the forest.

Garrett's sword fighting skills are legendary in his family. He once challenged his granddaughter, Haley, to a duel and surprised her with his agility and strength.

Garrett has a fondness for local baked goods and is often seen sneaking extra treats from Brona Gilroy's bakery.

Garrett is known for his sharp memory. He can recite entire passages from ancient texts that he studied decades ago.

Goals

learning

peace

family

adventure

Plot

Garrett's secret skill with the sword may come in handy if Luminia is threatened by bandits or other dangers. A plot could be developed around Garrett having to reveal his skills to protect the village.

Garrett is still mourning the death of his wife, who passed away several years ago. A plot could explore how Garrett copes with this loss and finds comfort in his family and faith.

Garrett is curious about the mystery surrounding the forgotten event that is often spoken about in Luminia. A plot could center around Garrett's quest to uncover the truth behind the event and its significance to the village's history.

Garrett's adventurous granddaughter, Haley, may inspire him to embark on a new adventure. A plot could focus on their journey together and the obstacles they face along the way.

Secret

He can still wield a sword with deadly accuracy.

Relationship

Boren Voyle: Garrett and his son Boren have a deep mutual respect for each other. Boren looks up to his father and often seeks his advice on business matters.

Enda Voyle: Garrett's relationship with his wife Enda is very strong. They have been married for many years and have weathered many storms together.

Erris Voyle: Garrett has a close relationship with his daughter Erris. She is very protective of him and often checks on him to make sure he is taking care of himself.

Kearey Voyle: Garrett has a somewhat strained relationship with his granddaughter Kearey. She often feels that he does not take her dreams of becoming a scholar seriously.

Anecdotes

Garrett once helped a group of adventurers navigate through the Old One's Forest and find a hidden treasure trove.

During a particularly harsh winter, Garrett risked his own safety to bring food and supplies to a neighboring village that was suffering from a famine.

Garrett is known for his love of riddles and often challenges his family and colleagues to solve them.

Garrett once spent an entire day lost in the woods but managed to find his way back to Luminia by following the stars.

Goals

wisdom

prosperity

legacy

adventure

Plot

Garrett's past as a thief could come back to haunt him if someone were to discover his secret.

A group of scholars has come to Luminia in search of a rare map that Garrett may possess.

Garrett's grandson Arias has joined a group of adventurers and gone missing. Garrett may need to intervene to help locate him.

A rival guild is trying to sabotage The Navigators' Alliance. Garrett must work to protect the guild's interests and reputation.

Secret

He is a former thief

Group

Group Name: Kerswell family

key_figure: yes

rank: elder

relationship: Highly respected by family members

situation: grandfather

family_name: Kerswell family

Job

Workplace: The Harvest Guild

description: A kind and gentle old man who is always ready to help

fullname: Godwin Kerswell

job: elder

key_figure: no

nickname: The Wise One

quote: “I may be old, but I remember stories that will captivate your imagination.”

rank: retired

relations: father of Baen and Amery, grandfather of Eckert

skill level: master

working_clothes: old woolen trousers, simple shirt, walking stick

workplace: The Harvest Guild

Relationship

Amery Kerswell: Godwin's youngest son is carefree and friendly, and he often stops by Godwin's house to share a glass of mead and catch up on the latest news. Godwin worries about Amery's lack of ambition and responsibility, but he still loves him as a son.

Baen Kerswell: Godwin's eldest son is hardworking and dedicated, much like his father. They often share stories over a glass of mead and discuss the future of the village.

Dara Kerswell: Godwin's granddaughter is curious and adventurous, and she often accompanies Godwin on his walks in the ancient forest. She is fascinated by the Old One and the unique continent, and Godwin enjoys sharing his knowledge with her.

Dexer Kerswell: Godwin's uncle is a grumpy old man who often complains, but Godwin still regards him with respect and affection. Dexer taught Godwin how to farm and hunt, and they share a deep bond that transcends their generational and personality differences.

Eckert Kerswell: Godwin's grandson is confident and hardworking, much like his father Baen. He looks up to Godwin as a role model and often seeks his guidance in matters of business and leadership.

Odger Kerswell: Godwin's father is wise and patient, and he loves to tell stories about the history of Luminia. Godwin respects his father's wisdom and often seeks his advice on matters of leadership.

Sorley Kerswell: Godwin's cousin is an optimistic and adventurous young man who Godwin sees as the future of Luminia. They share a love for exploration and learning, and Godwin often takes Sorley on walks in the ancient forest to share stories and wisdom.

Anecdotes

When Godwin was a young man, he and his friends ventured deep into the ancient forest, where they encountered a group of scholars from a distant land. The scholars shared stories about their travels, introducing Godwin to new cultures and ideas. This encounter inspired Godwin to become a scholar himself, studying the history of Luminia and its unique continent.

Godwin once helped a lost traveler find their way back to Luminia, sharing stories and mead with them along the way. The traveler turned out to be a powerful merchant who was so impressed by Godwin's hospitality that he decided to establish a trade route with Luminia, further boosting the village's prosperity.

During a harsh winter, when food supplies were scarce, Godwin organized a community effort to share the remaining harvest among the villagers. His generosity and leadership inspired the people of Luminia to work together and overcome adversity.

Goals

build orphanage

preserve legacy

advise leaders

record history

Plot

Godwin's dream of building an orphanage is threatened by a group of bandits who demand a ransom in exchange for safe passage through Luminia. Godwin will have to use all his wisdom and negotiating skills to prevent violence and protect the village.

A group of adventurers arrives in Luminia, seeking guidance and information about the Old One and the unique continent. Godwin sees this as an opportunity to record the history of Luminia and share it with the world, but he also fears that the adventurers may disturb the delicate balance of the village.

One of Godwin's grandchildren, Dara, discovers an ancient text that reveals a dark secret about the non-gendered God of Luminia. Godwin must decide whether to share this knowledge with the village leaders and risk shaking their faith, or to keep it a secret and risk losing his credibility.

Godwin learns that the Harvest Guild may have to increase their crop production to meet the demands of a neighboring village. Godwin sees this as an opportunity to trade with new partners and expand the influence of Luminia, but he also fears that the increased production may deplete the natural resources of the village and harm its ecosystem.

Secret

He has saved up some money to build an orphanage for the children of the village

rank: senior

working_clothes: leather armor, longsword, shield

Relationship

Alley Mosley: Gunner deeply respects his aunt and values her knowledge of the village's history. He often seeks her advice when dealing with family or village matters. Gunner hopes that one day, he will be as wise as Alley.

Artis Mosley: Gunner has a complicated relationship with his cousin. He loves him as a family member but often disagrees with his sarcastic and lazy nature. However, Gunner admires Artis's extensive knowledge of religious lore and thinks he could be a valuable asset if he would apply himself more.

Creena Mosley: Gunner sees his youngest daughter as his little angel and enjoys seeing her grow up to be a good-natured and helpful person. He hopes to teach her to be more confident and adventurous but also protect her from the dangers of the outside world.

Dalmer Mosley: Gunner sees his grandson as the future of the family and the village. He tries to guide him to become a responsible and caring individual, but he also worries about his impulsive nature. Gunner believes that Dalmer has great potential but needs to mature before he can take over his responsibilities.

Wren Mosley: Gunner loves his daughter deeply and is proud of her academic achievements. He hopes to pass on his family's love for knowledge to her and foster her curiosity to discover more about the unique continent.

Anecdotes

Goals

protect

preserve

legacy

prosper

Plot

Gunner discovers that an ancient artifact has been stolen from the local temple, and the thief is someone close to him. He must find out who the culprit is before the village is cursed by the Gods.

Gunner learns that there is a group of bandits planning to attack the village to steal their trade goods. He must convince the local authorities to take action before it's too late.

Gunner's youngest daughter, Creena, goes missing in the ancient forest. He must lead a search party and find her before she is lost forever.

The local authorities suspect Gunner's cousin, Artis, of being involved in a forbidden religious practice. Gunner must navigate his loyalty to his family and his duty to protect the village's values.

Secret

None
