family_name: Blackitt family

Job

Workplace: The Wayfinders

description: charming but reckless

fullname: Hedwig Blackitt

job: scout

key_figure: no

nickname: The Bold

quote: There's always something new to discover

rank: senior

relations: Close friends with Artis

skill level: expert

working_clothes: leather armor and cloak

workplace: The Wayfinders

Relationship

Artis Alkott: Hedwig works with Artis at The Wayfinders. Despite Artis' reputation for being reckless, the two get along well and often work together on scouting missions.

Bullin Blackitt: Bullin is Hedwig's cousin and although he can be grumpy at times, he is loyal to the family and supports Hedwig in his endeavors.

Ennis Alkott: Ennis is the leader of The Wayfinders and is often at odds with Hedwig due to their different approaches to exploration. However, Ennis recognizes Hedwig's talent and values his contributions to the team.

Girta Blackitt: Hedwig's mother Girta is overprotective of him and worries about his safety on his expeditions. Despite this, Hedwig and his mother have a close relationship and he values her advice and support.

Jurg Blackitt: Hedwig is very close to his grandfather Jurg. Jurg taught Hedwig everything he knows about exploration and the mysteries of Luminia.

Anecdotes

One time, Hedwig stumbled upon an unexplored cave system while on a scouting mission. He convinced his team to explore it even though they were hesitant. They ended up finding a treasure trove of ancient artifacts that shed light on the forgotten event that occurred in Luminia's history.

Hedwig once got into a heated argument with Ennis Alkott, the leader of The Wayfinders. Hedwig believed that they should take more risks while Ennis thought they should be more cautious. In the end, they compromised and decided to take calculated risks that ultimately led to success.

During a fight club match, Hedwig faced off against a formidable opponent. Despite being outmatched, Hedwig managed to win by using his quick thinking and improvisation skills.

Goals

exploration

discovery

thrill-seeking

adventure

Plot

Hedwig discovers an ancient map that leads to a long lost tomb of a famous adventurer. In order to claim the treasure, he must work with a rival team who are also after the same treasure.

Hedwig's involvement in the fight club gets him into trouble when he is caught by the authorities. He must clear his name and find a way to continue fighting without getting caught.

While exploring a dangerous area, Hedwig and his team stumble upon evidence of a cult that is trying to summon a powerful demon. They must stop the cult before it's too late.

Hedwig discovers a new species of monster that has been terrorizing nearby villages. He must track down the monster and figure out how to defeat it before it can cause any more harm.

Secret

he's involved in an underground fight club

Job

Workplace: The Cult of the Old One

description: Sassy and sharp-tongued.

fullname: Heleth Blackitt

job: oracle

key_figure: yes

nickname: The Wise

quote: The Old One says, 'Never hurt a dwarf who knows where you sleep.' Or, wait...

rank: boss

relations: Revered by all members of the group, particularly close to Gwen, sometimes irritated by Icabod's lack of faith

skill level: master

working_clothes: white dress, blue scarf

workplace: The Cult of the Old One

Relationship

Dunarl Hardwick: Although they work together, Heleth and Dunarl don't communicate much. She respects his stoic personality, but sometimes wishes he would show more emotion.

Girta: Heleth and Girta have been close companions ever since Heleth lost her husband. They often spend time together, discussing local beliefs and sharing stories. Heleth has also helped Girta raise her son Dragar and have a very close relationship.

Gwen Ironside: Heleth works with Gwen, the senior seamstress. She admires Gwen's warrior skills and is often fascinated by her expertise in sewing. Heleth considers her a valuable member of the team.

Icabod Denisson: Heleth works with Icabod, the apprentice smith. While she acknowledges his hardworking nature, she finds him quite gruff and is not particularly fond of him.

Anecdotes

Heleth once accidentally mistook a visitor to the village for a messenger from The Cult of the Old One and started lecturing them about the importance of proper sacrifices. The visitor was quite puzzled at first but then quickly realized what was happening and laughed it off.

When Heleth was a young girl, she snuck into a library belonging to a famous scholar without permission. Though she was caught, she was able to convince the scholar to teach her everything they knew.

As a teenager, Heleth fell in love with a local blacksmith, who wrote a love letter for her. She still keeps it after all these years, hidden in a secret drawer.

Goals

Knowledge

Legacy

Adventure

Discovery

Plot

Heleth suspects that there is something strange going on in the ancient forest surrounding Luminia. Her curiosity drives her to investigate, but as she gets closer to the truth, she realizes that whatever is happening might not be meant to be discovered by mortals.

A crisis hits The Cult of the Old One when one of their offerings is stolen. Heleth is called upon to help investigate the matter and recover the stolen goods. As she probes deeper, she uncovers a conspiracy within the cult.

Heleth discovers a long-forgotten passage in an old manuscript that might hold the key to a mystery surrounding Luminia's founding. She recruits a team of adventurers to help her explore the mountains and find the lost secrets.

Secret

she has an old love letter from a past beau

Group Name: Hardwick family

situation: eldest daughter

family_name: Hardwick family

Job

Workplace: Hardwick Milling Co.

description: Strong-willed woman who learns fast

fullname: Heleth Hardwick

job: miller

key_figure: no

nickname: The Miller’s Hand

quote: "I’ve found my calling in the mill"

rank: apprentice

relations: Daughter of Havelock and Garline, sister of Galtar, wants to prove herself to her family

skill level: novice

working_clothes: Green dress, white apron

workplace: Hardwick Milling Co.

Relationship

Dunarl Hardwick: Heleth loves her father deeply, but the two clash frequently over leadership decisions. Despite their disagreements, Heleth respects Dunarl's wisdom and experience, and hopes to one day take over the reins of the family business from him.

Garline Hardwick: Heleth has a complicated relationship with her mother, whom she sees as tough and no-nonsense. Though they sometimes clash over Heleth's independence and ambition, Garline loves her daughter deeply and is fiercely protective of her.

Gruhn Hardwick: Heleth gets along well with her younger brother, and often turns to him for help when she needs it. Though they have their differences, Gruhn looks up to Heleth and admires her determination and bravery.

Havelock Hardwick: Heleth has always been close with her grandfather, whom she sees as a mentor and role model. Havelock has taught Heleth a great deal about the art of milling and business management, and is proud of the woman she has become.

Stephan Blackwood: Heleth enjoys working with Stephan at the mill, and appreciates his curious and helpful nature. The two often exchange tips and tricks for improving their millwork, and share a passion for exploring the wilderness around Luminia.

Anecdotes

When Heleth was just a child, she heard a rumour that there was a hidden treasure in the ancient forest near Luminia. Determined to find it, she spent weeks exploring the woods, searching for clues. Eventually, she stumbled upon an old map that led her to the treasure - a stash of ancient dwarven coins buried deep in the earth. Heleth was thrilled by her discovery, and has kept the coins as a reminder of her adventure ever since.

One day, while out hiking in the mountains near Luminia, Heleth came across a wounded bear cub. Without hesitating, she scooped the cub up in her arms and carried it back to the village, where she nursed it back to health. The bear cub became her constant companion, following her wherever she went and even sleeping at the foot of her bed at night. Though eventually the bear grew too big to live with her in her home, Heleth still visits him in the forest every chance she gets.

Goals

leadership

adventure

prosperity

independence

Plot

Heleth's father is growing increasingly ill, and struggling to maintain his leadership of the family business. As tensions rise between Heleth and her father, it becomes clear that someone will have to take over soon. Will Heleth step up to the challenge and become the new leader of Hardwick Milling Co.?

Rumours are swirling that there is a long-forgotten dwarven city hidden somewhere in the mountains near Luminia. Heleth is determined to find it, but she'll need the help of her friends in the Hardwick family if she's going to succeed. Will they be able to navigate the treacherous wilderness and uncover the city's secrets?

A wealthy merchant from a nearby town has expressed interest in purchasing Hardwick Milling Co. from the family. Though Heleth is initially hesitant to sell, she realizes that the family could use the money to expand their business and improve their prospects. Will she be able to convince her father and the rest of the family to sell, or will they decide to hold onto the business at all costs?

Secret

none

The Bison Runners face financial troubles, and Henna must use her magic to save the company and her colleagues.

Henna's past as an outsider comes back to haunt her when a group of bandits arrive in Luminia with a grudge against outsiders.

Jarok Ainsworth

"Let the music guide your soul"

a human bard who has been leading The Luminia Entertainers for over 30 years

  • Age: 68
  • Age look: old
  • Beauty: average
  • Clothes: colorful robe with a cap
  • Eyes: brown
  • Gender: male
  • Generation: mid
  • Habits: Jarok is a true performer at heart, and he spends most of his time rehearsing with The Luminia Entertainers or scouting for new talent to join his group. In his free time, Jarok enjoys exploring the ancient forest surrounding the village, where he finds inspiration for new songs and stories. He is also a frequent visitor to the local tavern, where he entertains the guests with his music and storytelling.
  • Hair: short and gray
  • Height: tall
  • Origin: outsider
  • Physical detail:
  • Race: human
  • Skin: light
  • Structure preference: guild
  • Surname: Ainsworth
  • Traits: charismatic, wise, adventurous, charming
  • Weight: average

Group

Group Name: Ainsworth team

key_figure: yes

rank: group leader

relationship: respected by all members of the group

situation: old member

family_name: Ainsworth team

Job

Workplace: The Luminia Entertainers

description: charismatic leader of The Luminia Entertainers

fullname: Jarok Ainsworth

job: bard

key_figure: yes

nickname: The Maestro

quote: "Music is the universal language that brings people together."

rank: boss

relations: Respected by all members of the group, especially Orla whom he sees as a protégé

skill level: master

working_clothes: colorful robes with a lute embroidered

workplace: The Luminia Entertainers

Relationship

Afnaerad: Jarok has known Afnaerad for decades and considers him to be like a grandfather figure. He often seeks Afnaerad's advice on personal matters, and they share a bond over their love of music.

Derry Kerswell: Jarok sees potential in Derry and enjoys teaching her new songs and techniques. He hopes that she will one day become a valued member of The Luminia Entertainers and continue the group's legacy.

Ennis Gilroy: Jarok and Ennis have been friends for many years, and their playful banter is a common sight at the local tavern. Jarok considers Ennis to be a valuable member of The Luminia Entertainers and appreciates his positive attitude.

Herne Urdro: Jarok has a deep respect for Herne's craftsmanship and often commissions him to make new instruments for The Luminia Entertainers. They share a love of music and often discuss new ideas for performances.

Orla Atwood: Jarok sees Orla as a talented singer and songwriter, and he often seeks her opinion on new songs. He is proud of her progress and hopes to one day pass on the leadership of The Luminia Entertainers to her.

Anecdotes

Once, during a performance, Jarok accidentally set his robe on fire from a nearby candle. He kept playing and singing without missing a beat until someone from the audience threw a bucket of water on him to put out the flames.

Jarok once convinced a group of scholars to come to Luminia to study the village's unique beliefs and customs. He personally gave them a tour and even performed some of his music for them.

When The Luminia Entertainers were struggling financially, Jarok sold his prized lute to keep the group afloat. It was a difficult decision, but he felt that preserving the group's legacy was more important.

Jarok has a reputation for being a bit of a flirt, and many women in the village have fallen for his charming personality and smooth singing voice.

Goals

fame

legacy

innovation

collaboration

Plot

A new bard arrives in Luminia and challenges Jarok's status as the village's most renowned musician.

The Luminia Entertainers are invited to perform for the emperor in the capital city. Jarok sees this as an opportunity to cement the group's legacy and takes charge of the preparations.

Jarok discovers a mysterious artifact in the ancient forest surrounding Luminia. He becomes obsessed with unlocking its secrets and neglects his duties as the leader of The Luminia Entertainers.

A wealthy merchant offers to fund The Luminia Entertainers in exchange for exclusive performances. Jarok must decide whether to take the offer and risk compromising the group's artistic integrity.

Secret

none

Job

Workplace: Honey Keepers

description: Wise and patient, always shares his knowledge with the group

fullname: Julian Rhinehart

job: beekeeper

key_figure: yes

nickname: The Sage

quote: "Bees are the keystone species of our ecosystem."

rank: senior

relations: Respected by all members of the group, looks after both his children Gum Rhinehart and Sadie Muldoon, seen as a fatherly figure by the group.

skill level: expert

working_clothes: traditional beekeeping suit made of light colours

workplace: Honey Keepers

Relationship

Arias Voyle: Julian sees a lot of potential in Arias and encourages his curiosity and love of adventure.

Bixler Voyle: Julian sees a lot of himself in Bixler and takes him under his wing, acting as a mentor and guide.

Boren Voyle: Julian has a friendly relationship with Boren, often discussing beekeeping techniques and nature magic with him.

Enda Voyle: Julian has a special bond with Enda due to their shared love for nature and wisdom.

Erris Voyle: Julian has a deep respect for Erris as the family head and trusts her completely.

Garrett Voyle: Julian respects Garrett for his years of experience and wisdom, often seeking his advice.

Kearey Voyle: Julian admires Kearey's ambition and curious nature, and often shares his knowledge with her.

Anecdotes

Once, Julian discovered a swarm of bees had settled in a nearby tree. He spent hours coaxing the bees into a new hive, displaying his patience and expertise.

Julian once wrote a book on the benefits of honey and nature, which became a bestseller in Luminia and beyond.

Goals

honey production

nature preservation

knowledge sharing

empowerment

Plot

Julian discovers that the bees in Luminia are slowly dying off due to pollution and climate change. He teams up with other experts in beekeeping and nature magic to try and save the bees.

A group of adventurers comes to Luminia seeking Julian's help in navigating the ancient forest surrounding the village. They discover that Julian knows more about the forest than anyone else and they form a close bond.

The Honey Keepers come under threat from a rival company seeking to take over the honey production in Luminia. Julian becomes a leader in the fight to protect the Honey Keepers and their way of life.

  • Age: 45

She wakes up early in the morning, reads books and newspapers, prepares breakfast, and goes to work. After work, she returns home, cooks dinner, and spends time with her family. Katerine does not like to waste time or money and tries to be economical in everything she does.

key_figure: yes

nickname: The Keeper

quote: "Knowledge is power"

rank: boss

relations: Keeps a watchful eye on the group's activities, appreciates Muriel's creativity, but often clashes with Bullin's pessimistic mindset

skill level: master

working_clothes: Long dress and shawl

Relationship

Beck Kerrigan: Katerine's apprentice at The Luminarian Society of Ideologies. Katerine sees potential in Beck's curiosity about the world and encourages him to keep learning.

Bixler Voyle: Katerine's eldest son. They have a strained relationship due to Katerine's strictness and Bixler's love for adventure.

Boren Voyle: Katerine's brother-in-law. They have a cordial relationship but don't interact much due to their different interests.

Bullin Blackitt: Katerine's colleague at The Luminarian Society of Ideologies. They often have discussions about different philosophies and ideologies.

Enda Voyle: Katerine's grandmother. They share a deep respect for tradition and often reminisce about old times.

Erris Voyle: Katerine's sister-in-law. They are close friends and often exchange recipes and parenting tips.

Garrett Voyle: Katerine's grandfather. They have a quiet and reserved relationship, but Garrett is always there to offer wise advice when Katerine needs it.

Kearey Voyle: Katerine's youngest daughter. They have a difficult relationship due to Kearey's rebelliousness and Katerine's strictness.

Muriel Ironside: Katerine's colleague at The Luminarian Society of Ideologies. Katerine often helps Muriel with her shyness and encourages her to express herself through art.

Phineas Darkmantle: Katerine's apprentice at The Luminarian Society of Ideologies. Katerine is strict with Phineas but recognizes his talent for art and encourages him to pursue it.

Anecdotes

Katerine once saved a rare book from a fire at The Luminarian Society of Ideologies, which proved to be a valuable addition to their library.

Katerine is known for being very strict about the organization and cleanliness of the library. She once scolded an apprentice for not putting away a book in its proper place.

Goals

preserve tradition

promote knowledge

protect heritage

ensure prosperity

Plot

Katerine discovers a mysterious book at The Luminarian Society of Ideologies that contains ancient knowledge about Luminia and puts her in danger.

Katerine's son Bixler Voyle goes missing while on an adventure, and Katerine sets out to find him and bring him back.

Katerine is accused of stealing a rare book from The Luminarian Society of Ideologies, and she must prove her innocence to save her reputation and job.

history-book

Plot

Kealey's plans to open an antique shop have been met with resistance from some members of the community who fear that it will take business away from the existing shops in town. Kealey must navigate these conflicts while pursuing her dream.

Kealey's intimate knowledge of Luminia's history could lead to her uncovering a long-forgotten mystery, putting her in danger.

Secret

She is planning to open an antique shop

Kealey Gant

"Do the job right, or don't do it at all."

tough but fair, Kealey has been in charge of the Great Bison Company for decades

  • Age: 60
  • Age look: old
  • Beauty: average
  • Clothes: heavy wool coat, sturdy boots
  • Eyes: brown
  • Gender: yes
  • Generation: old
  • Habits: Kealey is a workaholic who takes her responsibilities seriously. She always ensures that the job is done right, no matter how difficult or challenging it may be. She is also fiercely independent and does not like to rely on others for help. In her free time, Kealey loves to explore the ancient forest surrounding Luminia, seeking adventure and new experiences. She enjoys hunting, fishing, and camping, and always comes back with amazing stories to share with her colleagues.
  • Hair: short white hair
  • Height: average
  • Origin: outsider
  • Physical detail:
  • Race: boss
  • Skin: weathered
  • Structure preference: guild
  • Surname: Gant
  • Traits: resilient, no-nonsense, determined
  • Weight: average

Group

Group Name: Rusling cult

key_figure: Gant

rank: leader

relationship: commands respect from everyone

situation: female

family_name: Rusling cult

Job

Workplace: Council of Wisdom

description: tough but fair, in charge of the Great Bison Company

fullname: Kealey Gant

job: boss

key_figure: yes

nickname: Bison Master

quote: "Don't mess with the herd"

rank: master

relations: respected by all members as a leader, but can be stern and unforgiving

skill level: expert

working_clothes: leather vest and trousers

workplace: Council of Wisdom

Relationship

Arias Voyle: Kealey has a good relationship with Arias Voyle, Erris and Boren's grandson. Arias is an energetic and curious young man who shares Kealey's love of adventure and exploration.

Bixler Voyle: Kealey has a good relationship with Bixler Voyle, Erris and Boren's eldest son. Bixler is an adventurous young man who shares Kealey's love for exploration and discovery.

Boren Voyle: Kealey has a cordial relationship with Boren Voyle, Erris's husband, who is also a respected member of the community. Boren is a loyal customer of the Great Bison Company, and often recommends Kealey's services to others.

Enda Voyle: Kealey has a deep respect for Enda Voyle, Erris's mother and the oldest member of their living group. Enda's vast life experience has made her a wise and patient mentor to Kealey and others in the community.

Erris Voyle: Erris Voyle is the head of Kealey's living group, and an important figure in Luminia. Kealey respects Erris's wisdom and experience, and often seeks her counsel on matters related to the community.

Garrett Voyle: Kealey respects Garrett Voyle, Erris's father and a quiet, reserved elder. Garrett's years of experience have made him a wise observer, and Kealey often seeks his advice on important matters.

Kearey Voyle: Kealey has a somewhat rocky relationship with Kearey Voyle, Erris and Boren's youngest daughter. Kearey has aspirations of becoming a scholar, which conflicts with Kealey's own no-nonsense approach towards life.

Anecdotes

Kealey once saved Vetta Darrow from a pack of wolves while they were exploring the mountains outside Luminia. Since then, Vetta has been an unwavering supporter of Kealey and the Great Bison Company.

Kealey lost her left pinky finger while hunting a particularly aggressive boar. She never talks about the incident, but it has become a legendary story in Luminia.

Rumors abound that Kealey once went toe-to-toe with the Old One, the mysterious entity that many locals believe is responsible for the village's prosperity. No one knows what really happened, but according to some accounts, Kealey emerged victorious from the encounter.

Goals

prosperity

adventure

justice

legacy

Plot

A rival business has set up shop in Luminia, and is threatening to undercut the Great Bison Company's prices. Kealey must find a way to beat the competition, or risk losing everything she has worked so hard for.

Kealey discovers a forgotten event from Luminia's past that could shed light on the origins of the Old One. But in order to learn more, she must venture into the dangerous mountains beyond the village, where many dangers lurk.

One of Kealey's former lovers comes back into her life, stirring up old emotions and threatening to destabilize her relationship with the Great Bison Company. Kealey must decide whether to pursue a new romance or stick to the path she has chosen.

Secret

she once fell in love with a rival hunter from another village

Kelsey Darkmantle

"The spirits of the forest teach us that all things are connected"

an old woman who is well respected by the community for her knowledge and kindness

  • Age: 75
  • Age look: old
  • Beauty: average
  • Clothes: simple woolen shawl and skirt
  • Eyes: grey
  • Gender: female
  • Generation: old
  • Habits: Kelsey has a habit of spending time meditating in the forest. She believes that this practice helps her to connect with the spirits of the forest and gain insights into the mysteries of the world. She also tends to forget things due to her old age but is always willing to listen to others' perspectives to learn something new. In addition to her spiritual practices, Kelsey enjoys spending time with her family, especially her grandchildren.
  • Hair: short, curly and white
  • Height: small
  • Origin: native

Job

Workplace: The Council of Wisdom

description: Well-respected elder

fullname: Kelsey Darkmantle

job: village elder

key_figure: yes

nickname: The Kind

quote: Be the change you want to see in the world

rank: senior

relations: mentored by Ashlan Pendrake

skill level: expert

working_clothes: brown cloak with a silver clasp

workplace: The Council of Wisdom

Relationship

Blayde Darkmantle: Kelsey's nephew, Blayde, has always looked up to his aunt for guidance, especially when it comes to agriculture. Kelsey taught Blayde how to plant and harvest crops and has instilled in him a sense of pride for his land and hard work.

Tressa Darkmantle: Kelsey holds a deep admiration for her granddaughter Tressa, who is an independent and intelligent woman passionate about education. Kelsey often shares stories from her own life to inspire Tressa to pursue her goals and dreams.

Vespera Nightshade: Kelsey has a mutual respect and friendship with Vespera Nightshade, the herbalist boss at The Council of Wisdom. They often share knowledge about the forest and its plants, which makes them both more effective at their jobs.

Anecdotes

Kelsey once healed a wounded bear that wandered into the village and became a guardian spirit for her.

A young adventurer once came to Kelsey for guidance and ended up staying in Luminia for a year, learning from the wisdom keeper every day.

Once, Kelsey forgot where she kept her book of herbs and approached a local child for help. The child found the book after only a few minutes of searching and Kelsey gifted them with a beautiful necklace.

Goals

knowledge

connection

spirituality

prosperity

Plot

Kelsey is known to have a mysterious connection to the forest spirits, which could lead to potential storylines involving the supernatural forces in the area.

Her work at The Council of Wisdom puts her in a position to make crucial decisions for the village, making her a potential target for those who oppose her ways of thinking.

Kelsey's close relationship with her family members opens up possibilities for character arcs involving them, such as conflicts or secrets that could impact the entire group.

Secret

has a mysterious connection to the forest spirits

Kerr Bancroft

I've seen too much in my life to believe in fairy tales

An old grizzled veteran, with a sharp wit and a rough exterior.

  • Age: 65
  • Age look: old
  • Beauty: average
  • Clothes: heavy plate armor over a chainmail shirt
  • Eyes: blue
  • Gender: male
  • Generation: mid
  • Habits: Kerr wakes up early every morning to begin work at The Living Trees Guild. He spends most of his day carving intricate designs into wood, often taking breaks to chat with his fellow guild members. When he's not working, Kerr can usually be found at the local tavern, swapping war stories with other veterans and adventurers.
  • Hair: short, grey and balding
  • Height: tall
  • Origin: outsider
  • Physical detail:
  • Race: human

family_name: Bancroft team

Job

Workplace: The Living Trees Guild

description: Old veteran with sharp wit and rough exterior

fullname: Kerr Bancroft

job: woodcarver

key_figure: no

nickname: The Grizzled

quote: "A good chisel is worth its weight in gold"

rank: senior

relations: Respects others' skills and experience, enjoys teaching and sharing stories

skill level: expert

working_clothes: leather apron, green shirt, brown pants

workplace: The Living Trees Guild

Relationship

Gade Rhinehart: Kerr has taken Gade under his wing, teaching him the nuances of woodcarving and helping him navigate the intricacies of life in Luminia.

Jordan Grimes: Kerr is wary of Jordan's mischievous streak, but can't help feeling a grudging respect for her sharp mind and quick wit.

Katerine Brasher: Kerr sees a younger version of himself in Katerine and takes it upon himself to mentor her in the ways of adventuring. He is fiercely protective of her and considers her one of his closest friends.

Rudd Halstead: Kerr respects Rudd's intellect and curiosity, though he sometimes finds the young scholar's questions tiresome.

Anecdotes

Despite his gruff demeanor, Kerr once saved the life of a young boy who had fallen into the river while playing. The boy's mother was so grateful that she invited Kerr over for dinner every week for a year.

Kerr once got into a heated argument with the local blacksmith over the best way to forge a sword. The argument lasted for hours and attracted a large crowd, but in the end, Kerr's opinion prevailed.

Kerr is known to have a soft spot for animals, particularly dogs. He can often be found feeding scraps to the strays that wander through the village.

Goals

redemption

legacy

protection

revenge

Plot

Kerr's past catches up with him when a former member of the royal guard arrives in Luminia, seeking revenge for Kerr's criticism of the king.

The Living Trees Guild is threatened by a rival guild that seeks to monopolize the woodcarving industry in Luminia. Kerr and his colleagues must find a way to protect their livelihoods.

Kerr discovers the existence of a mysterious artifact hidden deep in the ancient forest surrounding Luminia. He sets out on a dangerous quest to recover it, but must contend with greedy treasure hunters and dangerous monsters along the way.

Secret

he was dishonorably discharged from the royal guard for criticizing the king

Dardan Denby: Kerr loves his young apprentice Dardan and enjoys teaching him about exploration and adventure.

Morna Denby: Kerr is very fond of his playful and imaginative granddaughter Morna. He enjoys spending time with her and telling her stories about his adventures.

Stianna Denby: Kerr has a close and affectionate relationship with his mother Stianna. He often seeks her advice and guidance when faced with difficult decisions.

Anecdotes

Kerr once saved his entire team from a group of dangerous monsters by using his persuasive skills to negotiate a truce.

Kerr and his team once discovered an ancient artifact that was later sold to a wealthy collector for a large sum of money.

Kerr once got into a fistfight with a member of a rival exploration team over a woman they both fancied. The woman later revealed that she was not interested in either of them.

Goals

exploration

discovery

adventure

romance

Plot

Kerr's secret love affair with a woman from a rival guild could potentially cause problems for him and his team if it is discovered.

Kerr's desire for exploration clashes with his father's plans for the family's future, which could lead to a conflict within the Denby family.

Kerr and his team may stumble upon a dangerous discovery during one of their expeditions, which could have significant consequences for Luminia.

Secret

He is in love with a woman from a rival guild.

relations: Highly respected by the group for his hard work and dedication to the job, but can be overprotective of the group and slow to trust outsiders. Has a particularly close relationship with Phineas, who often seeks his advice on the best way to tend to the village's flowers and plants.

Phineas Versh: Kirwin and Phineas have a friendly yet competitive relationship, as they both take pride in their work at the Gardeners Guild.

Anecdotes

Once, Kirwin spent an entire night tending to a rare flower that he had discovered in the forest. When he brought it back to the garden, it quickly became the talk of the town and brought in many visitors to Luminia.

Kirwin is known for his excellent memory and often surprises his colleagues by remembering details about plants that they had long forgotten.

Goals

protect

love

admire

learn

Plot

Kirwin's secret love for one of the druids could potentially cause issues if it were to be revealed. This plot could explore the consequences of Kirwin's feelings being made public, and how it affects his relationships with his colleagues and family members.

Kirwin's dream of starting his own landscaping business could become a reality, but he must first overcome the challenges of securing funding and finding clients. This plot could involve Kirwin seeking advice from business owners in Luminia, and convincing his family members to support him.

Secret

secretly in love with one of the druids

Workplace: The Guardian's Pact

description: charismatic and impulsive, with a thirst for adventure

fullname: Malek Brasher

job: guard

key_figure: no

nickname: The Enthusiast

quote: "Let's do it!"

rank: apprentice

relations: Looks up to Dardan's skill

skill level: novice

working_clothes: leather armor - blue and silver

workplace: The Guardian's Pact

Relationship

Dardan Brasher: Malek looks up to his father, Dardan, who is a skilled guard with a quick wit. Malek wants to prove himself to his father and follow in his footsteps.

Delp Kerrigan: Delp is a boss at The Guardian's Pact and Malek's colleague. He is wise and respected within the community, and often acts as a mentor figure for Malek.

Delp Scarrow: Delp is a senior guard at The Guardian's Pact and Malek's colleague. He is impulsive and brash, and often clashes with Malek over their different approaches to problem-solving.

Kealey Brasher: Kealey is Malek's aunt and a member of Malek's living group. She knows everything about Luminia's history and Malek often seeks her out for advice and guidance.

Lorna Brasher: Lorna is Malek's cousin and a member of his living group. She is a curious girl who loves nature walks. Malek enjoys spending time with her, and often goes on hikes with her into the forest.

Anecdotes

Malek once saved a lost child who had wandered into the forest. He found her cowering behind a tree and escorted her back to the village, earning the gratitude of her parents.

Malek once challenged a traveling bard to a duel of wits and won, impressing his friends but also earning the ire of the bard.

Malek once attempted to swim across the river as a dare from his friends, but got caught in the current and had to be rescued by his father.

Goals

adventure

discovery

courage

achievement

Plot

Malek discovers a hidden entrance to a long-forgotten tomb in the forest. He convinces his friends to accompany him inside, but they soon find themselves trapped and have to fight their way out.

Malek is accused of stealing a valuable artifact from a local scholar. Despite his protestations of innocence, Malek is forced to go on the run to clear his name and find the real thief.

Malek's father, Dardan, is kidnapped by bandits while on patrol. Malek and his colleagues at The Guardian's Pact set out to rescue him and bring the bandits to justice.

Secret

He has a fear of drowning

Relationship

Canice Ironside: Malek greatly values Canice's wisdom and knowledge of family traditions, often seeking his advice.

Egan Helwick: Malek's relationship with his father is strained, as he feels the pressure of living up to his expectations. However, Malek still respects Egan's resourcefulness and wisdom.

Elspeth Helwick: Malek thinks of his cousin Elspeth as energetic and fun-loving, but often finds her lack of structure and responsibility frustrating.

Erris Helwick: As his mother, Erris holds a special place in Malek's heart. He turns to her for emotional support and guidance whenever he feels overwhelmed.

Evelyn Helwick: Malek takes pride in his daughter Evelyn's intelligence and curiosity, and tries to encourage her love for books whenever he can.

Stianna Mallory: Malek sees his boss as grumpy and judgmental, but respects her position and expertise.

Anecdotes

Malek once lost a hefty sum of money in a game of cards and had to sell some of his family's prized possessions to pay off his debt.

When Malek was still an apprentice weaver, he accidentally spilled dye on the best fabric in the shop, earning him a stern lecture from his boss Stianna Mallory.

Goals

redemption

wealth

family legacy

self-control

Plot

Malek's gambling problem gets out of hand and he starts stealing from Clothier's Collective to fund his addiction.

Malek discovers a rare type of fabric that could catapult Clothier's Collective to the top of the trade industry in Luminia, but he must navigate a tricky business deal with another guild to obtain it.

A group of adventurers come to Luminia looking for a guide through the ancient forest, and Malek is recruited due to his knowledge of the local area. However, he discovers that some of the adventurers have ulterior motives and must protect his village.

Malek's father Egan falls ill and Malek must take care of him while continuing to manage Clothier's Collective. The stress of these responsibilities causes Malek's addiction to resurface.

Secret

Has a gambling problem

Job

Workplace: Iron Hoof Guild

description: A wise and nurturing dwarf who loves baking

fullname: Marba Hardwick

job: farrier

key_figure: yes

nickname: The Baker Lady

quote: "I have the perfect shoe for your horse."

rank: boss

relations: Has a motherly relationship with apprentices, respected by other guild members.

skill level: master

working_clothes: leather apron, brown

workplace: Iron Hoof Guild

Relationship

Enda Voyle: Enda is Marba's mother and they have a very special bond. Enda has always been a source of wisdom and guidance for Marba, and she cherishes every moment they spend together.

Erris Voyle: Erris is Marba's daughter and they have a very close relationship. Marba is very proud of Erris and her accomplishments as a mother and a businesswoman.

Garrett Voyle: Garrett is Marba's father-in-law and they have a mutual respect for each other. Garrett doesn't talk much, but Marba knows that he always has valuable advice to offer when he does.

Thershaele Coralaeth: Marba is very fond of Thershaele, her young apprentice at the Iron Hoof Guild. She sees a lot of potential in her and enjoys teaching her everything she knows about working with horses.

Anecdotes

Marba once saved a horse from a terrible case of hoof rot by using a traditional dwarven remedy. The horse's owner was so grateful that they gifted Marba a rare book on horse care.

Marba is famous in the village for her delicious cookies. Whenever there is a special event or celebration, people always ask Marba to bring her cookies.

Goals

legacy

scholars

prosperous

family

Plot

Marba's family has been having some financial troubles lately due to the increasing competition from other traders. Marba is trying to come up with new ways to expand their business and ensure that their legacy continues.

Marba is worried about the Iron Hoof Guild's future as fewer and fewer young people are interested in becoming farriers. She is considering starting an apprenticeship program to train the next generation of farriers.

Recently, Marba has been having some health issues which have made it difficult for her to work as much as she used to. She is worried about how this may affect her family's income and is trying to find alternative solutions.

Marba's family has just received news that a distant relative has passed away, leaving them a significant inheritance. However, there are rumors that the inheritance may not be as straightforward as it seems and Marba is worried about the potential consequences.

Secret

she is hard of hearing

Morna Atwood

A mother's love knows no bounds

Wise and caring

  • Age: 68
  • Age look: old
  • Beauty: average
  • Clothes: Plain blue dress and white apron
  • Eyes: hazel
  • Gender: female
  • Generation: old
  • Habits: Morna has a very structured routine and begins each day with a cup of tea and a few minutes of quiet meditation. She then spends several hours in the forest hunting and gathering herbs for her healing practice. In the afternoons, Morna returns to the village to tend to her family and spend time with her grandchildren. She ends her day with a warm meal and a good book before heading to bed.
  • Hair: Long, thin silver hair
  • Height: average
  • Origin: native
  • Physical detail:
  • Race: human
  • Skin: White
  • Structure preference: family

  • Traits: Wise, caring, patient, nurturing

Group

Group Name: Atwood family

key_figure: no

rank: grandmother

relationship: Loving and supportive towards her grandchildren

situation: old

family_name: Atwood family

Job

Workplace: The Bison Runners

description: Wise and caring

fullname: Morna Atwood

job: hunter and healer

key_figure: yes

nickname: The Healer

quote: "Take care of your body and it will take care of you"

rank: boss

relations: motherly towards everyone, especially Ennis

skill level: master

working_clothes: simple hunting clothes with medicinal pouches

workplace: The Bison Runners

Relationship

Bixler Voyle: Bixler is Morna's eldest grandson and is known for his adventurous spirit. Morna admires Bixler's courage but worries about his safety. She often gives him lectures on the importance of caution and preparation before heading out into the wilderness.

Enda Voyle: Enda is Morna's mother and is one of the oldest members of the family. Morna has a deep respect for her mother and often turns to her for guidance and advice. Enda has also passed down many of her healing practices to Morna.

Ennis Atwood: Ennis is Morna's grandson and also works as a hunter for The Bison Runners. Morna has always been extremely close to Ennis and sees a lot of herself in him. She enjoys spending time with him and often shares stories of her adventures in the wilderness.

Henna Mallory: Henna is also a senior hunter at The Bison Runners and is one of Morna's closest friends. They often go on hunting trips together and share a deep love for the wilderness and its mysteries.

Regan Rhinehart: Regan is a senior hunter at The Bison Runners and has worked alongside Morna for many years. They have a deep respect for each other and often share stories and advice about hunting and healing practices.

Anecdotes

One time, Morna healed a fellow hunter's broken leg using only some herbs and a few incantations. The hunter was amazed by her skill and dubbed her 'the miracle worker'

Morna once took her grandchildren on a camping trip in the forest, where she taught them how to forage for food and build a fire from scratch. They still talk about that trip to this day

During a particularly harsh winter, Morna spent weeks traveling through the snow-covered forests, bringing food and supplies to families who were struggling to survive. Many people credit her with saving their lives.

Goals

teach

heal

protect

preserve

Plot

Morna has been secretly practicing forbidden magic for years, using it to heal some of the more difficult cases. However, the local authorities have recently caught wind of her practices and are threatening to arrest her.

Morna has been approached by a group of scholars who are interested in her healing techniques. They offer to pay her for her knowledge and even suggest that they could help her protect her secret from the authorities. However, Morna is hesitant to share her practices with outsiders and fears the repercussions of being associated with the scholars.

One of Morna's grandchildren has fallen ill with a mysterious ailment that no one in the village seems to be able to cure. Morna is determined to help her grandchild and sets out on a quest to find a rare herb that she believes holds the key to the cure.

Secret

She secretly practices forbidden magic

quote: "I never miss my target"

rank: boss

relations: sees Cammy as a close friend

skill level: master

working_clothes: leather vest and pants

workplace: Wandering Wayfarers

Relationship

Alvy Kerrigan: An apprentice farmer who respects Morna's skills as a hunter but is sometimes intimidated by her daring nature.

Boren Voyle: Morna's uncle and a respected father figure to her. Morna looks up to Boren and admires his charisma and wisdom.

Cacey Mallory: A senior thief who is envious of Morna's skills and often tries to one-up her. Morna dislikes Cacey's deceitful nature and tries to avoid her whenever possible.

Cammy Grayden: An apprentice cook who is bubbly and talkative, like Morna. The two share a love for adventure and often trade stories around the campfire.

Durwin Hitch: A veteran blacksmith who is stern and no-nonsense but has a deep respect for Morna's skills. He often provides her with weapons and tools for hunting.

Erris Voyle: Morna's aunt and a caring and protective mother figure to her. Morna often turns to Erris for advice and guidance.

Fargas Mallory: An optimistic apprentice blacksmith who looks up to Morna and hopes to join her on one of her adventures someday.

Kelsey Mallory: A senior guard and adventurer who shares Morna's love for exploration. Morna and Kelsey often go on hunting trips together and have become close friends.

Anecdotes

Morna once fought a giant bear in the ancient forest and emerged victorious, earning her the respect of her fellow huntresses.

Morna befriended an old scholar from Luminia who taught her about the history of the region and the legends of the Old One.

Morna is known to sing songs around the campfire during long nights on the road, lifting the spirits of her team members.

Goals

adventure

exploration

independence

tradition

Plot

Morna's family is being threatened by a group of bandits who are planning to raid their village. Morna must find a way to protect her family and drive out the bandits.

While on a hunting trip, Morna discovers an ancient artifact that unlocks a mystery related to the forgotten event in local beliefs. Morna must solve the mystery before it falls into the wrong hands.

The Wandering Wayfarers come across a mysterious cult that worships a non-gendered God and is planning to perform a dangerous ritual. Morna must stop the cult and save her team from danger.

Secret

none

During a particularly harsh winter, Nally organized a community effort to keep everyone fed and warm. She made sure that no one went without food or shelter during the cold months.

When one of her grandchildren expressed interest in becoming a scholar, Nally took it upon herself to teach them everything she knew about the local history and traditions.

Plot

Nally begins to worry about the encroaching civilization threatening the natural beauty of Luminia. She begins to rally the community to take action and protect their land from outside forces.

When a group of adventurers arrives in Luminia seeking information about the Old One, Nally takes it upon herself to share her knowledge and guide them through the ancient forest.

Nally's connection to the spirits becomes stronger, revealing a new path for her to explore. She must decide whether to embrace this new destiny or continue on her current path as family matriarch.

Secret

She has a deep connection to the spirits of the forest.

description: wise and respected leader

nickname: the elder

rank: boss

working_clothes: simple robe, medallion, walking stick

Relationship

Alexia Barrington: Nash is impressed by his granddaughter Alexia's musical talents and enjoys attending her performances. He also admires her compassionate nature and sees a lot of potential in her.

Ashley Barrington: Nash cherishes his wife Ashley and credits her with being his rock and source of support through all of life's challenges. He admires her kindness and nurturing nature and feels grateful to have her by his side.

Barlowe Barrington: Nash has a close relationship with his eldest son, Barlowe, and is grateful for his diplomatic skills and ability to handle difficult situations. He often relies on Barlowe to assist him in his duties at The Devout of the Non-Gendered God.

Creel Barrington: Nash loves his son Creel deeply but struggles to understand his brusque and independent nature. He worries that Creel may be too closed off and is always looking for ways to try and connect with him on a deeper level.

Griffon Barrington: Nash is incredibly proud of his grandson, Griffon, and enjoys spending time with him whenever he can. He sees a lot of potential in Griffon and is always willing to offer advice or guidance when needed.

Kearey Barrington: Nash is proud of his daughter Kearey's artistic talent and enjoys attending her gallery showings. He also appreciates her sophistication and quick wit and often seeks her out for advice on matters of diplomacy.

Nally Barrington: Nash has a deep respect and affection for his mother and values her wisdom and wit. He often seeks her advice when faced with difficult decisions and enjoys hearing stories from her youth.

Wren Barrington: Nash loves his youngest daughter, Wren, dearly but worries that her impulsive nature may lead her into danger one day. He tries to encourage her adventurous spirit while also emphasizing the importance of caution and common sense.

Anecdotes

Nash once saved a child who had fallen into the river while out on a morning walk. He dove in and pulled the child to safety, earning the gratitude of the entire village.

Nash has a reputation for being able to diffuse tense situations with his calming presence and wise words.

Nash is an excellent storyteller and often entertains children and adults alike with tales of Luminia's rich history and folklore.

Goals

peace

prosperity

spiritual enlightenment

community

Plot

Nash begins to suspect that the kingdom is planning to attack Luminia and must convince his fellow villagers to take action to defend themselves.

Nash discovers a hidden cache of artifacts related to the Old One, a mysterious deity worshipped by the village's ancestors, and must decide how to best preserve them for future generations.

Nash is unexpectedly thrust into a leadership role when his son, Barlowe, falls ill and must navigate the challenges of keeping the village running smoothly while also caring for his family.

Secret

He worries that the village will be attacked by the kingdom.

He spends most of his day working with the cooperatives or helping out his family. In his free time, Nash enjoys reading up on local beliefs and forgotten events that shaped the history of Luminia. He doesn't have much patience for small talk or idle gossip.

Relationship

Alanna Gilroy: Alanna is Nash's youngest daughter, and he loves her cheerful and playful personality. Nash enjoys spending time with Alanna and teaching her about the history and traditions of their family and village. He knows that Alanna has a bright future ahead of her and wants to do everything he can to help her achieve her dreams.

Alley Talbot: Alley is a compassionate and sharp-minded elder at The Devout, and Nash often seeks her advice on important matters. He admires Alley's wisdom and knowledge and enjoys spending time discussing the history of their village with her.

Anson Gilroy: Nash is close to his eldest son Anson, who shares his outgoing and adventurous personality. Nash admires Anson's charisma and optimism and enjoys spending time with him whenever he can. He sees a lot of himself in Anson and wants to make sure that he doesn't make the same mistakes he did when he was younger.

Ashley Barrington: Ashley is a supportive and nurturing cook at The Devout, and Nash enjoys her company. He knows that he can always count on Ashley to provide nourishing meals for their cooperative and appreciates her dedication to her work.

Ashley Gilroy: Ashley is Nash's wife and provides a nurturing and caring presence in his life. Nash values her opinions and knows that she will always be there for him and their family. He admires Ashley's patience and empathy and loves her deeply.

Boren Gilroy: Boren is Nash's uncle and serves as a wise and compassionate elder in their family. Nash looks up to Boren for guidance and wisdom and values his opinions on important matters. Despite Boren's gruff exterior, Nash knows that he has a heart of gold and cares deeply for him.

Brona Gilroy: Brona is Nash's aunt and provides a creative and curious outlook on life. Nash appreciates her eccentricity and enjoys her company. He often goes to her for advice and inspiration when he needs it. He knows that Brona will always be there to support him and his family.

Creel Barrington: Creel is an apprentice blacksmith at The Devout, and Nash often works with him. He appreciates Creel's hardworking and brusque personality and knows that he can always count on him to get the job done. Nash enjoys mentoring Creel and providing guidance when he needs it.

Dara Gilroy: Dara is Nash's cousin, and they have a close relationship. Nash saved Dara's life when she fell in the river as a child, and they have been inseparable ever since. Nash admires Dara's mischievous and daring personality and enjoys her company. He knows that he can always count on her in times of need.

Derry Gilroy: Nash is proud of his eldest daughter Derry and her diligence and reliability. He encourages her to pursue her dreams and provides guidance when she needs it. Nash understands that Derry is shy and cautious, but he knows that she has the potential to achieve great things.

Gunner Mosley: Gunner is a senior guard at The Devout, and Nash trusts him to protect their cooperative. Nash admires Gunner's vigilance and commitment to his duty and enjoys chatting with him whenever they have the chance.

Nash Barrington: Nash works alongside Nash Barrington at The Devout, and they have a mutual respect for each other. Nash admires Nash Barrington's wisdom and diplomatic skills and enjoys working with him towards the common good of their cooperative.

Nolan Fullet: Nolan is an outsider ambassador who often visits Luminia to trade with their cooperatives. Nash is wary of Nolan's charming and cunning personality but acknowledges his importance in maintaining Luminia's trade relationships. He knows that he must approach Nolan with caution and diplomacy to prevent any harm from coming to their village.

Tara Talbot: Tara is an efficient and ambitious administrator at The Devout, and Nash respects her work ethic and dedication. He enjoys discussing important matters with her and values her opinions on matters related to their cooperative.

Anecdotes

Nash once saved his cousin Dara from drowning in the river when she fell in while trying to catch fish for dinner.

Nash is known for his stubbornness, which often leads to heated arguments with his wife Ashley. Despite their differences, they have a deep and loving relationship.

Nash is a fierce protector of his family, and he once chased off a group of bandits who tried to steal from their farm.

Nash has a hidden talent for painting, which he rarely shows to others.

Goals

protect

teach

preserve

inspire

Plot

Nash's secret betrayal of a friend comes back to haunt him when the friend returns to Luminia seeking revenge. Nash must confront his past mistakes and make amends before it's too late.

A group of outsiders threatens the peaceful way of life in Luminia, and Nash must use his diplomacy skills to prevent violence and find a peaceful resolution.

Nash discovers a forgotten artifact that unlocks ancient mysteries about the founding of Luminia. However, his discovery attracts the attention of a powerful wizard who seeks to claim the artifact for himself.

The Devout's prosperity is threatened when a rival cooperative tries to sabotage their trade deals. Nash must use all his wisdom and authority to protect The Devout's interests and preserve its legacy.

Secret

once betrayed a friend

Niall once baked a cake for the annual village fair and won first prize. Her secret ingredient was a pinch of magic, which added an extra layer of flavor to the cake.

Niall once saved a group of adventurers who were lost in the ancient forest near Luminia. She used her knowledge of local herbs and magic to guide them back to safety.

Goals

baking

dreams

Niall discovers a long-forgotten event in Luminia's history that could change the way the villagers see their non-gendered God. She must decide whether to share this information with the community or keep it to herself.

Secret

dreams of opening a small bakery

Relationship

Cammy Talbot: Cammy Talbot, the senior nurse, has a somewhat contentious relationship with Nolan due to their differing views on how to run things. Cammy is more caring and curious, while Nolan is more ambitious and intimidating. However, they both ultimately have the same goal of keeping the village healthy and safe.

Derry Talbot: Nolan has a good working relationship with Derry Talbot, the boss herbalist at The Devout of the Non-Gendered God. They both share a love for order and structure and work well together to keep things running smoothly.

Nash Barrington: Nolan and Nash Barrington, the village leader, have a mutual respect for each other even though they come from different backgrounds. Nolan sees Nash as a wise and respected leader who can help advance the goals of his group, while Nash sees Nolan as a valuable ally in keeping the village prosperous and protected.

Anecdotes

Nolan once single-handedly stopped a group of bandits from attacking the village by using his charisma and cunning to talk them down.

There are rumors that Nolan has a secret underground network of spies who report back to him with information on the goings-on in the village.

Goals

power

protection

loyalty

expansion

Plot

Nolan is worried that a rival group may be trying to encroach on their territory and wants the players to investigate.

One of Nolan's trusted lieutenants has gone rogue and is causing trouble in the village. Nolan wants the players to bring them back to face justice.

Secret

None

Nolan Ironside

"You want the best? Come to me!"

charismatic blacksmith

  • Age: 40
  • Age look: middle-age
  • Beauty: very pretty
  • Clothes: thick leather apron with a red shirt
  • Eyes: blue
  • Gender: male
  • Generation: mid
  • Habits: Nolan has a habit of working late into the night at his forge, often fueled by his love for his craft and the alcohol he drinks to help him relax. He can be found most days at his forge, wearing a thick leather apron and a red shirt, working on metal objects of all kinds. Nolan also has a habit of keeping to himself and distancing himself from others at times, which can be attributed to his drinking problem.
  • Hair: short and dark
  • Height: tall
  • Origin: native

Group

Group Name: Ironside family

key_figure: yes

rank: family head

relationship: respected, but distant with some members of the family

situation: eldest son

family_name: Ironside family

Job

Workplace: Iron Quill Inc.

description: charismatic and skilled with metalwork

fullname: Nolan Ironside

job: blacksmith

key_figure: yes

nickname: Ironheart

quote: "The forge is my sanctuary."

rank: boss

relations: mentor to Elatha, friendly with other group members

skill level: expert

working_clothes: leather apron, blacksmith gloves

workplace: Iron Quill Inc.

Relationship

Bixler Ironside: Nolan's young grandson Bixler is a curious and energetic child who he loves to dote on. He sees a lot of himself in Bixler and hopes to help guide him on his own path in life.

Brock Ironside: Nolan's cousin Brock is a reckless troublemaker who he has had a complicated relationship with in the past. While they have had their differences, Nolan still cares about Brock and wants to help him find his place in the world.

Cam Ironside: Nolan's father Cam is a respected blacksmith and head of the Ironside family. While they share a close bond, they also have had their disagreements in the past over family matters and Nolan's addiction.

Canice Ironside: Nolan has a complicated relationship with his aunt Canice, who serves as the family elder and keeper of family traditions. While she respects his leadership, she often disagrees with his decisions and has challenged him on multiple occasions. Despite this, they still share a strong bond and Canice trusts Nolan to do what is best for the family.

Dowd Ironside: Nolan's grandfather Dowd is an old hunter who Nolan admires greatly. Despite their age difference, they share a special bond over their love for the outdoors and hunting. Dowd has served as a mentor to Nolan in the past, teaching him valuable lessons about life and survival.

Elspeth Ironside: Nolan's mother Elspeth is a kind-hearted healer who he loves and respects deeply. While they do not always see eye-to-eye on everything, they share a close-knit bond and Nolan knows that he can always count on his mother for support and guidance.

Evelyn Ironside: Nolan's granddaughter Evelyn is a studious bookworm who he finds fascinating. He enjoys talking with her about books and learning, and hopes to encourage her love of knowledge in any way he can.

Gwen Ironside: Nolan's grandmother Gwen is a fierce warrior and expert seamstress who he looks up to greatly. He often seeks her out for advice and enjoys hearing stories of her past adventures and triumphs.

Henna Ironside: Nolan's sister Henna is a confident and ambitious trader who he admires greatly. While they have had their disagreements, Nolan respects Henna's drive and determination to succeed in the world.

Muriel Ironside: Nolan's youngest sister Muriel is a shy and dreamy artist who he worries about often. He hopes to help her pursue her dreams and find success in her own right, but also worries about her ability to handle herself in the world.

Una Ironside: Nolan's cousin Una is a gentle and empathetic gardener who he gets along well with. They often bond over their shared love of nature, and Nolan enjoys hearing about her latest projects and plans.

Anecdotes

Nolan once crafted a beautiful sword for local adventurer, Fiona Nightingale, who used it to slay a dragon and become a legend among the people of Luminia.

When Nolan was younger, he and his cousin Brock snuck into the forest to hunt for deer. They ended up getting lost and had to spend the night in the woods, surviving only on berries and mushrooms they found.

One time, Nolan got into a heated argument with his aunt Canice over family traditions and values. Despite their disagreement, Canice still trusts Nolan to lead the family and make the right decisions.

Goals

redemption

success

overcoming addiction

making a name for himself

Plot

One potential plot involving Nolan could be centered around his struggle with addiction. Perhaps a concerned family member or friend tries to intervene and help him overcome his problem, leading to some difficult conversations and confrontations. Alternatively, Nolan's addiction could lead to some serious consequences, causing him to lose everything he has worked for.

Another plot involving Nolan could be related to his desire to make a name for himself in the larger world. Perhaps he receives an exciting opportunity to craft a special item for an important figure, putting his skills to the test and forcing him to confront his own limitations and insecurities.

A third potential plot could involve Nolan's family dynamics and relationships. Perhaps tensions boil over and someone challenges his leadership, forcing him to defend his position and make difficult decisions that affect both himself and his loved ones.

Secret

He has a drinking problem

Group

Group Name: Kerswell family

key_figure: yes

rank: family head

relationship: Highly respected by family members

situation: father

family_name: Kerswell family

Job

Workplace: The Harvest Guild

description: Wise and experienced man who loves to tell stories

fullname: Odger Kerswell

job: elder

key_figure: no

nickname: The Storyteller

quote: “I’ve been around long enough to have an interesting story for every situation.”

rank: retired

relations: father of Baen and Amery, grandfather of Eckert

skill level: master

working_clothes: simple woolen robe, walking stick, hat

workplace: The Harvest Guild

Relationship

Amery Kerswell: Odger is fond of his carefree and friendly youngest son, Amery, but worries that he doesn't take life seriously enough.

Baen Kerswell: Odger has a close relationship with his eldest son, Baen. They share a deep love for the land and a desire to preserve Luminia's legacy.

Dara Kerswell: Odger dotes on his curious and adventurous granddaughter, often taking her on walks through the forest and telling her stories about the village's past.

Dexer Kerswell: Odger's uncle Dexer is a thorn in his side, constantly complaining about everything and never satisfied. Despite this, Odger still loves him as family.

Eckert Kerswell: As his confident and hardworking grandson, Eckert is someone that Odger sees a lot of himself in. He takes it upon himself to mentor and guide the young man.

Godwin Kerswell: Odger's relationship with his grandfather Godwin is one of mutual respect and admiration. They share a deep love for Luminia and its people.

Sorley Kerswell: As a cousin who shares Odger's sense of adventure, Sorley is someone that Odger looks up to and respects as a fellow explorer.

Anecdotes

Once, during a particularly harsh winter, Odger single-handedly saved The Harvest Guild's crops from freezing by spending countless hours tending to each one with care and attention.

Odger once helped a group of scholars from a nearby city decipher an ancient text that had long been thought indecipherable, earning him the respect and admiration of academics in the region.

There is a legend in Luminia that tells of a powerful artifact hidden deep within the ancient forest. Many have searched for it over the years, but none have succeeded. Odger claims to have seen it once, but refuses to reveal its location.

Goals

preserving legacy

sharing wisdom

revealing mysteries

strengthening community

Plot

Odger's great-grandchild has recently returned to Luminia, causing Odger to fear that his secret might come to light. He must decide whether to reveal the truth to the family or continue to keep it hidden at all costs.

Rumors have been circulating that The Harvest Guild's crops have been failing due to an unknown disease. Odger takes it upon himself to investigate, revealing a sinister plot by a rival village to sabotage Luminia's prosperity.

Odger discovers a long-forgotten journal written by one of Luminia's founders, detailing a dark secret about the village's origins. As he delves deeper into the mystery, he realizes that some will stop at nothing to keep the truth hidden.

Secret

He has a great-grandchild from his forbidden relationship with a nomad girl

Anecdotes

Quinn once brewed a remedy that cured the local lord's headache, earning him a place of honor at the lord's court.

During a thunderstorm, Quinn used his knowledge of divination to predict that a fallen tree would cause flooding in the village. His warning allowed the villagers to take precautions and prevent any damage.

Goals

discover new herbal remedies

deepen his understanding of magic

maintain peace and harmony in the village

pass on his knowledge to the next generation

Plot

Quinn is approached by a group from a neighboring village who seek his help in deciphering an ancient scroll. However, the scroll contains dangerous magic that could unleash a powerful curse on the village if not handled carefully.

Quinn is tasked with finding a rare herb deep in the mountains that is said to have powerful magical properties. However, the herb is guarded by a fearsome beast that has already claimed the lives of several adventurers.

Quinn discovers a dark secret about the coven's past that threatens to tear the group apart, and must decide whether to keep the secret hidden or confront the other members.

Secret

Renny Skarholt

“Life is short, so make it sweet”

Wise elder frequently sought for advice

  • Age: 70
  • Age look: old
  • Beauty: ugly
  • Clothes: Shawl and long skirt in muted colors
  • Eyes: Grey
  • Gender: female
  • Generation: young
  • Habits: Renny wakes up early every morning to tend to her bees before the sun becomes too hot. She spends most of her day outside amongst the hives, carefully nurturing her colonies and collecting honey and beeswax. In the evenings, she enjoys reading by the fire and sharing stories with her family. Renny also practices meditation and yoga to stay centered and calm.
  • Hair: Short and straight, white
  • Height: Small
  • Origin: native
  • Physical detail:
  • Race: human
  • Skin: Fair

Job

Workplace: Honey Keepers

description: A wise elder frequently sought for advice

fullname: Renny Skarholt

job: beekeeper

key_figure: yes

nickname: Bee Lady

quote: "The bees will tell you all you need to know."

rank: senior

relations: Patient with the apprentices, respected by all members of the group, seen as a matriarchal figure by the group.

skill level: master

working_clothes: simple white dress and bonnet

workplace: Honey Keepers

Relationship

Aria Hawksmoor: Renny has been grateful for Aria's knowledge and expertise as a healer, and has sought her out for advice on many occasions. Renny sees the natural world and its remedies as closely linked to her own beekeeping practices.

Arthur Farnsworth: Renny admires Arthur's precision and skill as a carpenter, and has commissioned him to create several pieces of custom furniture for her family over the years.

Dextrel Skarholt: Renny has always had a deep respect for her wise and perceptive husband Dextrel, who has been her partner in life for many years. Though they have their disagreements, they share a deep love and understanding of each other.

Elatha Skarholt: Renny has a close and loving relationship with her daughter Elatha, who shares her spiritual beliefs and values family above all else. Renny often seeks Elatha's advice when faced with difficult decisions.

Fenris Grimsson: Renny sees potential in Fenris's eagerness to learn to hunt and track, and hopes that he will develop a respect for the natural world and its balance. She worries that his impulsive nature could put himself or others in danger.

Gryan Oakley: Renny has little interaction with Gryan, but respects his reliable and skilled work as a stonemason. She hopes that he will continue to provide quality building materials for the village.

Gum Rhinehart: Renny respects Gum's confidence and energy as a leader of the Honey Keepers, though she sometimes worries that he may be too eager to take risks. She appreciates his support of her beekeeping skills.

Jarek Ironsides: Renny finds Jarek's enthusiasm for learning the craft of beekeeping infectious, and enjoys teaching him about the bees. She hopes that he will continue to grow in his knowledge and love for the hives.

Julian Rhinehart: Renny has a strong bond of respect and friendship with Julian, who shares her love of bees and appreciation for the natural world. Renny values Julian's wisdom and patience, and looks to him as a mentor.

Kaelin Blackthorn: Renny does not know Kaelin well, but respects his skill as a blacksmith and appreciates the weapons he has crafted for her family over the years.

Keavey Skarholt: Renny loves her impulsive and energetic granddaughter Keavey, but worries that the young girl will not take her studies seriously enough. Renny tries to balance her concern with her desire to encourage Keavey's creativity and curiosity.

Leif Magnusson: Renny has known Leif for many years, and appreciates his skill as a hunter and his deep knowledge of the forest. She sometimes worries that he takes too many risks in his adventures, but respects his love and appreciation for nature.

Morna Denby: Renny enjoys working with Morna at the Honey Keepers, and is impressed by the young woman's imagination and positivity. Renny sees great potential in Morna as a beekeeper.

Nally Skarholt: Renny is proud of her adventurous granddaughter Nally, and enjoys sharing stories of her own travels and experiences with the young woman. Nally has shown an interest in beekeeping, which pleases Renny greatly.

Sadie Muldoon: Renny has been impressed by Sadie's quiet but observant nature, and sees great potential in her as a future beekeeper. Renny tries to instill in Sadie a respect for the bees and a passion for sustainable practices.

Anecdotes

Renny once saved a swarm of bees that had taken up residence in the local tavern. She carefully captured the swarm and relocated them to one of her own hives.

Renny is known for her delicious honey cakes, which she bakes for special occasions in the village.

Renny once helped a young couple overcome their fertility problems using a traditional herbal remedy.

Goals

legacy

spirituality

community

knowledge

Plot

Renny has recently been having vivid dreams that seem to be connected to a forgotten event from the village's past. She is determined to uncover the truth and discover what it means for the present.

Renny fears that the increasing demand for honey and beeswax could lead to over-harvesting and harm to the bee colonies. She is considering leading a campaign to raise awareness of sustainable beekeeping practices.

Renny's granddaughter Nally has been showing signs of an interest in beekeeping, but her mother Elatha is against the idea. Renny must navigate this family conflict and find a way to pass on her knowledge to the next generation.

Secret

None

family_name: Coralaeth family

Job

Workplace: The Caretakers' Society

description: A wise elder who is respected by everyone

fullname: Sumil Coralaeth

job: healer

key_figure: no

nickname: the herbalist

quote: "Nature has all the remedies, we just need to know where to find them"

rank: senior

relations: mentor and friend to Biagio

skill level: expert

working_clothes: long white robe with a green shawl

workplace: The Caretakers' Society

Relationship

Angihar Coralaeth: Sumil dotes on her granddaughter and enjoys spending time with her, often telling her stories and teaching her about the plants and animals in the ancient forest.

Nimestidar Coralaeth: Sumil has a deep admiration for her grandmother's wisdom, but has always sensed that there were secrets that Nimestidar kept hidden.

Ruibrarii Coralaeth: Sumil sees a lot of herself in her adventurous cousin and is often happy to share stories with her.

Tahlumillean Coralaeth: Sumil has a deep respect for her father and often seeks his advice on matters related to the family.

Thershaele Coralaeth: Sumil loves her youngest son dearly, but sometimes struggles to connect with his rebellious nature.

wyn'Talyththi Coralaeth: Sumil is proud of her eldest daughter's beauty and intelligence, but sometimes worries that she may be too focused on appearances.

Anecdotes

When Sumil was a young woman, she ventured into the ancient forest beyond Luminia's borders. She stumbled upon a mysterious cave that was said to contain the secrets of the Old One. Sumil spent days exploring the cave and learning its secrets. When she emerged, she was transformed by the knowledge she had gained.

Sumil is known for her ability to heal even the most severe injuries. Once, when a young adventurer was gravely injured by a pack of wolves, Sumil was able to bring him back from the brink of death with a powerful poultice.

Sumil is a skilled storyteller and often regales her grandchildren with tales of her adventures. Her stories are filled with magic, mystery, and wisdom.

Goals

teach

heal

preserve

pass on

Plot

Sumil's long life has given her a unique perspective on the world around her. She may be approached by adventurers seeking guidance or knowledge that only she can provide.

Sumil's work with The Caretakers' Society may lead her into conflict with other factions in Luminia. She may have to navigate tricky political situations to ensure that her guild can continue to provide medical care to those in need.

Sumil may be approached by younger members of the Coralaeth family seeking advice or guidance. She must balance her desire to protect her family with their need to live their own lives.

Sumil's long life has also made her a witness to many secrets and mysteries. She may be approached by those seeking information about forgotten events or ancient artifacts that she has encountered in her travels.

Secret

None

rank: boss

relations: distant from other members

skill level: expert

working_clothes: fine clothes, quill, ink bottle
