Relationship

Alley Talbot: Tara's grandmother Alley is a compassionate and sharp-minded elder who often advises Tara on matters of the heart and the mind. Alley is one of Tara's biggest supporters and always encourages her to pursue her dreams.

Artis Talbot: Tara's father Artis is a traditional farmer who has more conservative views on religion and farming than Tara. However, he loves his daughter and respects her choices, even if he does not always agree with them.

Brona Gilroy: Tara respects Brona's creative talents as a baker and often collaborates with her on various projects related to The Devout of the Non-Gendered God. Brona, in turn, admires Tara's leadership qualities and seeks her guidance on personal matters.

Cammy Talbot: Tara is very close to her younger sister Cammy, whom she often mentors and advises on life decisions. Cammy looks up to Tara and seeks to emulate her strong leadership qualities.

Derry Gilroy: Tara's distant relative Derry is a shy but diligent student at The Devout of the Non-Gendered God and a member of the Gilroy family. Tara often gives her advice and helps her with her studies, as she sees potential in her as a future healer.

Derry Talbot: Tara's mother Derry is a wise and experienced herbalist whom Tara respects and seeks advice from when it comes to matters of health and medicine. Derry is proud of her daughter's achievements and supports her in her endeavors.

Nash Barrington: As the village leader and a senior member of The Devout of the Non-Gendered God, Nash is one of Tara's trusted colleagues and advisors. She often consults with Nash on important matters related to the cooperative and its future.

Stianna Talbot: Although they have different personalities, Tara and her sister Stianna share a deep bond over their love of baking and their passion for the cooperative. Tara often helps Stianna with her baking business and supports her in her other endeavors.

Anecdotes

Once, during a village festival, Tara saved an old woman who had collapsed due to heat stroke by carrying her to the nearest shade and providing her with water and fruit.

Tara once organized a charity event to help poor families in Luminia by collecting donations from the villagers and distributing them equally among the families in need.

Tara's favorite hobby is gardening, and she loves to spend her free time nurturing flowers and plants in her family's farm.

Goals

prosperity

leadership

innovation

growth

Plot

Tara discovers a unique herb in the ancient forest that has healing properties and decides to use it for the benefit of the cooperative. However, she faces challenges from rival factions who want to use the herb for their own gains.

The Devout of the Non-Gendered God faces financial difficulties due to a decrease in the number of worshippers. Tara comes up with a plan to attract more people to the worship services by introducing innovative rituals and spreading awareness about the unique beliefs of the cooperative.

Tara's ambitious nature leads her to clash with her parents and grandparents, who have more traditional views on farming and religion. She must find a way to balance her personal goals with the expectations of her family and the community.

A mysterious illness spreads in Luminia, affecting both humans and animals. Tara takes charge of the situation and collaborates with local scholars and healers to find a cure. However, they soon realize that the source of the illness is not natural but magical, and they must find a way to deal with its origins.

Secret

none

Anecdotes

When Torey was still an apprentice, she accidentally caught a giant octopus. Her colleagues were impressed with her bravery and skill in wrestling the creature into submission.

Torey once challenged Conor Roane to a fishing competition. The two spent all day on the river trying to catch the largest fish. In the end, Torey won by catching a 20-pound trout.

financial stability

Torey's curiosity about the Old One and the forgotten event could lead her down a dangerous path. She may uncover secrets that were meant to stay buried, which could put her and her colleagues in danger.

Anecdotes

Vinter once helped a group of adventurers navigate the treacherous mountain pass outside of Luminia. His knowledge of the area and his ability to read the natural signs saved the group from disaster.

Vinter was once approached by a wealthy merchant who offered him a large sum of money to reveal the location of a rare and valuable herb that only grows in the forest surrounding Luminia. Vinter politely declined, preferring to keep the knowledge of the herb within his family and his community.

Goals

Plot

Vinter discovers a forgotten artifact in the forest that sheds new light on the history of his people. He must decide whether to share this knowledge with the outside world or keep it a secret.

A group of outsiders arrive in Luminia and begin to challenge the beliefs and customs of the natives. Vinter must decide whether to stand up for his traditions or embrace the new ways.

One of Vinter's children becomes involved in a dangerous plot that threatens the safety of the village. Vinter must navigate the delicate balance between loyalty to his family and his duty to his community.

working_clothes: long green robes and sandals

workplace: Cloaks of Coercion

Relationship

Ansel Atwood: As an apprentice lookout, Ansel is one of the newer members of the Cloaks of Coercion. Vora has taken him under her wing, recognizing his potential as a talented and disciplined member of the group. Vora sees a lot of herself in Ansel and hopes to help him develop into a leader like herself.

Bryson Bannister: As one of the grumpier members of Vora's family group, Bryson often clashes with Vora over issues related to guild operations. Despite their disagreements, Vora respects Bryson's dedication to the group and his strong work ethic. She admires his honesty and integrity, and she sees him as a valuable voice of reason in many discussions and decisions related to the Cloaks of Coercion.

Cammy Grayden: Cammy and Vora have known each other for years, having grown up together in Luminia. While Cammy is not a member of the Cloaks of Coercion, she is deeply invested in the success and wellbeing of Vora's family group. Vora sees Cammy as a source of moral support and often confides in her about personal matters that affect the guild and her family group.

Delp Scarrow: Vora has mixed feelings about Delp, who is known for his rash impulsiveness and quick temper. While she recognizes his value as a fierce defender of the group, Vora often finds herself at odds with Delp over issues related to safety and strategy. Vora worries that Delp's hot-headedness could put the group in danger, but she also sees his loyalty as a valuable asset to the guild.

Dunla Baskin: Vora looks up to Dunla as a source of knowledge and expertise on a wide range of topics. Dunla's encyclopedic knowledge of Luminia's history and local beliefs has often proved invaluable to the Cloaks of Coercion, and Vora often consults with her when planning strategic moves for the guild.

Durwin Hitch: As the leader of Vora's family group, Durwin and Vora have a close working relationship. Vora often seeks Durwin's counsel and advice in strategic matters, and the two share a deep understanding of the inner workings of the Cloaks of Coercion. Vora greatly admires Durwin's experience and discipline, and she looks up to him as a father figure in many ways.

Gamack Domack: As the oldest member of the Cloaks of Coercion, Gamack is revered for his wisdom and his extensive knowledge of the town's history and local beliefs. Vora greatly respects Gamack and often seeks his advice on matters related to the guild's legacy and reputation. Gamack sees a lot of potential in Vora and has taken on a mentorship role in her life, encouraging her to continue developing her leadership skills.

Stephan Silverwood: Vora has a tense and often contentious relationship with Stephan, who is known for his ruthless and violent tendencies. While Vora recognizes the value of having an enforcer on the team, she often finds herself at odds with Stephan over issues related to the safety and wellbeing of their fellow members. Despite their disagreements, the two harbor a grudging respect for one another's skills and dedication to the guild.

Tahlumillean Coralaeth: Vora has worked with Tahlumillean on several river raids in the past, and the two have developed a mutually respectful working relationship. Vora appreciates his expertise and experience on the water and often seeks his advice on tactical matters related to river-based missions.

Anecdotes

Vora once saved the life of a fellow guild member who was being attacked by a rival gang. She managed to take down three of them on her own before the rest of their group retreated.

Vora is known for her impeccable memory and attention to detail, and she once uncovered a significant security breach in the guild's operations by recalling a conversation she had overheard weeks prior.

Goals

growth

protection

legacy

acceptance

Plot

Vora finds out that a senior member of the Cloaks of Coercion is secretly plotting against her and her family group. She must decide whether to confront them head-on or try to find a more diplomatic solution.

Vora discovers information about a potentially lucrative heist that could greatly benefit the guild. However, the job poses a significant risk, and Vora must weigh the potential rewards against the chance of getting caught.

A new member joins Vora's family group, but they struggle to assimilate into the dynamic. Vora must act as a mediator and try to bring the new member up to speed while keeping the group's morale high.

Vora's past as an outsider comes back to haunt her when a group of local bullies target her and her family group. Vora must find a way to protect both her physical safety and her reputation within the guild.

Secret

she is related to another member

Brone Langworth: Wolfe respects Brone's quiet determination and follows his lead at The Timbermen Guild.

Bryson Villius: Wolfe admires Bryson's wisdom and reliability, and looks up to him as a mentor.

Cecily Atwood: Wolfe's youngest daughter is kind-hearted and sensitive, and he is fiercely protective of her.

Dowd Langworth: Wolfe has a professional relationship with Dowd and respects his ambition and hard work.

Dunla Villius: Wolfe appreciates Dunla's gentle and wise nature and often seeks her advice.

Gale Atwood: Wolfe's sister is sassy and confident, and they have a playful sibling dynamic.

Kearey Voyle: Wolfe sees potential in Kearey's rebellious nature and encourages her to pursue her dreams of becoming a scholar.

Kelsey Atwood: Wolfe's cousin is resourceful and independent, and they have a respectful professional relationship at The Timbermen Guild.

Malek Langworth: Wolfe worries about Malek's impulsiveness but sees potential in the young boy.

Morna Atwood: Wolfe loves and respects his grandmother, who is wise and caring. She is a constant source of comfort for him.

Orla Atwood: Wolfe's daughter is artistic and dreamy, traits that he admires but sometimes struggles to understand.

Orla Langworth: Wolfe finds Orla's curiosity and playfulness refreshing, and enjoys teaching her new skills at The Timbermen Guild.

Shay Langworth: Wolfe respects Shay's hard work and nurturing nature, and they have a good working relationship.

Stianna Atwood: Wolfe's great-granddaughter is mischievous and energetic, and he enjoys spending time with her.

Wyatt Langworth: Wolfe finds Wyatt's bashfulness endearing and enjoys teaching him new skills at The Timbermen Guild.

Anecdotes

Once, a young apprentice at The Timbermen Guild challenged Wolfe to a wood-chopping contest. Needless to say, Wolfe won by a landslide.

Wolfe once caught his oldest son sneaking out of the house late at night. Instead of scolding him, Wolfe took him out to the forest and taught him survival skills.

Goals

protect

provide

family

legacy

Plot

Wolfe's past may come back to haunt him when a stranger comes to Luminia looking for revenge.

Wolfe's eldest child goes missing in the ancient forest and he must rally the village to find them.

The Timbermen Guild is struggling and Wolfe must decide whether to stay loyal to the guild or join a new cooperative that offers better pay and benefits.

Wolfe discovers a family secret that shakes the foundation of his beliefs and must confront his own biases and prejudices.

Secret

He killed a man in self-defense when he was younger

wyn'Talyththi Coralaeth

"Diplomacy is the key to success."

A beautiful and intelligent woman with good taste.

  • Age: 70
  • Age look: adult
  • Beauty: very pretty
  • Clothes: flowy blue dress, silver jewelry
  • Eyes: green
  • Gender: female
  • Generation: mid
  • Habits: Wyn'Talyththi is a disciplined individual who values punctuality and organization. She starts her day early by taking a walk in the forest to clear her mind before heading to work at The Sole Savers. She takes pride in her appearance and always dresses elegantly in flowy blue dresses and silver jewelry. Wynnie also enjoys cooking and often invites her colleagues and friends over for dinner parties.

  • Height: tall

Group

Group Name: Coralaeth family

key_figure: no

rank: member

relationship: Respected by her family, admired by the village.

situation: eldest daughter

family_name: Coralaeth family

Job

Workplace: The Sole Savers

description: A beautiful and intelligent woman with good taste.

fullname: wyn'Talyththi Coralaeth

job: shoemaker

key_figure: yes

nickname: The Sole Whisperer

quote: "Good shoes should be worn with pride."

rank: boss

relations: Mentors Durgan, appreciates his enthusiasm

skill level: master

working_clothes: elegant dress with an embroidered leather apron

workplace: The Sole Savers

Relationship

Bixler Voyle: As the eldest son of the family, Bixler is protective of his sister wyn'Talyththi and often helps her out at The Sole Savers. They share a love for adventure and often go on hikes in the forest together.

Boren Voyle: wyn'Talyththi's father Boren is a respected figure in the village, and she values his opinion greatly. He is always there to offer advice and support when needed.

Durgan Vain: As an apprentice at The Sole Savers, Durgan looks up to wyn'Talyththi as a boss and mentor. She often goes out of her way to provide him with opportunities to learn and grow as a shoemaker.

Enda Voyle: wyn'Talyththi's grandmother Enda is a wise old woman with vast life experience. She has taught wyn'Talyththi much about the history and mythology of Luminia, and she continues to be a source of inspiration for her.

Erris Voyle: wyn'Talyththi has a close relationship with her mother Erris, who she looks up to as a role model. They often have long conversations about the history and mythology of Luminia.

Garrett Voyle: wyn'Talyththi's grandfather Garrett is a quiet and reserved man, but she has always respected his wisdom and observations. He provides a different perspective on the world that she finds valuable.

Kearey Voyle: wyn'Talyththi's younger sister Kearey is rebellious and headstrong, but they share a close bond. Despite their differences, wyn'Talyththi supports Kearey's dreams of becoming a scholar.

Anecdotes

Wynnie once settled a dispute between two rival guilds with her diplomatic skills.

She once discovered an ancient artifact while exploring the forest and donated it to the local scholars.

Wyn'Talyththi is known for her exquisite taste in fashion and often designs her own dresses.

Goals

expand business

learn new skills

provide for family

uncover village mysteries

Plot

Wyn'Talyththi's business has been flourishing, but she wants to expand it even further. She is considering opening up a second shop in a neighboring village, but she needs to convince her colleagues and family that it's a good idea.

While exploring the forest, wyn'Talyththi stumbles upon a hidden cave that contains a clue to the village's forgotten past. She sets out on a quest to uncover the truth behind the mysteries that surround their community.

One of her colleagues at The Sole Savers is secretly sabotaging the business. Wyn'Talyththi must figure out who it is before it's too late and their livelihood is destroyed.

Secret

None
